Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen_watkins_84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania for 9 nights and could not have asked for a better experience. Our room was absolutely gorgeous, generously sized and especially clean. We faced the construction site and do not have any complaints about noise from the construction site. We found NYC to be quite noisy however this was not at all a problem during our stay at Ameritania. The hotel is perfectly located...in between Times Square and Central Park, as well as subway stations and eating facilities. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help us wherever possible. Special mention must be made to Jose who went out of his way to make sure we experienced NY properly and his friendly nature made us feel welcome at all times, nothing was ever too much for him. Would definitley return to Ameritania in the future an recommend to others. Thank-you so much Jose and the rest of the Ameritania team.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizwall
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever. From the moment we first arrive nothing but a great experience. From the concierge to the front desk. The price is great for the location. The people are always friendly and willing to help. Every time I come to the city this is where I will always stay. I love it and highly recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Annika E
Reviews.Content: We were totally satisfied with everything during our stay for three nights.

Reviews.Title: “a good location in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: fernando s
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well located if you plan to enjoy the broadway attractions...a bit pretentious but overall OK. Please be sure to get the free wi-fi, in my case when booking it was included, upon arrival the front desk lady said that it was not, I showed my printed internet reservation bearing all those details, and so she had to provide me with the service for free! Breakfst not good, better take it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room; Not Ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: PBenjung
Reviews.Content: As someone who had prepaid this stay months ago, I was pleased to see reviews of this hotel recently improve. Unfortunately the renovation is not yet complete and the hotel is not up to par. Issues we've had 2 days into a 4 day stay: 1. Lobby construction - still ongoing. We had trouble hearing each other in the lobby when we checked in at 3 pm March 21. 2. Tiny room -we asked for a room away from the large construction site across the street. We were warned interior facing rooms are small but there was NO closet, only a tiny 2 drawer dresser about 2ft high. I have stayed in hotels around the world but never saw a room without a hanger! 3. One bath towel. Had to call down for a second one. 4. Safety issue- a large 5' x 7' wall mirror is leaning against our wall. Seems that someone forgot to install it. Hope it doesn't fall onto our bed and crush my skull. (our family staying in another room have the same problem.) 5. Double Booked the room - just now a man tried to get into my room. He showed me his keycard which had my room number. The front desk called to apologize and said the man had misread his number. Not true. I read it myself. So despite the recent good reviews I cannot recommend this hotel. There are many other better hotels to choose from in the area

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: westycoast
Reviews.Content: Wow, talk about about a bad experience. Our room (311) had no curtains, just a set of slatted blinds. Directly across the street is a building under construction with very bright lights that shine all night long. So our room was well lit for the entire night. Our the window consisted of just a single pane of glass, so all of the noises outside were clearly audible in the room. Honking horns, police sirens. We also learned that the hotel adjoins a nightclub that closes and discharges hundreds of patrons between 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. The night of our stay, the patrons were in no mood to go home so partied in the street just outside our window until dawn. What with the bright lights and incessant street noise, we got almost no sleep and felt as if we had bunked down in the middle of Times Square. The hotel's dining room is mostly used for storage, so the complimentary breakfast is served in the trendy lobby, where people try to balance food on their laps. When we left, we bid a very fond farewell to the Ameritania, fond because we were so happy to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good night in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DSK3some
Reviews.Content: We (2 adult, 1 child) stayed at Ameritania one night. The room was good sized esp. for NYC. Furnishings were new and very nice. Location was great in midtown. Could not beat the price. Would definatley use this spot again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Go Back”
Reviews.Author: WENR0D
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor reviews on the Ameritania convinced us that this was a pretty safe bet for high value lodging in Manhattan. We were not disappointed. It was our first stay in Manhattan and we planned to be typical tourists during our 3 night stay. Location was ideal for the one Broadway show we planned (Jersey Boys) and the last minute decision to see another show (Once). “Jersey Boys” was an easy quick walk (maybe 8 minutes) and “Once” was about 15 minutes however, the sidewalks were were VERY congested (St Patrick's Day!). Lot's of eateries nearby & a Starbucks is 60 seconds from the front door. We intended to at least get a glimpse of the St Patrick's Day Parade, and we managed to do just that...about 10 minutes on foot brought us to a decent vantage point along the route on the southernmost edge of Central Park on 5th Avenue. Our first impression of the Hotel lobby was very good. It smelled great (really!), appeared scrupulously clean and the desk help was great. Friendly, helpful, cheerful folks seemed eager to please. We asked for a room away from the construction you've read about it in other reviews and they accommodated BUT the downside of facing away from the construction was an uninteresting view of exterior walls of the hotel; I would have loved a great city view but quiet was more important. The room was exactly the way it looked in their website photos... appeared updated, no wear & tear of any significance and again- clean, clean, clean. The room was on the small side but adequate. The bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable …. some of the best we've experienced. The bathroom was very nice with a walk-in full ceramic shower, a “rain” shower head and a hand held shower. You may have read some squawks about the elevators; they did seem a wee bit slow at times but otherwise, previously mentioned problems seemed to have been cleared up. It's just a few amenities short of 5 stars... lavatories off the lobby, perkier elevators and a slightly larger room would have probably done the trick. All things considered, we consider the Ameritania a very good value and we are happy to recommend it. If we overnight in Manhattan again, we'll certainly consider a return engagement.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, quite location though”
Reviews.Author: gatesy150
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Alot of building work going on around the area, so can be get quite loud at times ! Place is slowly being updated, have done a nice job in the downstairs lobby, just some of the rooms need doing now. Quite a good area to be in though, near to central park for a nice walk, near quite a few shops, bars, restaurants etc. Check out the bar over the road called "Characters" - they do all types of food, very tasty. I went there 4 times in the 7 days I was there ! As I say though this place is ok, not top quality, but ok. If you are like me and are out and about most of the day and night then its only a place to sleep, so it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Doing a great job with their upgrade”
Reviews.Author: chipsbird
Reviews.Content: had a really nice stay in a lovely room last weekend. the room was spacious, attractive, well-laid out and immaculate. the hotel seems to be making great strides in upgrading the rooms, lobby, bar area, etc. lots of construction on-going across the road so some noise-blocking windows on the street-side would be a big help. staff helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Jodiejones
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last year it is in such an amazing location a very short walk from times square. Great hotel and the staff were very friendly. Cant wait to visit again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrafter
Reviews.Content: Other reviews said noise was an issue, but we did not have that problem. We were in room 722 and heard no street or construction sounds. Everything was very clean. Only issue was a light bulb not being replacd after a request. The price we paid was well below surrounding hotels and made for a great value. Loved the shower. Comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & staff”
Reviews.Author: bob f
Reviews.Content: From the time that my group of 8 checked into the hotel on Friday Feb 24th we found all of the staff that we dealt with to be very helpful and friendly.In particular it was nice to talk with members of the staff who all always took the opportunity to introduce themselves (Adam and Susan are the only two names I can recall) and shake hands. I definitely had the feeling that all the staff members appreciated our business. All of the rooms for my group were very clean and comfortable. We had the need to arrange for transportation to JFK for some of the members of my group and this was handled by the friendly bell staff. When the first group went to JFK they used a credit card to pay the driver and were charged an extra $5 for use of a credit card. On mentioning this to the bellman and after verifying the charge with the car service company, he advised that we would not be charged a credit card fee if we pre-payed the car service fee through the hotel which we did. The hotel location is excellent. It is centrally located for visiting all the tourist areas and is an easy walk to times square, the theater district, St Patricks Cathedral Rockefeller center and Central Park. The 2 elevators are not sufficient to handle all the guests especially during peak time; however, I was informed that a third elevator would soon be put in service. As there are a ton of restaurants and cafes in NY, we did not partake of the continental breakfast. We did not experience and discomfort as a result of the construction across the street from the hotel. I would definitley stay at this hotel again when I visit New York and will not hesitate to recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay un NYC”
Reviews.Author: Robyluc74
Reviews.Content: It is a in good location and most important the room was clean with a clean bathroom. Had some issue with a window that did not close but mantainance took care of it. TV was not working but just needed to move the cables around in the back of it.

Reviews.Title: “Too many flaws”
Reviews.Author: icyoubaby
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at the Ameritana. Firstly there is crazy construction across the street so it was a very very noisy stay. I also did not have hot water in my room! Completely unacceptable for a NY hotel! I literally had to let the taps run for at least 5minutes before it got hot! The cleanliness of my towels was also very questionable. The hallways definitely need to be vacuumed! The room however was large in comparison to other NY hotels! I would definitely chose a different hotel for my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Major construction across the street”
Reviews.Author: Clayton14
Reviews.Content: While we agree with other recent reviewers that the hotel is clean and the staff friendly and helpful, it is hard to believe no one has mentioned the buildings going up just across the street. If you don't sleep or care about quiet after 7am, then you should be okay. I had a hard time getting used to the bed, and the pillows were atrocious springy things that were more akin to balloons (providing lots of support if you want to sit propped-up, but awful for resting one's head) and would have liked to have slept a bit longer once asleep. Unfortunately, I was awoken by the very loud construction noise just after 7am. Because the location is otherwise good and the hotel does many things right some may still find the hotel works for them and is a good value. I did not, and wish very much I had been informed as to the real reson for the low room rates and last minute availability.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Gary57K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find for my wife and I. Great location, very clean, very friendly staff. The rooms are basic - not huge - but roomy enough. Bed was very comfortable, we slept great. The front desk and doormen were extremely helpful and very friendly. The bar area was nice and quaint, the bartenders were very friendly as well. The continental breakfast we found to be exceptional - a good start to the day. When we needed any vouchers, passes, or tickets printed the front desk personnel were always great to help out. The elevators were a bit slow, only 2, but I guess to be expected. But that was about the only downside that we experienced. We will definitely stay there again when we visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in NYC-and amazing price!!”
Reviews.Author: JuneCny
Reviews.Content: All I can say is WOW-place was beautiful and all brand new. We booked last minute and got a GREAT price. A quick walk to Times Square-Broadway and shopping. This is our new place to stay when we visit NYC! Movrad was wonderful!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “No Water?!”
Reviews.Author: lZZZl
Reviews.Content: So I arranged my parents to come to this hotel to have a affordable nice stay for a night, but they came back telling me there was no water during their stay. They couldn't take a shower, flush the toilet, couldn't even brush their teeth because of no water. I was disappointed, I wanted to make their visiting to new york to go as smoothly as possible. The hotel staff should've made an announcement about the time when the water would be off, so that they could prepare themselves for it. Other than the issue of not having water, overall, I heard that the interior decorations looked nice and the place was clean. From what I see from the photos they took it was a decent looking room for the price of $115. (date visited: February 21 - 22, 2012)

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise with beautiful modern decor throughout the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bankizy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great overall. The lobby was beautiful. It smelled great and very clean when you walked in. Staff was friendly, especially the bell men and bartender. The room was beautiful but a bit too small. The location was perfect as well. It should be a 4 star hotel instead of 3.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dana A
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical to come to the city due to my lack of knowledge with the sites and tourist spots. However, during my stay here my concerns were lifted. My husband and I asked an employee, Hugo, to help us find some good tourist spots that weren't your normal go to places. I think the best part about his suggestions were that the places weren't just in Manhatten. We visited places in Brooklyn and Queens as well. He recommended a few places that we loved and all together our visit was great. The rooms were farely small but very affordable and Emerald at the front desk was very nice and made us feel very at home and comfortable. Can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “A PLEASANT SURPRISE FOR MIDTOWN MANHATTAN”
Reviews.Author: Elaine R
Reviews.Content: I purchased the hotel on Groupon for an overnite stay. Was very pleased with the hotel and would go there again without using a Grouponl The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was comfortable and clean. The location is great. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were very nice. The room was quiet. We had the King deluxe and were very satisfied with our overall stay at the hotel. Would recommend it to others. Good value for the accommodations. My daughter is staying there and I told her she would be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In The Heart Of New York”
Reviews.Author: BruceH09
Reviews.Content: A business trip - fantastic rooms, great location, great staff. I will be bringing my wife back to here because of the experience. Internet at $10 for 24 hours added up after a few days but with Free wifi in coffee shops and restaurants within very short walking distance - all was good. A GREAT hotel that I will be going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good value, Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: lecknox
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. I agree with a previous reviewer that the doormen were the highlight of Customer Service!! AWESOME!! Room was newly decorated, the mirror was huge! Bed was very comfy, and pillows very fluffy. I would appreciate one thinner down pillow as an alternative. I liked the closet and the safe, but please put the light back in. (10th floor, room on the end) I love the fact the hotel is nonsmoking. However, in my room on the 10th floor, especially in the bathroom, I could smell the cigarettes of folks smoking down below in the alley. Shutting the bathroom door helped keep it out of the room, but if its caused by hotel employees going out for a break, then management should look into an alternative solution. (downdraft ashtrays perhaps?) Location of this hotel is excellent. Subway stations within two -three blocks. Central Park less than 5 minute walk, excellent food in the neighborhood, at a variety of price ranges. I am certain that the staff and patrons look forward to the day that the construction across the street is completed. (Good thing is that work stops at night.) I enjoyed my stay, and would most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy NYC from 54th and Broadway for under $150!”
Reviews.Author: Shopnome
Reviews.Content: Ameritania at Times Square Husband and I stayed here for 3 days in Renovated Standard Guestroom 819. Would recommend. Details: Doormen were the highlight of Customer Service at the hotel. Quick to smile, grab bags, open doors, crack a joke, and offer bag storage. Front desk was not so friendly. However, it was not so bad that I would not send my mother here. My grandma could not stay here as it is not wheelchair accessible. We did enjoy drinks at the never busy Twist lounge before going out for dinner, $10 and up is standard for the area. The room and lobby all make great backdrops for photo ops. I had a hard time getting my husband out of the duel head shower. A few things they have listed are not offered or were not in-room: No CD player No blackout curtains No 24 hour kinko's or front desk business services By the end of the day I was so tired I didn't need the backout curtains and the building out the window blocks the sun pretty well. However, I didn't bring my laptop because of the business services and nearby kinko's - neither of which are offered or open 24 hours. Overall I would stay here again if offered at the same great price I got this time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New York stay & Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: This was our second vacation & trip to The Big Apple New York & this is the very best Hotel stay we had. Upon arrival on our first day we were greated by the excellent staff who knew our names and informed us of the automatic upgrade for our Anniversary stay by Sylvia. The room was beautilful & we had two excellent views. The staff was So friendly, helpful & professional, including the doormen. The front desk staff was excellent as well. Emerald was one who called us by name & referenced us as one of her special guest. The bar was beautiful, so romantic & the Fireplace was an extra added amenity. The lobby was red, black & white & a beautiful spot to take nice pictures. We recommend this to you & any others visiting New York. Everything is in close proximity. The hotel is around the corner from the Ed Sullivan Theater, 6 blocks from Central park & the Time Warner building. It is also only 8 blocks from Time Square. Everything is close to walk to even in the cold. I highly recommend this for your stay. THANKS TO ALL THE STAFF & HOTEL FOR SUCH A WONDERFUL MEMORABLE STAY. WE WILL BE BACK AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated.”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl007
Reviews.Content: We thought we'd check this hotel out when they advertised a voucher. I give it a 3+ rating but Trip advisor didn't give me that option. Its newly renovated & the lobby is pretty cool, lots of silver. The rooms are pretty cool too. Lots of construction going on across the street. The bed was very comfy. We enjoyed drinks at the bar & the bartender was very friendly. The "breakfast" was pretty lame, just continental stuff. We don't like to eat pastry for breakfast, so we went elsewhere. We called when we were a few blocks away to ask about parking & were given vague directions to the parking garage, so we parked in the wrong garage which cost us more money. I explained this to the person at the desk & I was informed they told me the streets it was between, however if you aren't familiar with the street & you are driving down a one way street, it would have been more helpful to say something like, "not the one before Golds Gym, but the one after." When I got home I received an emailed invoice & noticed we were charged for a breakfast we didn't eat. They removed the charge. They have some customer service issues. Great location & kind of funky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Boutique Hotel In Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first ever trip to NYC in December (and again in January). Both times I booked online through the website for less than $210 AFTER taxes (I think the rates are going up as the Construction finishes). The location was great - very convenient to Central Park, Times Square, etc. The hotel is in the process of being completely overhauled but the construction is almost done. The lobby is modern and clean - and so are the rooms. The front desk staff was nice and accommodating. I arrived early (10:30) but they took my cell phone number, held my bags, and called me at 1:30 to say my room was ready (check in was at 3:00 pm). The room was small, but clean. The beds seemed brand new (no sign of wear and tear or bedbugs). Depending on what side your room faces it can be noisy as there is construction going on the north side of 54th. It is loud, but this is NYC. I didn't really expect to get a quiet hotel and was very impressed with the Ameritania given how little I paid. The bathrooms are small, but clean and new. The rain shower is nice, but something to note, the shower is open concept and doesn't have a door. I see in some other reviews that bugged some people. I snuck up to the roof and it looks like there are in the process building a rooftop deck area to hang out at. I was surprised it was accessible since it looked a little dangerous (mid construction) - so if you have kids or teens, and they are feeling mischievous, be warned. That evening before going out, grabbed a drink at the bar in the lobby. Drinks were surprisingly cheap (I'm going off Chicago prices) and strong and the bartender was nice. Checkout the next day was seamless. Another HUGE plus for the Ameritania was that I paid for my room on a debit card and they didn't put a massive hold on my card like some hotels and I wasn't charged until I arrived at the hotel, no reservation fee ahead of time. I stayed at Ameritania again in January after my great first experience. This time I arrived early again (10:30) and was told my room was ready right away, the desk staff thanked me for coming back to the hotel and upgraded me to a deluxe size room with a King bed. Again the construction across the street was loud during the day, but I was out and about so it wasn't a big deal to me and I sleep with ear plugs. If the price remains low - I will continue to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: stillred51
Reviews.Content: We were given a night at the Ameritania as a gift and added a night to make a weekend of it. We live outside of Manhattan, but often spend a weekend in the city as a quick and easy getaway. This hotel was fabulous!! What a pleasant surprise! Location was perfect, right in midtown near all the theaters. The hotel itself is a gem. We were upgraded to a deluxe king room, a corner with windows on both sides and lots of room to walk around. Although the bathroom is a little small, it is beautifully appointed and the shower is modern and roomy. The decor is modern and sleek, and the staff was friendly and accommodating. A light continental breakfast was included, which was a nice start to the day. The room was a bit noisy during the week, as there is construction going on around the corner, but that's not unusual in NYC. We would definitely go back and would recommend it without reservation (no pun intended!).

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: I just spend two nights at the Ameritania after finding a deal through Groupon. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and both the lobby and our room were nicely updated with very modern finishes. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. And my more worldy traveling companion kept marveling over the relative spaciousness of the room. We did have a hiccup along the way when our floor lost power for a few hours, but the situation was addressed. My only issue was how dim the room was, but other than that I loved it. I would absolutely recommend the hotel, especially if you can find a deal on it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Midtown Option”
Reviews.Author: EastCoaster36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ameritania Hotel for one day during the 2011 Christmas holiday. We got a good rate at the hotel, and while we did have some criticisms, I would say that the value was overall pretty good for that very busy week in very busy NYC midtown. A few notes I would share: â€¢ The elevators were somewhat iffy. Stalling and stopping in a way that made us uneasy and opt for the stairs. I think they were soon to be refurbished â€“ and we would suggest this would very much be a priority. â€¢ The lobby was quite nice, and the bar was small and cozy â€“ it was a good place to get a drink before heading out for the evening. â€¢ Our shower was actually pretty cool â€“ no door - just a large space so water fell on half the room. It had a nice contemporary feel to it. Similarly while the bones of the hotel were quite old, the furnishings, decor and electronics are all brand new. â€¢ The construction noise across the street was really pretty bad â€“ as noted by other posters. We were awakened quite early by the work itself and the radios of the construction crews. â€¢ The last name on our reservation had been spelled incorrectly by the hotel booking agent. While it got sorted out â€“ the gentlemen behind the desk was very quick to tell us that WE had made the mistake and did not have a reservation. It was not the warmest of welcomes.

Reviews.Title: “Most unfriendly people i've ever met”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: The front desk workers were extremely unfrinedly. There's one guy there who gives attitude to simple questions. I was also charged $34 a week after check out and called to find out what it was for and he said my living social deal didn't include taxes and hung up. Thanks for your over friendliness!!!! Room was not bad, elevators were pretty slow. Would have been nice if they gave us early check in like our living social coupon said we would get...instead we waited until 3:30pm only to receive more attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Time Square. Great Price and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hosam E
Reviews.Content: Currently the hotel is still under renovation, but most rooms and the lobby are already finished and the result is great. I reserved a calm room and got a calm, stylish room with two king size beds. Breakfast was ok (variety of bread, marmelade, fruits, but plastic plates), but i was told that the restaurant will be finished soon. Same about the elevator and concierge service. Not perfect yet, but a solid base and surely they are going to work out the last 15 % to be a perfect hotel. Really a great stay and the location is nearby many famous attractions: Time Square, Broadway Theatres, Grand Central Park and Station, Rockefeller Centre, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location , location!”
Reviews.Author: IdaSweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Ameritania in November 2011. This was my second time at this hotel and its really all you can ask for. The location is perfect, the bathroom is spotless clean, comfy beds and perfect housekeeping, I belive this one is the best value of all the hotel on broadway we looked at! I had requested a bottle of wine in the room as a suprise for my boyfriend and they ha made it so nice for us at our arrival with a letter wishing us happy annversiary and a rose. There is good and cheap breakfast cafe, and a Starbucks just across the street so no need for continental breakfast at the hotel. There was some construction work going on, but no nois. The AC is a bit loud and disturbing, and theres no restroom in the lobby. But thats the only two downs, and its no big problem. I can recomend this hotel, and next time I go to NYC I will defentely stay at the Ameritiana!

Reviews.Title: “Recently remodeled, but much left to do in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: pstempe
Reviews.Content: The decor is nice, but there were many problems with the two rooms we had. For one, the window came out in my hands and I almost dropped it out and eight floors down. When I told them at the front desk they said "Well I don't think you are supposed to open the windows." In my opinion, if the windows aren't to be used they should be screwed shut or at the very least labeled as such. Also, the shower leaked water all over the bathroom floor and there was nothing I could do about it. My travel companion had the same issue with the bathroom and a window in his room, as well. He also found bugs in his bed and was transferred to another room. Here he sat in the desk chair and flipped over backwards. No apologies were made for any of these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Christina C
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was amazing! While in NY my phone quit working. I had a very important meeting I needed to be able to access some information in my email. Renaldo at the front desk was very helpful. He printed out my emails and saved the day! The door men were wonderful to help with information and directions. The room was beautiful - I would definitely stay at the Ameritania again! Only downside is there was no fridge or microwave!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lauren-ashlee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend from 28th December until 2nd January. Since the refurbishment it looks amazing. The rooms resembled those in a boutique hotel and the bed was so comfy! The staff at reception are so helpful and will go out of their way to help you. When we arrived our room was straight across the road from the building work which was very loud. I informed reception straight away and they moved our rooms quickly and easily. The room we moved into was tiny with no wardrobe or space for our suitcases so we were stepping over them constantly. Aside from this, the room was gorgeous and clean and had an amazing power shower! The hotel is in a perfect location, just a walk to times square, central park and 5th avenue. We were made up to be spending new year here and will definitely stay here again when we return to New York! A hotel in a great location, clean, well presented and with friendly staff is hard to find in a big city but I felt that this one really ticked the boxes. Looking forward to returning again in a few years after we have saved up more money to shop again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: Leelee63
Reviews.Content: Hotels in New York are always quite expensive, but this chic boutique hotel is in an excellent location on the corner of West 54th Street and Broadway, only 3 blocks south of Central Park, and 3 blocks west of 5th Avenue (love those shops!). And of course, if you're in town to see a show or 2, it all happens just around the corner. The hotel has been beautifully decorated, and our room (although quite small) had the most gorgeous soft bed, big fluffy pillows, and a very chic bathroom. We could regulate the heat ourselves and we were 'toasty warm' given that we stayed there in December. We were also pleased that apart from the occassional police siren, the noise inside the room at night was minimal. The hotel does offer breakfast for $10 per person, and although it was satisfying on our first morning, we ventured out to other establishments on subsequent mornings, where the menu range and value was better. All in all, this is a great hotel, extremely well located with friendly, helpful staff, and it has a really nice homely feeling to it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Pawe S
Reviews.Content: I'm quite disappointed in my stay at Ameritania Hotel. I have reserved a "RENOVATED Deluxe King" for one night, but upon arrival I was told that only rooms with two double size beds were available. The concierge gave an excuse that, thatâ€™s best described as a load of horseâ€¦. She blamed the reservation system, but she had all information about my reservation and I have received a confirmation of the reservation directly from the hotel. I'm 6'5" and I can not comfortable sleep in a double bed. After an argument the concierge gave me another option â€“ a smaller room with a queen size bed. I agreed to check into this room, but as soon as we entered the room we discovered that was a mistake. The room had literally two to three feet of space around the bed and no space to store our bags or even hang our coats. The door to the room did not close properly, allowing the noise from the corridor to freely enter the room. The room was located on the top floor near the stairway. Anytime anyone closed the door to the stair we heard a loud bang. About 8 am on Sunday, someone started shoveling snow and breaking ice from the roof directly above out room making it impossible to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jlhanaen007
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in elevatofor 20 minuend...aimed like an hour... it dropped a little and my girlfriend... Luckily had cell phone or who knows how long we would have been trapped. Elevator and alarm didn't work either.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Joey_V86
Reviews.Content: First off, great location, especially for the price. Literally right around the corner from Ed Sullivan Theater where they film Letterman, about 2 blocks up from Times Square, 5 blocks from Central Park, and right in the middle of the Theater District. The staff was extremely helpful during our weekend stay, ranging from helping us make dinner decisions, to printing out our boarding passes before we left for the airport. The rooms were small, but from what I've heard all the reasonably priced rooms in NYC are small. They were also quite nice, and I would definitely be ready and willing to book a room there again should I travel through the Big Apple any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations by staff”
Reviews.Author: Silvia R
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of being checked in by Renaldo Moore. I remember his name because he was well spoken and very professional. He definetly reflected the fine quality and professionalism of how Ameritania presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: The staff knew that customer service was a mind set. NYC can be a bit confusing if you're not there often, but Erin and Renaldo did a great job steering my party in the right direction. They looked for the chance to provide service to us. The room was small, but the bed was big and comfy, and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: aminay
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel over Christmas on a last minute decision to spend the weekend in NYC. Initially we were not sure what to expect but immediately after walking into the lobby it began to exceed our expectations - particularly with the very affordable price paid (thanks TravelZoo). Our room was ready early and unlike many other rooms in NYC, it was quite roomy. The lobby and room were both designed well (can someone tell me who designed the petal-like clock in the rooms?). The bed was very comfortable and perhaps b/c it was a holiday we were not awakened by any noise (i.e. from construction). As others have suggested, the view is pretty much nonexistent but hey you are in NYC - get out of your room! The location was ideal and even having a small bar in the lobby was a nice perk. Breakfast was nothing fabulous but better than nothing. I'm sure when renovations are complete ratings will improve further. Thank you for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel! Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Adele E
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in November 2011. From our fist day we loved it. After arriving on the first flight from San Fran we went straight to the hotel. We arrived around 9am and expected to put our bags somewhere and come back after checkin time. We were more than pleased when the reception told us our rooms were ready immediately and we could check straight in! We were very happy with the room they gave us - very modern and clean. I have a thing about bathrooms and the one in our room was great, super clean and such an awesome shower. Our beds were comfy and our rooms were cleaned every day to perfection. Our room was a decent size (for New York standards) - we had two double beds and there was space to put our luggage etc. The hotel location itself was perfect for us. It was close to Central Park and walking distance to Broadway, 5th Av, the art galleries. I really couldn't recommend this hotel enough. We booked very last minute and weren't expecting the quality that we got for the price we paid. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Christina F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, in a great spot in the city and had very accomodating staff. Mario, a doorman, made sure everything was ready in our room and took our bags up for us. When we had questions about the city, he was very informative and always suggested great places to eat. The only negative was the size of the room. The room was very small but the bathroom was huge and newly renovated. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: carolnorm
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week over new year On arrivral we were very pleased with our room very clean and modern. The bathroom was brand new and the shower was the best we've ever used . the beds are comfortable maybe a bit too soft.The beds are made every day the towels changed whenever required the staff always polite and friendly. The only downfall which is no fault of the hotel is the building work opposite the hotel front which caused some disturbance but as we were out all day we were'nt troubled too much. noise levels during the night were loud the room could do with better double glazing. Couldnt wish for a better location sat on the corner of broadway with central park just a few minutes walk away and times square the same. Also within a short walking distance some very reasonably priced eating establishments would definitly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel building site”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: Great location terrible hotel stayed for the new year lifts constantly full .Stayed on the 12th floor room not ready when we arrived. Room small could hardly walk around the bed. Huge mirror stuck on the floor kept tripping over it. Stairways wires stIcking out, sockets off wall, Insisted on taking 30 dollars off credit card daily for incidentals and were told it would be refunded. When we booked out receptionist was rude and when i asked for a receipt for refund I, was told i was charged for a phone call down to reception, when i answered that i phoned down to reception because we had no towels left in the room, then she shrugged her shoulders. Disappointing the positive was helpful doorman named Jeffrey.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent location and very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Tjoklat
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for one week in Ameritania during Xmasholiday. I loved the interior design which is really extraordinary! Beds are great, and sheets and bathroom crisp clean! The staff is very friendly, especially the doorman, Mourad was very helpfull! We took great benefit of the excellent location, no need to go by subway, we could visit every highlight just wandering around!

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bexbees
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 3 nights on our maiden visit to NYC from Toronto and this hotel was one of the best parts of our stay. The location is unbeatable, everything to love about Manhattan is literally at the doorstep. The staff were super amazing, checked us in at 8am when we arrived even though check-in is not until 3pm! They helped us with any and all questions we had too. Rooms were really clean, modern and the beds! Ooooooo the beds! So comfy, we had a hard time getting out of them in the morning! Great showers, water pressure etc. You can't go wrong with this place. We go an excellent deal on expedia and for the price the Ameritania could not be beat. Tip to tourists, buy your souvenirs in Chinatown!! Much cheaper and much more variety!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wandersons
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of a Groupon discount, but would be happy to return. We stayed there Christmas weekend 2011. It's a GREAT Manhattan location. It's less than four blocks to Central Park. We were able to walk to two Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center and Times Square. Now the rooms are small. But the building was erected turn of last century and is next to the Ed Sullivan Theatre where David Letterman broadcasts. However, the beds were comfy, the staff was nice and a continental breakfast came with the package. Plus, there are historic (and good) sandwich shops like Carnegie Deli less than two blocks away. It seems a new group owns the property. The owners are renovating and I think we stayed in a renovated room. Recommend if you are coming to the city to see the sites. If you want the ritz book upper east or downtown. Here's a video summary of our trip featuring the hotel and where we ate. http://youtu.be/fA1Zo3wyo-g

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay right in the heart of the theater district”
Reviews.Author: IzoldaT
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise! We decided to stay here on a whim when LivingSocial had a coupon. And we are glad we did. The room was spacious and lovely Art Deco. The staff was helpful, generous, and congenial. The location is tremendous and the bar just off the lobby provided a delightful respite after a long day in the city. I recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to this hotel when visiting NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn D
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to NYC for shopping and plays and stay for 3 nights prior to New Year's Eve. With the support of a wonderful staff, we made the decision to stay through New Year's and what a great time. The staff couldn't help us enough to get theater tickets, dinner reservations and support and we, 2 women, checked off New Year's in NYC on their bucket list with a flair!!!! The rooms were clean, the beds so comfortable and the staff outstanding!!! The location couldn't be better to all parts of town.....thank you for a wonderful time.....can't wait to come back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fromhell1959
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania looks like a whole load of not much from the outside but once inside the gorgeous refurbed lobby - all reds and oranges and scented with something yummy - you know that a lot of time and effort (not to mention style) has gone into this reinvention. The building site opposite is unfortunate but they keep respectable hours and I never found my slumber unduly disturbed. Check in was a breeze and I was in my bijou but tastefully decorated room within minutes. Photos are included so take a peek. Helpful staff, efficient assistance from all and the perfect location all ensure that I will checking in again this year...especially if it comes up again on priceline.co.uk for circa Â£60 per night! Christmas sure came a little early this year for one solo traveller!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Araceli L
Reviews.Content: I've been in the Ameritania hotel on my hollidays. The satff was so friendly and it took care of everithing: luggage, information,.... Even they gave us a christmass postcard in our room! The hotel is clean, faschionable, very well situation,... I bet you'll enyoy a lot i it.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be coming back to NYC often!!”
Reviews.Author: Trish C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting NYC for the first time, and decided on this hotel because comparatively the price was cheaper to other hotels in the area. The lobby is very nice and modern looking. The rooms are a bit small, but seemed clean. The bathroom was tiny and hard to maneuver in. However, with the close proximity to Times Square and transport to all parts of the city the room did not matter much to us, we wouldn't be spending much time there anyway! We read in other reviews the continental breakfast was not worth the money, so we opted to go elsewhere for breakfast. This was fine because there are places close by (Starbucks for example). One gripe we had was that the elevators are really really slow. Over all we had a positive experience in NYC, especially since the doorman Mourad was extremely helpful and friendly; always giving us tips on places to go and how to get there. As old timers nervous about visiting NYC for the first time, this helped tremendously. We will be sure to stay at Ameritania the next time we are in town (which hopefully will be soon!) and suggest it to friends/family who are visiting NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms dramatically improved w refurb, rest of hotel not so much”
Reviews.Author: blf222
Reviews.Content: this is a 3-star hotel who just did a decent job of upgrading the rooms with a very nice refurbishment. The newly done rooms are stylish with nice furnishings and finishes. However ... the windows are still too thin, so they let in much ambient noise. The staff is certainly friendly, but they act like a 3-star place. The common areas are also not particularly special -- no major problems, just an average sort of place. Location is pretty great except for the massive building being built across the street (read, noise). All in all a good place to stay if you can book a cheap rate, but not one worth paying up for.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Amanda C
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ameritania from 20 to 23rd December 2011, to celebrate my husband s 50th birthday. We had read the mixed reviews but need not have worried; our stay was excellent. The room was spacious, clean and beds very comfy. The bathroom was fab. Staff were helpful and the location is perfect for seeing the city. We had a superb time and would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places”
Reviews.Author: Skibum9988
Reviews.Content: I go to the city every month or two. I would not go back here. The rooms were nice but the service and vibe was not. There is major noisy construction going on outside.

Reviews.Title: “Expedia Groupon Bait and Switch 6 am Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: Savyjam
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through Expedia's Groupon "one-day-only" deal and I got the worst hotel experience of my life. I was given the option to pay an $30 per night for a "delux" room. I could have paid a lower rate for the "standard" room but I wanted to be sure I got a half way decent room so I paid extra. I get to the hotel and I'm rudely told that the delux is not aavailable and I must take the standard room at the same rate that I paid for the delux room. The room was right in from of the very very very loud construction of the highrise right next to the hotel. Constrution stopped at 5 pm but then their alarm went off and beeped loudly for over an hour. Construction resumed at 6:20 am the next morning. Within an hour I was writing this review. The lights in the room only work after ushing the light swith serveral times but I could live with this for I could get some sleep. I contacted Expedia and they said that they are not responsible for the services that they sell through through site. What you get is totally up to the hotel itself. Thei Expedia name means nothing in terms of the integrity and reliablity of the hotel or service you recieve. I will never book an Expedia Groupon service again. Stick with your own judgment after reading several reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ournoni
Reviews.Content: Nice remodel. Lovely room. Nice front desk people. One of two elevators out of order for 2 days. No inspction sticker in other elevator. Continental breakfast for $10 ok, but no heat in this room either. Beds very good. Windows made to open, but will not stay open. Some reviews say noisy. We had room 816 and it was nice and quiet. Maid service mostly very good - forgot towels one day, but delivered them when I called. We booked stay as part of air & hotel deal and it was a great deal for the money. I have certainly paid more in NYC. Also, near subway, Central Park, Radio City. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NY in Dec”
Reviews.Author: Candy G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located for pretty much anywhere you want to go. The room and bathroom was spacioius, clean and reasonably priced considering the time of year. On the down side there is construction occuring accross the street and the hotel itself is undergoing remodeling. The service is very slow. We won't be staying here again. TIP: if you stay here, ask for a room facing Broadway as far away from the construction as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price point”
Reviews.Author: wtc92
Reviews.Content: The location is walking distance to Central park, Time Square, 5th Ave shopping, Rock Center and right next to Ed Sullivan Thearter (David Letterman) The "E" train subway stop from JFK is only one block away. The room was remolded with very funky decor and was comfy. We stayed here the day after the tree was light and room rates were high for the next 2nts but this place gave us great rates and we were thrilled to be near everything we wanted to see and do on our short visit. Its not a 5start hotel with all the extras but great for a place just to sleep. The staff was friendly, dont eat the breakfast uness it's comped (not worth the money).The only other negative was the very slow elevator but I will definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkledc
Reviews.Content: There was construction going on across the street, but they did not start early on Saturday morning; and even when they did, we hardly heard them. We were in a renovated Deluxe room on the 2nd floor, and the windows must be well sound-proofed. The hotel is very elegantly designed in a modified art-deco. The lobby is really quite beautiful, in a rough-aesthetic kind of way, and our room was clearly thoughtfully decorated, in a way that made it look and feel bigger than it really was. It would have been nice to have a refrigerator (e.g., minibar or plain fridge). We had our own coffee maker but if we hadn't, that would have been disappointing too. But the room really was pleasant to be in. My biggest complaint -- or almost-complaint -- concerns the bedding. I am extremely allergic to feathers and down. My wife saw the label on the blanket saying "at least 70% down" so we called the front desk for a replacement blanket. The receptionist talked to the manager and reported back to us that, according to the manager, none of the bedding was down. My wife told her about the label, and they backed off, and gave us woolen blankets. They were prompt and friendly, but had we taken their word for it, I would have suffered a bad asthma attack -- not a joke. We also noticed that one of the elevators was broken for most of our stay, As we were on the 2nd floor, this was not a problem. Despite these glitches, I found the hotel a delightful place to stay. And being on the corner of 54th and Broadway is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Olya J
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked into the Ameritania's sister hotel, The Moderne, a block north. Upon arrival, I was told my booked suite was being renovated and was not available and that I would have to go over to the Ameritania. From the moment I walked into the lobby, the bad experiences started: 1. the room rate a the Ameritania Hotel was 60% of that for a suite at the Moderne but they wouldn't credit me the difference; 2. when I got to my suite, I called Housekeeping but kept getting a busy signal. I called the Concierge, busy signal. Each button you press gave me a busy signal! So I dialed "0", got the front desk, and they told me that none of those buttons is functional. I asked for the sofa bed to be made up, as my cousin was arriving on a late flight from Canada. Half an hour later, still no sign of Housekeeping, so I called again, and......... no Housekeeper arrived. 3. in the meantime, I discovered that the safe in the room was non-functional as the batteries were DEAD. So I called the front desk AGAIN, and they sent someone up to change the batteries. I asked this gentleman to please send someone from Housekeeping up. Then I left for dinner because I was starving and couldn't wait any longer. Upon my return an hour later, the sofa bed was made up. 4. There is NO hotel binder or booklet with information about the hotel and its services. 5. There is NO ice machine on ANY floor. 6. The stairwells look like a bomb was dropped into them. Holes in the walls, steep staircase, broken off or non-existent handrails. I discovered this when I went looking for the non-existent ice. 7. There is construction across the street. We were woken up @ 4 AM when the work began each morning. 8. There is NO concierge to book reservations, give recommendations, NOTHING. 9. The front desk is VERY bad at giving recommendations. We asked for a recommendation for a restaurant that was moderately priced but casual, and were directed to one 5 blocks away. We were told it overlooked Central Park but there was NO view of Central Park- and we sat by the windows!!!!!!!! 10. When we asked room service to bring us ice in a glass because we wanted to drink some water, they brought a small bottle of generic water, no ice, and charged us $5.00!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 11. There is NO restaurant in the hotel, just a lobby bar. 12. We went shopping on our third day there. Upon our return at 4 PM, one of the two elevators was out of service. We showered, changed, dressed and went out to a holiday function dressed in long gowns and stilettos. Upon our return, BOTH elevators were out of service and we were told we had to walk up that dingy, steep stairwell to our TWELFTH FLOOR room. 13. The next morning it was time to check out. The elevators had not been looked at and were BOTH non-functional. We were told there is NO service elevator and that we would have to bring our suitcases down twelve flights of stairs because the bell boys were overburdened. Imagine the situation with everyone trying to drag their bags down those stairs to check out. One father had his little 3 yr old boy trying to walk down the stairs holding the non-existent (in many places) handrails, while he tried to carry the suitcases down. One of us had to take the little boys had because we were afraid he was going to fall, it was so steep and treacherous. 14. The valets kept pushing sedans on us all the time, instead of hailing taxicabs, as we requested. 15. There are NO services in the hotel- no business services, nothing. And no one seems to care either. ALL IN ALL, I travel 2-3 times a month, every month, for business all over the US and this is BY FAR the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Never will I stay here again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too many things going wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpt003
Reviews.Content: We stayed invNYC this past weekent to do some fine dining and go see a show. We were looking for a hotel that offered a good location and a great price. Thought that this hotel filled both of those requirements. Sadly it did not. Location is the one thing that you can truly say works in the hotels favor. 54th st, walking distance to shows, central park, lincoln center, well just about everything. Thats it for the good though. Everything else about this hotel should send you running for the hills. First I booked two rooms, one for my wife and I and the other for my adult daughter. Just so you know, the rooms are tiny. You can barely turn around without bumping into something. Anyway, they put us on the 12th floor, all the way on the top. This will come into play later. The first night we were there we had dinner reservations at one of chefs Daniel Boloud's restaurants with a meet and greet set up with the chef. My wife is a huge foodie and was looking foreward to this for weeks. About an hour prior to leaving, I went to check on our daughter. Once in her room we sadly discovered that the door lock had malfunctioned and we were locked into the room. Hard to believe? Apparently commonplace at this establishment. It took well over an hour with two men working on things before the manager on duty finally called his boss and got permission to kick the door in. Bits of door went flying everywhere almost putting my eye out, remember the rooms are tiny. But at least we were free. We missed our special evening with the chef since he could not wait for us. But the hotel did compensate us by giving us a voucher for a free continental breakfast. Very giving of them. Im not sure we would have even gotten another room for my daughter had we not complained. So that was the first night. The second night that we stayed more things happened. Forget the fact that the maid never came to make up our rooms, even though we called the front desk twice to request this. No never mind that. I made the huge mistake of trying to use the inroom safe. Now I have stayed in a lot of hotel rooms, and used the safes, maybe hundreds of times. They have all pretty much been the same kind of safe. Very easy to use if you follow the provided instructions. Well I put my important documents in the safe and started to follow the instructions and it instantly locked as soon as I shut it. The instructions clearly said to shut the door, then punch in your secret code, etc... Lies. Had to call to get them to open it up for me, only they couldnt do it right away and said that sometime in the evening, while we were out at a show, someone would come up and open the safe. Does this even make sence? What is the point of the safe if they are just going to do that? But the evening continues. So we go out to dinner and a show. Get back to the hotel at around 12:30 only to find these nice little pieces of paper taped to the elevator doors stating that the elevators were broken and that management was sorry. Sorry?!? We were on the bloody 12th floor. Climbing up these rickety stairs, with no hand rails mind you, with all kinds of other people. Some elderly people too. It was a mess. Why couldnt we use the service elevator. Come to find out, this had also been broken all along. We did make it back to our room, my wife wanted some ice for some ice water. Guests do not have access to an ice machine on any floor, you need to call their 24 hour room service to get it. But because the elevators werent working they would not answer their phone for room service. So too bad no ice. Just went to bed in our dirty little room. The next morning the elevators were still not working. We asked for a bellman to help with our luggage since we were on the 12th floor and had to carry them all the way down. Again they refused. The front desk person insisted I first check out then go see the bellman for assistance. The bellmans responce was this service was only for guests and since I had allready checked out he could not help me. What a scam. Just tell the truth. You dont want to carry bags down 12 flights of stairs either. Fortunately the elevator cake back on line and we git our bags down without injury. Couldnt get out of there fast enough. Dont stay at the Ameritania!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again... Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: eelzbeth9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awful! Rooms were ok, nothing special. Very small. But I did get locked INSIDE my hotel room for over an hour which made me miss my dinner reservation (one of reasons for my trip to NYC). They had to literally break the door down, can you imagine if there was a fire? The manager on duty sad he would personally call the restaurant to ensure we would still get in. After re-packing and being told they were sold out and to just leave my bags and they would find something while I literally ran to dinner, they moved me into an even smaller room. No apologizes, just a free bagel and a drink coupon. Arrived at the Resturant and the manager on duty NEVER even called! THEN, the next day all 3 elevators were not working! I had to walk 12 flights in high heels, which is fine for me, but I passed several people almost passed out because it was steep of a walk. Took my mom forever, she had to rest every few minutes. Not to mention my "new room" was right next to stairs and all night I heard people swearing and pissed they had to walk. Buy the time they got to the floor so many people slammed the door in anger, I couldn't even sleep! The safes in the rooms don't work either. So hold on to your personal belongings. In the morning the elevators were not working again but we were told they would come get our bags ONLY if we went down to check out. So leaving bags on the 12th floor we walked all the way down and checked out. Waited about 40 minutes (after telling us it would be less than 10). Finally my father and I walked up 12 more flights of stairs and attempted to get three suitcases down and our carry ons. No help, no apologizes. No nothing. When complained at desk, we got "I'll make a note of it". We almost missed out train back home because of the delay. I would NEVER wish this hotel upon anyone. Stay far far away from the place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Next door to Letterman Theater; good value”
Reviews.Author: FredL757
Reviews.Content: We visited in early December for theater and shopping. The room was small, but more than adequate for 3 people. Beds were comfortable and room had a large screen, wall-mounted TV. Room was recently renovated. Room, bath and shower were clean. The hotel is at the northern end of the theater district, but within easy walking distance of Carnegie Hall, Radio City and Times Square. Considering the rate, the room was an extremely good value. There are a variety of eating places within walking distance. We will stay at the Ameritania again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: orlando123957
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days for Thanksgiving. The hotel has been renovated and some finishing touches are still going on but it is beautiful. The staff is AWESOME and upon returning to our room from viewing the Macy's Parade we found chocolates on our bed along with a Happy Thanksgiving letter from the Director of the hotel. What a nice touch!!! Made us feel very welcome and comfortable to be there. Will be back every time I stay in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great location but refurbishment not done according hotel standards”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, centrally located in midtown. Stayed in room 521 and it was small. I mean really small!!! The bed although was good en my room was at the backside so no view but also noise from outside. Just the air conditioning was making way to much noise so during the night I just had to switched it off. The bathroom looks nice and looks efficient but after taking a shower the floor in the bathroom was fully wet. Also the temperature of the shower was not as comfortable as you would want..... So overall a great location but expect a small room with no storage options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jd82
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania was an excellent choice for staying in NYC. We stayed here twice, once last year and once again this summer. Our first experience wasnt the greatest, we were given the smallest room possible that had a old heater that made noises all night long. We decided to give it another chance the second time around because the price was affordable, this time we were given a much bigger room. The service here is friendly, the doorman is great and can give you directions to anywhere you need to go. As for the location, you walk out the front door, make a right, then another right and you're in times square. Also within a couple minutes walk the opposite way is central park. A couple must do things for NYC is Top of the Rock, Walk through Central Park, Ground Zero , save some time and money by doing a bus tour, but start early. Wear comfortable shoes as you will be walking a lot. I also love going to Canal Street and getting cologne/perfume for half price. Knock off designer bags are also available. Enjoy your stay in NYC and consider the Ameritania, we will be going back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JMDallas_11
Reviews.Content: Great trip - comfy bed, courteous hotel staff, and a fabulous location!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rmac13
Reviews.Content: Had some ambivalence about booking this hotel after reading some of the earlier negative reviews. Most seemed to be connected to renovation that was going on during the past summer. The room I had was renovated, and was bright, clean, with a wonderful bathroom with walk in shower, and very comfortable bed. The staff wass great, immediate and friendly service for any concern. The bellmen were also great, with a lot of local knowledge and connections to outside serrvices. The person I travelled with was used to staying in much more expensive hotels, but liked this one very much, and booked a future stay there. I've been to a number of moderate (for NYC) priced hotels, and this was definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “Dena & George's stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: DenaHatzaras
Reviews.Content: Great location, atmosphere, service exceptional by all from the reception desk especially by Jose and his team to the door men. Room was a little small especially with two large suitcases, but we managed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheMull
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be spot on room was way better than expected, doormen Mourad and Julian were friendly and helpful, always had time for a chat with them, I didn't use the bar or have breakfast there but thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The location is great right on broadway and under 3 mins to times sq. the hotel was having renovation done whilst i was there but this was very unobtrusive, there is a new hotel being built across the road and the workmen started early, but this didn't bother me i always wake early and who wants to waste time sleeping I was on holiday in New York the city that never sleeps. Had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: born2travel58
Reviews.Content: I have a few hotels I usually stay at but due to a last minute trip my usual hotels were not available. I travel A LOT. This was a wonderful experience. The Hotel is undergoing renovation and the renovated room I was in clean, fresh, and comfortable. The most outstanding part of the experience was the staff, Sylwia greeted me on arrival and made the experience great. She remembered me by name during my stay and was attentive and helpful. I would absolutely stay there again. The location is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: lenaroscommon
Reviews.Content: stayed here october 2011. could not fault this hotel. the location was perfect for exploring the city, come out of hotel, turn right and u are on times square. best value in this area. checked in and we were left alone for the week without anyone bothering us. the room was newly decorated, compact and sufficient. it was cleaned daily. the only dowside was that we would have likd tea and coffee making facilities in the room, starbucks right accross the street. i would stay here again but will bring travel kettle. the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in. don,t bother paying 10 dollars for hotel breakfast. lots of pubs nearby serving good irish breakfast for a few dollars more. doormen very helpfull, organised shuttle bus to airport. we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Anthony757
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brilliantly located just a few blocks up from Time Square and around the corner from The Tonight Show. The initial impression is that the hotel has been re-decorated recently in a stylish red, black and silver theme. Although this looked great, I felt as though the older parts of the hotel were just repainted instead of being renovated. The beds were comfortable and the clean - the bathroom in my opinion was the best feature! It was modern in style, very clean and I liked the toiletries provided. I heard no noise from outside my room! The bar area was small but stylish - they had a good red wine that came with pretzel snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ivybmw
Reviews.Content: Yes then hotel is undergoing renovations and yes there is construction across the street, but it is NYC and noise is everywhere! I went there with my sisters to celebrate my birthday. We arrived at least 3 hours before check in and were given a very nice double up on the 11th floor. We could hear some of the construction noise, but we were gone during daytime so this was not really an issue. Front desk staff was very pleasant and the bartender was very nice as well. The only downside was the elevators.. Having to share with construction workers and only 1 elevator in service. At times it took at least 10 minutes to get elevator up to 11th floor. Overall I would say very nice place and once they are completed with their renovations, it will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “go and enjoy this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ojosazules11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and must say we were delighted with our choice of hotel , if you took a pen and marked on a map of N.Y.C. where you would like to stay the Ameritania would be that spot. the lobby is newly refurbished as are most of the rooms, our particular room was quite small but really well decorated and appointed and looked out onto Broadway and way down to Times Square ,just lovely , the staff were all diamonds but I would very much like to mention three in particular, Ronaldo in reception who really went beyond the call of duty to help us,Jeff on the door who is one of the nicest people you could wish to encounter and last but not least the bar tender , a Mexican guy whose name I have forgotten who spent a good bit of time ,giving us help and and advise, we will return to N.Y.C. very soon and would not hesitate in booking the Ameritania again

Reviews.Title: “Good place,and a real pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: PEGUILLET
Reviews.Content: The room were big enough,the dÃ©coration beautiful,the bathroom too,the housekeeping great,the location was the best close buy the subway,the shopping,restaurants,Central Park. Amazing staff,they were available all the time,especially "Mourad",the bell man (who speaks an excellent french) very helpful with a smiley face all the time,from him we got all information about visiting New-York and where to go and what to do,it was our first time,we will be back for sure. The only problem we had ,it was the rÃ©novation and the noise in our floor,and sometimes the Ã©lÃ©vators were slow,but it was a great place me and my daughter we did really love it,we will comeback again to AmÃ©ritania in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jama2006
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under construction and there is a lot of noise because next to the hotel they are busy with building, so you can sleep till 8th in the morning. Room was good. The location was perfect

Reviews.Title: “8 Days at the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: lora m
Reviews.Content: I was initially worried about staying at this hotel due to reading some reports online AFTER I had booked my stay about bed bugs. I was very happy to see that not only are there no bed bugs but the beds are incredibly comfortable! I really loved the beds. The door staff were awesome and so friendly, especially Juilan who made my stay very enjoyable, he's great to talk to. The other doormen were also lovely. The bar man who I thought was called "Caviar" was also truely marvelous and he gave me many ideas about where to find things I wanted in NYC. He is a very intelligent and knowledgeable person and a real asset to the hotel. On the down side, I had no computer and found the hotel's computer hopelessley slow and it had a broken keyboard. It meant that paying $2 for 8 minutes of internet time -a real rip off as the keyboard being broken meant that I spent all my time correcting errors and waiting for pages to load. The computer is in a hot noisey room with vending machines and an ice machine and it ended up costing me $2 just to send one email! That was really bad. The lifts are very slow, and I always wished the cleaner had mopped the bathroom floor. The room safe was located on the floor and this made getting things in and out of the safe so difficult for me as I had a bad knee. I would have really liked to have had tea and coffee facilities in the room, but the bed and the decor were the main redeeming features of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old School”
Reviews.Author: Barttira
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was refurbishing, the atmosphere was fantastic.Very 70s to 80s decor,big room with two double beds, and a simple but functional bathroom, where (most important) everything works very well). The plus is Ameritania is next door to the best NYC pub: Three Monkeys. If you are looking for big LCD screens in the room, this definitely is not Ameritania. TVÂ´s old but who wants to be in a hotel room watching TV in NYC? Ameritania is cooler than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a wonderful holiday!”
Reviews.Author: KathE_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days - was 1st trip to USA. First impressions of the Hotel were that it was underconstruction and we weren't too impressed. However that all changed once we'd checked in. Our family wasn't ready on the 1st night but apart from that everything else was great. Our family room, when ready, was fantastic and the location of the hotel was perfect for visiting Central Park, Times Square and the subway was nice and handy too. The Staff were excellent, very helpful especially Mourad the bellman. He organised taxis for us and arranged transport for our return to the Airport. I'm planning on returning to New York in the next few years and would have no hesitation in staying in this hotel again. The only reason I didn't give it a '5' was there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room and although the hotel was close to some great coffee shops 'Bagel and Bean' being one of them, it would have been nice to have had this facility in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location in a wonderful city....”
Reviews.Author: SuperVic85
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on TA which suggested me and my friend would be in for a nightmare experience, we were both pleasantly surprised with our experience. Location - Always knew this would be fabulous, this was the main driver for booking our stay here. Booking process - A few of the reviews I read prompted me to email the hotel a week before the stay to ensure our booking was in place as we had originally booked in April via Expedia. I received a speedy response from the hotel advising me that my booking was on their system as requested and that we would be given a renovated room, this was also the case when we got there... I love it when a plan comes together! Staff - The front desk were pleasant upon arrival, we did not have much interaction with them as we are very self sufficient, but the one request we did make was for a cup of hot water for medication, which arrived promptly to our room free of charge. - Although we did not drink in the bar, we visited the bar for a bucket of ice as the machine was out of order, if anything this was the only negative experience we had at the hotel, on two occasions the bar man was on the telephone and ignored our presence for a good few minutes before acknowledging us and dealing with our request. - All the door men were very pleasant and happy to help, Jeff in particular deserves a mention, he was very polite and welcoming and looked after our airport shuttle for our departure so that we did not have to worry about it! Room - First and foremost the room was clean and the beds were comfortable, I did not have any issues with noise from other rooms, the construction over the road or the air conditioning unit, as mentioned in other reviews. Although the air-con was on the loud side of the spectrum, it was easy to control and we were able to turn it off if the noise got on our nerves. The room was also a decent size, I am lucky enough to have visited New York previously and after staying in another hotel there I can confirm that this room was the average, if not quite large for the city. The room was equipped with a flat screen TV (good for catching up on US TV shows and the weather channel) and there was an iPhone dock. The bathroom was spacious with a nice shower and plenty of hot water. I guess the only box that was not ticked was the tea and coffee making facilities, but this was not an issue as there is a Starbucks over the road. There are no doubts that there are improvements that could be made to this hotel, in particular the windows were a little drafty (the window in the bathroom had a half inch gap at the top) but with temperatures in the 70s and 80s and the thick curtains this was not an issue. Also little things, like the ice machine being out of order (which it seems to have been for some time) and the coffee and tea making facilities, would make a big difference. Overall I would recommend this hotel, based on price vs location it is good value for money.
