To those who say the quality / standard is low, I would suggest digging deeper into your pockets for your next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for hoofing around the city”
Reviews.Author: mpn7330
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why others give poor reviews. The location is great, service perfect and hotel is clean. Rooms are smallish, but this is NYC so why are you in the room? Close to central park, times square everything. I didn't think there was much noise. Construction wasn't a problem. Internet available for a charge but is fine. I think if you want times square, this is great value for it. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 26NettieLaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights - first time in the USA - nicely surprised with room and the location was great - we found the porters v helpful and Jeff in particular was fab - only downfall no free wifi - will definitely return :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5hellebelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing refurbishment, although our room hadn't been renovated it was smart, clean and the bed was really comfy! The location of the hotel was brilliant, just a stroll into the action at Times Square. The staff were amazing, friendly and really interested in us, this was our first time in NYC and we are already planning our return!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even have a room for us!”
Reviews.Author: lynborghini
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about reserving here after reading these reviews, but the gal i spoke with at the property was so helpful and reassuring, i decided to give it a chance since the rate was good for nyc in july. I called at least 3 times to confirm and discuss details with the front desk. But when we arrived the hotel was "sold out" and had no room for us. Only consolation was the front desk staff who were kind enough to contact another property & book us a tiny, smelly room there. NOT the experience we had paid for. We made our reservation on-line thru travelscape.com and would not recommend this company either, after spending hours on the phone getting disconnected trying to get a refund. Argh!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bananachainsaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania from the 1st September til the 5th. Me and my girlfriend loved it. The room where small and so was the bathroom but it was comfortable. We was in room 504 and there was some work going happening on our floor but not once did we hear them. The best thing about the hotel was the location. You walk out the door and turn right and you could see Times squre .If you are used to posh hotels and 5 star service this place isn't for you but we loved it! Give it a chance. If I was pickie and had to pick something I didn't like it was the lifts only because they was very slow lol.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with very friendly and responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City. My daughter and I stayed at this Hotel for four nights and unfortunately our stay coincided with Hurricane Irene, and the Mayorâ€˜s sensationalizing it by shutting down subways, airports and restaurants long after it was obvious that Irene would not pose any serious threat to the City. However, because of the excellent location of this hotel, we had easy access to 24-hour food through nearby family-run stores that remained open even after the entire City was shut down. The overall friendliness, cooperation and courtesy of the staff at Ameritania made us feel comfortable there. At the time Ameritania was still under construction. So there were some deficiencies in several areas. For example, we had a room on the 12th floor, which was renovated but had a non-functioning phone system that remained disconnected during our entire stay. So we had to go down to the front desk with any housekeeping requests, which were responded to in a timely manner. Secondly, at the time of our reservation we had requested a room with a double bed but got one with one queen -size bed because of unavailability. Ameritania offered us a free roll-over bed instead, which I found being not as comfortable as a regular bed at all. On the evening of our fourth day at Ameritania, my daughter noticed something moving in a plastic bag containing a bag of Hersheyâ€™s Chocolate Kisses I had bought the previous day. As I approached the bag, I noticed a mouse trapped in that bag. I immediately tied up the bag closed and delivered that live mouse to the front desk. The following day, two men came into the room searching for holes in walls allowing a mouse to come into our room. They found one underneath the air conditioner just below the window. Because we were leaving Ameritania that day, I asked them to fix the hole later after we had left. I think that mouse downgraded my daughterâ€™s evaluation of the hotel substantially. But I cannot blame Amertania for this mouse as I have learned New York City has a rampant mice problem. Instead I would like to invite the Cityâ€™s Mayor to consider solving this mice problem, which poses a real public health hazard, instead of sensationalizing hurricanes, causing all sorts of problems for tourists, and trying to speak terribly broken Spanish in an attempt to attract the Hispanic voters.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, "OK" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guysingle
Reviews.Content: We had a refurbished room here. The good points: the location, room was spotlessly clean and the bed probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The shower was excellent, consistently hot and powerful. Yes the rooms are small but I don't worry too much about that as I'm out and about. The building site across the road is noisy from about 7 am but you can't blame the hotel for that, and it is a temporary situation after all. The bad points: the aircon in the room was incredibly noisy, rather like sleeping in an engine room. The lifts are rediculously slow and why the renovating staff use them and nor the service lift I don't know - replacing the lifts should have been job number one. I think someone should be doing quality checking on the work too: none of the doors in my room would shut properly, a tile had come off the wall and grouting was missing in places. It just gives the feeling that the management here is lacking attention to detail. For these reasons I couldn't give the hotel a high rating. And I would take my chances somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “even before refurb it was OK”
Reviews.Author: lmccreadie
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter here for her 18th and it was very comfortable. The location is excellent for all the sights we wanted to see, except the statue which was a cheap taxi. The hotel is next door to the Ed Sullivan theatre where the David Letterman show is filmed. Angelo's pizza is amazing right on the doorstep. Unless you're paying top dollar don't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the rain!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian617
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania with my girlfriend and her family this week. Rain leaked through the roof into the room and on the beds of 3 of our group members in the middle of the night. It took nearly 2 hours for them to be re-roomed (at 4am), and even then they were put in part of the hotel that was being redeveloped and not suitable for human habitat. The night receptionist just said 'it happens all the time'. They didn't even offer us a complimentary breakfast. In addition to this the rest of our party were located in rooms in the centre of the hotel which were incredibly loud- we didn't even have our air-con on! I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you like to sleep. In addition to this some parts of it are like a building site.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked!”
Reviews.Author: punkrawrr
Reviews.Content: Where do I even begin? The three nights that my partner and I stayed at this hotel were pretty disastrous! I made a reservation with this place through Last Minute Travel, I got what I thought was a pretty good deal for the three nights that we were going to stay there, boy was I wrong! Upon checking in on August 8th, my partner and I were informed that the hotel would be docking our card an additional $90 on top of the $590 that we already paid. They ended up running us through some BS about how in a few weeks or so weâ€™d get that money back, and, they HAD to have it right then. So, reluctantly we gave them the money. They had us staying in room 1010, they informed us that construction was still going on, on the hotel and such, which didnâ€™t really bother us. We ended up taking the elevator to our room, which was hot, dirty and extremely slow! Upon getting to our room, we discovered that we one of the newer renovated rooms. The room itself was small, the bed was nice and clean but very freaking dangerous, there was a huge mirror up against the wall that took up tons of space, the view sucked as our room was located directly across from the construction going on outside, the bathroom was nice and clean but again very small. The room was pretty average to say the least. The bed is one of those modern type ones that set really low to the ground. It wasnâ€™t five minutes of being in the room that I smashed my foot up against it and broke it, my foot that is. I ended up going down to the front desk and filling out an incident report about it, I was offered ice as medical treatment and informed that a manager would contact me ASAP about it. The manager never called. I spent the next four days walking around with a broke foot. As if that werenâ€™t bad enough, during our stay, housekeeping thought it would be a good idea to come and take all of our towels, washcloths etc. and not leave any fresh ones AND the hotel turned off our water. Broke foot and all I had to limp down to the front desk and tell them about it, only to have them say, â€œWe forgot to mention that the workers turned it off. It should be back on now!â€� When the water was eventually turned back on, it was brown with sediment parts in it. Totally gross. Also, the hot water took forever to heat up. When it finally came time to check out, I still hadnâ€™t heard from a manager about my foot or anything and the hotel charged us an additional $46 to take us to the airport. We wanted to take a cab, which would have been about $30 or so. When I finally got back home I called the hotel and complained about everything. The manager told me and I quote, that since I refused medical treatment (the ice) that there isnâ€™t anything that theyâ€™re going to do about it. So needless to say, right now Iâ€™m fighting with Last Minute Travel to get a full refund. I seriously wouldnâ€™t recommend anyone staying here; this was probably the worst NYC vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “5 star place for a 1 star price”
Reviews.Author: gords15
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing in every way you can imagine..especially for the price

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TheQuailes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on West 54th Street on Broadway, which is a short walk away from Times Square, all the Broadway theatres, Macy's, the Empire State Building and Central Park. The staff on arrival were very helpful and booked us tickets for the E.S.B. for that same afternoon. They were helpful with most of our enquiries. On the first evening the room we had was opposite a noisy air con machine and above a bar, in the morning we asked the staff if we could be moved and when we returned in the afternoon they had done so. The room we moved to was 100% better, we had air con and the room was decorated to a modern taste. The hotel didn't offer coffee making facilities when we were there, however Starbucks is on the opposite corner if you need a coffee fix in the morning. The doormen were also helpful, they held our luggage during the last day of our stay (for a small tip) so we could relax knowing it was safe, they also arranged a reasonably priced airport shuttle and advised us on how long we would need to allow for travel to the airport. I would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as i thought...2 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: azn_chick756
Reviews.Content: Well... to begin, i stayed here with my family for a week (Last week of July into beginning of August), and truthfully i expected a lot more. I requested early check-in and a renovated room, as most people have suggested. The early check-in was a no-can-do, because apparently they were booked full, so we just hung out a little until their check out time. They were polite enough to let us in at 10, an hour earlier than expected, which was good because we flew in at 5 in the morning with no sleep. At first, they were going to give us a room with only ONE bed, for FOUR people, and after complaining how we were GUARANTEED 2 doubles by phone and online, they fixed it. We had a corner room, which i believe was slightly bigger than the other rooms, but still tiny... but since this is our first time in NYC, i can't tell if it's small compared to other hotels... I believe that we had a renovated room... at least we were on a floor where they were renovating the rooms around ours. I didn't hear anything at all, morning or night. The room itself, was quite average- not clean, but not dreadfully disgusting. The restroom was TINY. I had to sit slanted while using the toilet because it was so close to the door, and i'm short (5'2). The view was... oh wait there was NO VIEW. There was a brick wall from the other building. The Continental Breakfast is a HUGE rip off! $10 for a few pieces of bagels and fruits... walk down the street to starbucks or mcdonalds for some DECENT food. The location, i'll have to admit was good. Right next to Broadway and a few streets from Times Square, Central Park, and subways. Oh and the elevators sucked... there are only 2, and they take FOREVER to get up on my floor (4). The workers use them also, so the elevator on the left is not as new and clean as the one on the right. Sometimes at night, you can hear the bar next door, at least for the rooms facing that way, but it really didn't bother me that much. I was too tired to let noise bother my sleep, and anyways, i'm a heavy sleeper. So all-in-all, not an AMAZING hotel, but it wasn't DREADFUL either. 2 1/2 stars for it's location and attempt to be hospitable. Oh and if you go here, don't take the airport transportation... we were charged $80 (from JFK) ... the taxi costs roughly $30-$40 to La Guardia, a little more to JFK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tjb12111
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night visit at The Ameritania Hotel and we loved the location!!! Location is the biggest perk of this hotel! This hotel is in the center of NYC! and it does not break the bank! It's a short stroll to Broadway's theaters, Times Square, News studios, Rockefeller Plaza, Fifth Avenue, and a block from Central Park! Subway staions are just minutes away that can take you everywhere which makes easy mapping! If you want Glitz, NYC lights, and a hotel lobby to die for, this hotel is NOT the one! But if you want a clean comfortable room (shades never pulled because we saw a brick wall), comfy bed, rainwater shower, tv, ice bucket, $10 continental breakfast, and an attentive, pleasant, and courteous staff. I will stay again and keep the savings for experiencing NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - wished the renovation was complete”
Reviews.Author: denverLH
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel. It was close to the subway (#1 train was at W 50th or W 59th) - so it was super handy to get on and off the subway. Hotel charges $9.95/day - but you can just walk across the street and get it for free. Free wi-fi was everywhere near the hotel (Starbucks, McDonald's, etc.) Since I literally just slept and showered there, and got a good deal, it was acceptable. They are undergoing renovations, which is ok, they try not to inconvenience guests too much. But the building next door is being demolished and you hear a jack hammer even at 3am. That wasn't fun. The staff is awesome - super friendly and very courteous. And the lobby is ultra modern. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A dump”
Reviews.Author: MGD54
Reviews.Content: No clue where this hotel received its *** rating. Of course, I am referring to a room that has not been refurbished as it is my understanding that this hotel is in "transition". Worn out mattress, worn sheets -- albeit seemingly clean, no closet, no table or stand for your luggage, bathroom floor worn and dangerously uneven, worn wall covering, worn wall to wall carpeting. As seasoned, 55+ travelers, we could not wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Dont let the bad reviews deter you”
Reviews.Author: rmpbrasil
Reviews.Content: This past weekend (July 21-24) we went to New York to see the Alexander McQueen exhibition at the MET. We came across the Ameritania and really hesitated after some of the reviews but we went for it. I was so hesitant that I called the hotel to make sure we got one of the renovated units and not an old one. So happy we didn't let the reviews deter us! The location was convenient for us. When we check in at 11:00 AM the young lady at the front desk promptly gave us a newly renovated room as requested. The room was definitely larger than I expected and was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable, clean and the staff was very professional and friendly. There was no trouble with construction as some reviews stated; I barely noticed any repairs were under way. We went in there with the understanding that the hotel was under renovation. It didn't disturb our stay and I was really happy with everything. The elevator is used by guests are construction workers, so the rug is worn out, but that was not a problem for us. The hotel staff is really helpful and try to make an effort to compensate for the inconvenience of the construction but we didn't have any trouble with it in the first place! Pending on the rates, I would stay at the Ameritania hotel next year. We stay at room 1103

Reviews.Title: “Be very wary of these cowboys. It is definitely not a three star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: honest_traveller53
Reviews.Content: This is an extract from my letter today to the NYC health authorities about our experiences of this terrible hotel with a wonderful location; "1. We were placed in room 603, on arrival late in the evening, to find the sheets were clearly not changed but simply straightened out, after a previous user. They were obviously and significantly soiled in a number of places with what appeared to be body fluids, including possibly blood. I was prompted by this to immediately strip the bed and examine matters better. The undersheet was heavily stained, on one side, just like in a bed in a geriatric long-stay unit with incontinent patients, and the mattress itself showed signs of multiple previous incidents, although then quite dry. 2. I immediately reported the matter to the reception desk by phone and politely asked for fresh linen and a change of under-sheet and mattress. The reception representative was hostile and overtly aggressive. Mr. "Hose'"? said clean sheets were not available at that hour and after two reminder calls and a significant delay of more than forty minutes, for two tired transatlantic travellers, offered us an alternative room. I inspected this offered alternative with a polite porter who was clearly embarrassed but not un-used to the scene. I found that the second choice room offered was a clearly sub-standard, tiny room, on first floor, directly over an open construction site with a third of the window taken up with a noisy air-con unit. I had to decline. Mr. Hose' then offered two other alternatives that I will just say were similarly aesthetically less convenient that our original room, so we opted to stay in 603 insisting, at least, on a change of all bed linen. 3. Mr. Hose at this stage menacingly suggested that we could always "move out if you are not happy ", despite the late hour, our correct booking and obvious absence of an alternative at that hour of the night. 4. Eventually a lady arrived with a change of sheets which were un-ironed. She explained that the hotel laundry service did not iron sheets, as their iron had been broken for some months and that the replacement sheets were the cleanest available. Throughout our stay, after this worrying introduction to their hygiene practices, I asked for a daily change, as we were sweating a lot with humidity and could not sleep with the noise of the air con in our room. The sheets provided each day were never ironed and frequently raised questions re cleaning standards. This should worry anyone connected with hygiene standards in a city with a recent history of a major bed bug epidemic. It clearly does not worry the management of this "hotel". 5. The lift on the left, from lobby to floors, had a carpet flooring that had frayed and shifted considerably, exposing areas of the metal floor and giving the impression of a generally un-safe and un-clean environment. It may not be contrary to hygiene regs. but it certainly matches their courtesy standards. 6. The hotel is under-going repairs and builders and dust are all over the place. The poor quality of the tile-work in the bathroom of room 603 hints that the workers involved probably operate to similar standards as the reception staff. Again, probably not covered by the regulations, but someone should be interested in the poor image this company are providing of hotel standards in one of the most interesting cities in the world." Anyone can make a mistake, but this "hotel" obviously does not care what transient travellers think, as long as they can exploit and bully them. Inciodentally, they also over-charged us, way beyond our so-called all-inclusive quotation. Avoid these cowboys !

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: WouterO
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this hotel. Hardly getting any sleep at all, since there are construction works going on across the street. From 6am onwards no sleep. But besides that, the noise isolation is terrible: with only single glass windows you hear every horn or yell. The air conditioning compressor is in the room, so leaving the AC on at night is not an option. The windows aren't covered by curtains, they use an office-like system which doesn't keep the light out very good. THE bathroom is very nice, good shower, a waterfall-like system. THE beds are quite good too. Location is perfect, but in my view it Does not compensate all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Belledoll
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Manhattan but moved before I was old enough to fully appreciate everything the city had to offer. My boyfriend and I have made several trips within the last year to NYC and stayed in various beautiful 4 star hotels. This past 4th of July weeked we made a last minute decision to spend an extra night in the city and scrambled to find an affordable hotel. We came across the Ameritania and really hesitated after some of the reviews but we went for it. So happy we didn't let the reviews deter us! As promised, the location was the best you can ask for. We originally booked a smoking room but when we went to check in the young lady at the front desk offered a free upgrade to a newly renovated nonsmoking room. While we originally were adamant about sticking with a smoking room we appreciated her honesty that the newly renovated would make a big difference in our stay so we took her advice. The room was definitely small but very clean. We didn't mind the size since we're always attached at the hip anyway. Plus the small room was the best motivation to get out and explore the city! We weren't there for a jacuzzi or satelite tv anyway. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff was very professional and friendly. There was no trouble with construction as some reviews stated, I barely noticed any repairs were under way. We went in there with the understanding that the hotel was under renovation. It didn't disturb our stay and I was really happy with everything. The staff really made an effort to compensate for the inconvenience of the construction but we didn't have any trouble with it in the first place! Another trip to NYC this summer was not in the budget but we already are planning another weekend pending the rates here are stay so reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Small basic room but very good location”
Reviews.Author: ldthk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely renewed, reception is large and modern. The staff is very friendly. The room was a bit of a disappointment, very small and no comfort. There is no free wifi at the hotel. We would not stay here again, just because the room was to small, everything else about the hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for New York vacation!”
Reviews.Author: KYQuacker
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania Hotel is ideally situated in the heart of New York. It's a short walk to broadway and major off broadway shows and far enough away from Times Square to cut down on the noise. Public transportation is near with several subway stops minutes away, as is Grand Central Terminal and Penn Station and excellent bus connections for more distant museums. Service is courteous, personal and attentive. The rooms, particularly in the already renovated section where I stayed are comfortable, clean with extremely comfortable beds and sparkling clean bedding. The hotel has sizeable closets with irons and boards at the ready; hair dryers provided and quality toiletries for air travelers. Continental breakfast is very reasonably priced and the quiet bar was a great place for winding down after a busy day. It may not be the newest or glitziest hotel in NYC but great for value minded travelers who want a secure location close to museums, shows and plenty of restaurants. I would definitely stay here again. You are a name, not a room number here.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid range”
Reviews.Author: JewelsandJarda
Reviews.Content: MId priced hotel, got it on www.lastminutetravel.com- and was a little leery as the last hotel from that website in the city was a little off the beaten path. The room was tiny as was bathroom- but modern and clean. I was very happy with the price and location. Right outside was the Letterman show and Times Square. Would definitely go again as I think it was a bargain. Was impressed they held my luggage at front desk after checking out for the remainder of the day before I picked it up and flew out of town in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: Lash018
Reviews.Content: The lobby is very cool. The staff ranged from good to nonexistent. The rooms were recently updated, but they missed a few things. You have to call for washcloths, the towels were big but shabby, there are no reading lights near the beds, the hairdryer didn't work and was not mounted to the wall, the shower had no place to put soap or shampoo, and the door didn't close all the way unless you pulled/pushed on it. The good side: the shower is amazing and had two shower heads, the beds were comfortable, the room big by NYC standards, the desk help was great. I will try someplace else in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: columbine456
Reviews.Content: We booked our break in New York at short notice so availibility was limited. We chose the Ameritania based on location, price and the ability to reserve a "quad" room (ie 2 double beds) - as two friends travelling together rather than a couple, we specifically wanted a quad room. We arrived very late at night and were told by the desk clerk that no quad room was available and that we had been booked into a king room instead. We pointed out that we had specifically reserved a quad room and this was met with a shrug and a comment that the king room was the same price (this wasn't the point at all). We were told that the hotel would move us into a quad room next day. As it was late at night we had little choice but to accept the position. The room we were put in was small, dark, appeared to be unfinished (the whole of the second floor appeared to be being renovated) and did not seem clean, and we were glad it was only for one night. The next morning we packed up as instructed. Obviously it was inconvenient - we had to carry possessions rather than leave them in the room and it is not relaxing to have to pack after 1 night. But we were glad to be changing to a different room. We went down to the front desk where the attendant confirmed we could be moved to a quad room. The attendant could not confirm which room - which surprised us given the hotel must know who is checking out. But we felt confident our request was understood. When we returned that evening, we were given keys to the new room. This was a much, much nicer room - larger, brighter and clean. But it was not a quad room - another king room. We also noted that the safe didn't work, the air conditioning did not seem to be effective and the room phone did not work. We went down to reception to question this. We were told (again) that there was no quad room available. We were told that the notes for our removal said "move to higher floor with view". We can only assume that our request was confused with someone else's request. The attendant said that we could be moved again the next day to a quad room. However, by this time, we simply were not inclined to believe the assurances. Plus we did not want the inconvenience of packing up and being moved again. We were also concerned that any new room might be dingy and dark along the lines of our initial room. We therefore agreed to stay in this room provided the other issues could be fixed. An engineer arrived promptly and fixed the safe. The air conditioning was improved - though never ideal - and we were told the phone line had been cut and could not be repaired. Despite this, we felt the best option was to stay in this room. During the rest of the stay, things improved and there were no further major problems. However, despite repeated requests, we never managed to obtain a full set of towels -a relatively minor problem but still inconvenient. We felt generally that the staff were unsympathetic to our issues - we barely received an apology let alone any offer to make up for the inconvenience. The location was good and the price reasonable - but this did not make up for the inconvenience and problems suffered. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster>>>>>>>>>>”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNYC60763
Reviews.Content: This place should be closed for good. Filthy dirty, NO air conditioning upon my arrival room was 85.5 degrees and I asked for my credit card to be refunded and they simply laughed. I had to go stay at another hotel that evening. Front desk agents are rude and worthless June 29th 2011. I still have not heard from anyone of the 5 people I have called to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Part great, part not so great....”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: Well, we had a renovated room, I think. Fourth floor. I liked it! Upon walking in, the lobby and the bar were very mod and chic! I loved the dÃ©cor! Very cool! Pictures included. Even the drinks were delicious. The bartender can make an awesome cosmo, yum!! However, my boyfriend DID see a mouse. Not in the room, but in the breakfast area restroom, but hey, apparently there are a lot of mice in New York City. Yikes, I am glad I did not see or encounter one in any way! There was a lot of work going on. In fact, we woke up a few mornings with it right next door and it sounded like they were banging on the wall to come in! I was even showering once, and right outside my window was a man working, painting or something! The window was frosted so hopefully, he could not see more than my silhouette. Hmmmm.... The half glass shower in the bathroom was intriguing, but not very practical because water went everywhere. Once, I almost slipped hard, but I caught myself. Whew! I loved the location! I missed having a gym. There was parking at Icon right next door with a discount for hotel guests which was GREAT! Also, the rooftop was lovely! So as you can see, it is a mixture of great and not so great. Bottom line, I think the positive outweighs the negative. But then again, I was not the one who encountered the mouse.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you like mice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VanCity80
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel!!!!! If you donâ€™t feel like reading this entire review then the only thing you really need to know is that I would not recommend this hotel to anyone because we found a mouse in our room. Also, even if the mouse issue was taken care of, I still would not recommend this hotel to anyone based on the terrible customer service we received from the Assistant Front Desk Supervisor regarding this issue. My wife and I had booked and pre-paid for this hotel through Book-it.com for 6 nights in late May 2011. The hotel was listed on the website as 3 stars and was going for an average of $140 plus tax per night. Like many similar websites the identity of the hotel was only revealed to us after confirming the booking. We decided to take our chance considering the price was so affordable compared to other accommodations in New York City. The location was also great (Theatre district â€“ next to Ed Sullivan Theatre, walking distance from Times Square and Central Park) and we figured if it was listed as a three star hotel it couldnâ€™t be too bad. Some of our friends had also used the same website to book a â€œmystery hotelâ€� in New York, through which they were also booked at the Ameritania, and had no problems - they said it wasnâ€™t the greatest hotel but for only 6 nights and considering we probably wouldnâ€™t be spending too much time in the room it was good enough. We didnâ€™t have very high expectations for this hotel. These expectations went even lower after we read some of the reviews, however, the price was right and we were willing to put up with a less than ideal place for a few nights. We can put up with a lotâ€¦our main concern was cleanliness, mainly that there were no bed bugs. Upon arriving at the hotel I could see that the lobby and lounge area had been renovated fairly recently. It looked decent but we knew that this wouldnâ€™t be an accurate reflection of the rest of the hotel based on the reviews that we had read. We were booked in room 215. Of course the room hadnâ€™t been renovated yet, which explains the cheap price. On one hand I expected that we would be getting a room that hadnâ€™t been renovated yet but based on the hotel managementâ€™s response to other customerâ€™s complaints on this website (that renovations should be complete by May 2011) I had some hope that we would get a newly renovated room. Unfortunately, from what it looked like the renovations at this hotel wouldnâ€™t be done for some time. It looked as though our entire floor still needed to be re-doneâ€¦there were rooms with the doors left open that were completely gutted, construction material lying around, etc. I never actually saw any other guests on our floor (although I did see some contractors walking around) and it was eerily quiet which made me think we were the only ones staying on the floor. Who knows how many other floors were like this. The room wasnâ€™t great which wasnâ€™t a surprise. It was small (which we didnâ€™t mind) and dark (which we also didnâ€™t mind except for it made it hard to see if the room was cleaned properly). The first thing we did was check the mattress for any signs of bed bugs â€¦thankfully we didnâ€™t find anything. The floor looked like it hadnâ€™t been vacuumed recently, the washroom stunk, and the bathtub had some hairs in it. The water pressure and temperature for the shower wasnâ€™t consistent. Still, as we had low expectations anyways we were content with making this our home for 6 nights. It wasnâ€™t until night number 4 that we had our encounter with the mouse. It was about 2 in the morning when my wife had heard some rustling in the garbage can and saw the mouse poke its head out. I saw it running along the wall towards the corner of the room. There are a lot of things that we are willing to put up with but having rodents running around our room is not one of themâ€¦ I called the front desk to report the problem. At this point I was still willing to stay at Ameritania if they offered me a renovated room as we wanted to spare ourselves the inconvenience of having to move hotels in the middle of the night. The maintenance guy came up to our room and as he wasnâ€™t acting surprised I figured this was a problem that he had seen before although he was adamant that he had never received any such complaints. The only other room that was available was another unfinished room directly above ours. I checked it out and it looked a little better but we didnâ€™t take it. Front desk set up another hotel for us (Sheraton Tribeca). The Sheraton was great but it wasnâ€™t as central and cost $330 plus tax per night. The front desk staff at Sheraton said that they had a few other guests from Ameritania transfer to Sheraton earlier in the night. The front desk guy working the late shift at Ameritania the night we checked out was fine to deal with. He was nice and seemed like he genuinely felt bad that we had to move hotels in the middle of the night. He was also the one who called around to see what other hotels were available. Unfortunately, he couldnâ€™t deal with our refund and told us to contact the manager the next day stating that management wouldnâ€™t be in until 3 in the afternoon. We were told that management would be advised of our issue. The following afternoon we went back to the hotel to speak with the Assistant Front Desk Supervisor. The supervisor wasnâ€™t yet aware of our problem, which surprised me as I figured the issue would be a priority for management to deal with although, to be fair, he had just started his shift shortly before we arrived. When I explained my problem to him he initially told me that he didnâ€™t have the authority to give me a refund and told me I had to speak to the Hotel Manager. I was disappointed that he wasnâ€™t more willing to help outâ€¦I thought that, as a supervisor, he would make every effort to properly address a customer complaint, especially one such as this. After speaking with him for some time he finally said that he could approve a refund...which still wasnâ€™t good enough as he said that he would only refund us for 1 and a half nights. Again he claimed that I would have to speak with the hotel manager who, of course, wouldnâ€™t be in for a few more days and who he had no way to contact. Again, after some time he reluctantly agreed to charge for only 2 nights. He stated that we would have to contact bookit.com for the refund and only did so himself when I asked him to. I was content with this outcome although I was not happy with how long it took before he agreed to give a refund for more than 1 and a half days. Regardless of how cheap the price is and regardless of the prime location do not stay at this hotel. Even after the renovations are complete and the mouse problem is fixed I still wouldnâ€™t stay here based on the terrible customer service from the supervisor.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations and would return again”
Reviews.Author: nataliem9
Reviews.Content: After reading various mixed reviews of this hotel before we went away, i was apprehensive at what we might find upon our arrival. However these worries were immediately put at ease at check in. We were put in one of the renovated rooms, it was massive for the two of us, lovely clean bathroom and a great plasma tv. The hotel staff were very helpful and just let us get on with having a great time in a great city. Previous reviews comment on the noise of the hotel, on this note i am not sure what people expect if they book a hotel just off Times Square!!! Nothing can be done to help traffic noise, and we were always so tired at night that we looked forward to sleeping in the very comfortable bed. After staying at this hotel we are now staying in a 5 star hotel in Miami, and I can say I much preferred the customer service levels at The Ameritania. This is officially a three star hotel and in my view exceeded all expectations. I would love to return to New York and would not hesitate in staying here again. I would urge people to give this hotel the chance it deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely re-done in the last 6 months and offers great promise after entering thru a nearly un-marked front. If you are not careful, you might walk right by it! The lobby is hip, yet sedate and the front desk is cool but efficient. That's pretty much where the fun ended for me. The attention to detail, or lack thereof, is going to really hold this hotel back. For instance, I had issues with the key card system every time I left the room. Nothing is more frustrating after a 16 hour day than finally getting to your room and finding out you can't get in. This happened four times during a one night stay until they finally called the engineer to fix it. I then found out that the key card system is from 1988 and is a constant source of problems. If this is true, management needs to replace it pronto! Once I got into my room, there were no towels and it took 3 tries to finally get them. Once i did get them, they were still damp. Perhaps they have a towel shortage too? The room has a huge flat panel TV, just don't try to watch it unless you like watching snow. I pulled the wires out and tightened everything down, but to no avail. Also, the shower is lukewarm. Other than that, the bed is comfy and the a/c works great. As I said, everything has been re-modeled and updated. The room is small, so if you're a family that spends time at the buffet tables, you will not be too comfortable in a standard room. Location is also superb. It feels like a quiet pocket right near the theatre district and the craziness of Broadway. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful, but this hotel has several issues that really prevent it from being a serious contender. I hope that management is reading this!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: The entrace of the Hotel was dark, i couldn't read the name of the Hotel from a distance and there was not even a doorman at the entrance and it was 11pm. When i got there the front desk staff was rude and didn't even ask me for an ID just for the credit card and gave me the keys, he didn't even guide me where i had to take the elevator until i ask him. The Hotel inside is really nice and modern, the room was too small but comfortable. The price was really good, So i do strongly recommed this Hotel but the Staff needs to be more nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers - FInd somwhere else unless you are desperate”
Reviews.Author: Dion K
Reviews.Content: Hotel in an excellent location just 2 blocks south of Central Park. Rooms had recently been upgraded, but very poorly done; quality was aiming to be high but well short. Windows didnâ€™t; close properly, Air Conditioning did not work and no other rooms to put me in. I phoned the front desk several times but never got an answer, when I visited was told the other staff were too busy fixing other problems. TV was mounted on the wall and well off square which was really annoying. Floor was filthy, covered in muck, paint chips and dust. If you are going to do up rooms close the area off to contain the construction mess. Very noidy hotel, especially bad as the windows woudl not close,.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what they offer, not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: maritere26
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late in the day (on a reservation, however). Because of the time (9:30 pm) we had no choice, we felt we had to keep the room they gave us.... it was tiny, the air quality was horrible, I could not sleep between the heat and the freezing intervals caused by poor air conditioning and ventilation. The shower was nice but I found the cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Our friends asked for another room and were told there were none...but when they approached the front desk for a second time stating it was impossible for them to sleep in the room they gave them....they then quickly found a second one for them. The location of this hotel is great, of course, in the very heart of Manhattan but if I have a choice, I would not ever again go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: MRPA85
Reviews.Content: The good: Staff was very nice. Room was a good size for a New York hotel. Probably due to being a corner room. Room had two beds with a sitting area and a bit of open floor space. Also had a wet bar. Bathroom was upgraded and quite clean. Location was perfect. Minutes to subway, Times Square and Central Park. The Bad: Ceiling above wet bar had some issues. The drywall appeared to have had some previous water issues and looked as if it wanted to fall off the ceiling. The area under the wet bar was dirty and had a mouse trap. i did not see any mice. We stayed on the 10th floor but had to travel to the first floor for ice. The ice machine was in a room that doubled/tripled as the vending area/business center. That area was quite dirty. TV was smaller than the one i had in my college dorm 25 years ago. Initially I was quite pleased with the room and the hotel but the more I was there the more I wanted to leave. The place could be a decent option if only it was much cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont ride the NYC subway or are not from Europe you wont 'get' staying here”
Reviews.Author: scottgillanders
Reviews.Content: I dont mind hotel rooms that are small-they are by definition for a bed and shower-this is exactly what you get wrapped in a sexy mod package in the renovated rooms. Bed comfortable with nice pillows - bathroom very modern and nice shower, although the open shower design is probably not maid friendly. Watch toes on corners of bed as the platforms are not recessed. Gilchrist & Soammes soaps are nice - elevator never a problem. Yes, hotel under renovation but no obvious more noise than from street - work waited until after 7:30 - the fenestration / windows on the hotel do need to be reviewed to get better seals to close out street noise, but is was no louder than any other CBD. If I need to crash in Manhattan after a concert as I did, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: mumbojumbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights - way too long! Had no sleep any night due to workmen banging, shouting and laughing all through the night. Had to go to bed early one night and at 10pm rang the reception stating that the workmen were still working laying a new carpet outside of our room. Reception said they should be finished very soon. Had to ring again at 2.00am as they were still outside the room banging and shouting. Rang the reception yet again to be told they shouldn't even be working at this time, but this carried on all week. Asked to speak to the Manager but was told he wasn't there, he never even bothered to get in touch with us or saw us when we booked out. I would like some sort of compensation if he reads this review. LETS SEE!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1949-12
Reviews.Content: The photographer really did this place justice! Room was not like the pic. Everything worn out. No hot water for a shower--ICE COLD. Complained to the front desk and was told the situation would be taken care of. Pipes were noisy at all hours. Hair dryer over toilet which kept falling off wall--don't see how this passed city inspection. Room was noisy, bed was very low to the floor and not comfortable, room was very dark, felt like they were trying to hide the uncleanliness, lighting was really poor. Lamp on desk didn't work. Room was really small and kept hitting feet and legs on bed. TV was from long ago and didn't work. Elevator was really slow. Ice machine didn't have ice. We stayed here three nights. AVOID THIS HOTEL, IT IS WAY OVERPRICED EVEN FOR NEW YORK. As a guest on the elevator stated, "This isn't a very good hotel" and he had warm water for a shower.

Reviews.Title: “this cannot be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: canada18671
Reviews.Content: dont stay here. the shower was eiether burning hot or stone cold and the man who came up tried to fix it but nothing changed. beds not comfy floor had a hole in it bathroom rusty toilet did not flush too small for 4 ppl drilling at 130 am and in elevator shaft creepy workers hotel is only half operational halls dirty lamps in hall cracked stairs dont work elevator takes forever dirty floor despicable service at front i left a rotten hamburger and sandwich in the stairs as payback for your awfful excuse for a hotel in nyc u even the bed bugs stayed away because it sucks and is dirty dont stay go to the hilton a few blocks u only pay 50 bucks more but it like 500 times better this place needs to be shut down by city inspectors u suck

Reviews.Title: “Dont eat there”
Reviews.Author: gonewiththewind14
Reviews.Content: . I requested a breakefast which arrived after 15 minutes and was so cold I could not eat it. I had also requested no hash browns which were sent on the plate.I was advised that the food was brought in ? I returned the meal and waited for another during which I requested a cup of coffee. The 2nd meal arrived with no knife and fork supplied and I tried to eat it with the hotels plastic ones but it was impossible. Again it also had has browns which I had twice remarked that I did not want. I would like this money refunded as the services for this 1 time I tried to eat there was terrible.I compalined about the meal but when I arrived home I found I had received a charge on my bank account of Â£11.62. I sent an email to CRS hotels from there website but it just bounced back and I cannot find an email address to contact them diect. Anyone able to help!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: debbie1963
Reviews.Content: excellent location - 5 minute walk to Times Square. a good base. Myself and my daughter stayed for 4 nights . the room had 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. The room had recently been redecorated and provided the ideal sleeping accommodation. a free safe was provided. On the downside there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and other parts of the hotel was under going re-decoration/updating and there was a building site opposite the hotel which could be a nuisance if your room was close to this. however great value for money. staff helpful, would stay there. if you want a reasonably priced hotel in a great location and are not worried about the hotel being redecorated this is your ideal choice. the room was clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: LandSHolidays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic, rooms are big but quite dark and hotel is quite noisy. But AMAZING location. Right in Times Square, views out of the window and easy links to all of Manhattan. For a budget break where you just want to see as much of New York as you can as easily as you can then would recommened staying here. Who wants to sit in the hotel room if you're a tourist in NYC anyway?!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Very shabby rooms - and very small. Hot water problem - took around 20 minutes for hot water to come through. Carpets very old and rather dirty looking. Damp/mould stains on bathroom walls, plus part of the walls looked 'bubbly' and peeling. Don't think the room had seen a duster in months. Crap TV and channels. No tea/coffee making facilities. Beds were made every day and clean towels replaced daily (a plus at last!). View was rubbish - looked out into 'internal' black, facing onto rooms which were being renovated (I think - as they were very diirty looking). Good location for Times Square (wow! another plus!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good rooms, helpful staff, good value for money, what more can you ask on a budget? :)”
Reviews.Author: Mikeyg316
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on the 19th of march 2011 for 1 week, having read the reviews we we a bit concerned about what we'd find on arrival but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised! First of all let me say that the hotel is undergoing a lot of renovation work which I'm told should be finished by May, as building work didn't start til 10am and finished at 6pm it hardly disturbed us at all except for the builders using one of the two lifts. The lobby is stunning and the staff were very helpful and accommodating on arrival, even upgrading our double bed to a queen size free of charge on finding out it was my girlfriends Birthday during our stay! The rooms are a decent size and decorated quite well, bathroom was clean with a good shower but a small bath even for someone who's 5'2! Although there have been loads of comments about the room being cold we found it the exact opposite due to the radiator in our room on for 24 hours a day. The door men are characters and very helpful and friendly, they rang our airport transport for us without having to be asked which was much appreciated. Overall I found our stay very comfortable and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again especially as the renovation will soon be completed, overall a solid 7/10 please ignore the negative reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “No better than Motel 6, and in some ways worse”
Reviews.Author: chrisrimple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania in NY on 3 separate occasions in February and March 2011, all business trips. The hotel was selected by my company's travel coordinator based on price. I won't stay there again. My complaints about the Ameritania include: - Dated, unclean rooms. Carpets may have been vacuumed, but don't feel like it. Bathrooms, particularly showers, show rust stains and other signs of age. TVs are small CRTs, not flat screens. Cable TV wasn't working on any of my visits, so very limited channel selection with poor quality picture. No fridge. Rooms are often cold, with little control over temperature due to central, radiant heating. - Poor services and amenities. No gym. No on-site snack/etc. sales (nearest 24-hour grocery is 1 block). No vending machines. No ice makers. Continental breakfast has no heated food. No restaurant. No free wifi. - Untrained staff. During my last visit, I was given a room that was already occupied. After changing rooms and paying the wifi fee online, it immediately stopped working. I called the front desk, and they transferred me to the wrong tech support 3 times in a row; apparently, they didn't know the difference between their wifi provider and their cable TV provider. - Construction impact. Not just the half of the hotel that's being refurbished, but also in the open lot next door to the hotel. Expect lots of noise beginning at 7am on any weekday. As an alternative, I recommend the Novotel, which is one block from the Ameritania and is much, much nicer, like a Hilton or similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal even better location”
Reviews.Author: ss05ng
Reviews.Content: I was some what leery about staying at the Ameritania Hotel after I began reading the reviews however, I was pleasantly surprised. Although the hotel was undergoing renovations there was no excessive noise while sleeping and no construction interfering with my stay. There was an old radiator in the room to heat it which was extremely noisy however, turning it down/off solved that problem completely! When I booked the room I booked a room with one queen bed but instead ended up with a room with 2 queen beds at no extra cost! We also had a very friendly doorman, were ONE block from 2 different subway lines and about 2 blocks from other subway lines. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Friendly Staff & Comfortable Room!”
Reviews.Author: FaceandFace
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at the hotel I must admit I was for from impressed, thee hotel was undergoing some renovation...thee face of thee hotel was covered by scaffolding. Not thee best start. However...inside was a totally different story, The lobby, which most people on here will tell you is absolutely stunning, obviously what thee hotel have fixed up first. After check-in we were shown our room (10the Floor), This sadly to say was not acceptable: The door would hardly lock, The pressure of thee shower was rubbish, thee plug in thee bathe did not work and thee sink surface would collapse at thee slightest bit a pressure (due to thee leg being cut short). I decided to do thee most un-British of theings and complain. The hotel staff were more thean accommodating and showed us a several otheer rooms for us to chose from. We chose a room on thee 7the Floor, theis room had a lovely batheroom, a king sized bed, a walk in wardrobe, mirror, desk & a tv in a cabinet. Perfect! The hotel was going under extensive renovation work on one side, which was closed off, thee work was being carried out between 9:30 till 17:00 during theese hours we were out sightseeing so didn't really mind, we would occasionally share a lift withe thee builders who were also friendly. The location of thee hotel is fantastic! literally walk out of thee hotel, turn right and you're straight outside thee recording studios of "The Late Show" on Broadway, a few hundred yards down was time square and from theere on everytheing is mostly withein walking distance. Don't listen to the other rubish reviews, the chance's are they didn't voice their problems when they were there, otherwise I'm sure the hotel staff would have sorted it out!

Reviews.Title: “UGH!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellenk6
Reviews.Content: This place was just gross. I had to stay here because my boss is cheap. We had to change rooms THREE times. Each time was supposed to be an improvement, but it just kept getting worse. The bathroom in the first room I would expect in a motel that charges hourly rates; the second room was dirty and smelled mildewy; in the third room the carpet was wet. We gave up at that point. I was praying the boss would just throw in the towel and get a better hotel, but nope. Guess who's staying at this dump again this winter. FML.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, rather Scared.”
Reviews.Author: dbw46
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this place a couple of times before and I liked the location and the buildings, BUT from now on I will NEVER CHOOSE to stay at this hotel. I arrived at the hotel earlier than the check-in time so I had my suitscase kept in a room until I can chek in. When I come back, the person in charge couldn't find my suitcase anywhere. He looked around murmuring something irritatedly and said, "Sorry, I can't find your suitcase" in a slapdash manner. I was freaked out and asked him to look for it again. I also looked around, but we couldn't find it anywhere. ã€€THEN, the guy was trying to TAKE the ticket-stub kind of thing FROM ME. That was the only evidence I can rely on in case of the loss. He obviously began to try to destroying evidence. I was SO SCARED. Because I don't speak English well enough to deal with this kind of thing, I was so frustrated. He totally changed his attitudes, acting overbearingly. I thought I had to ready for a case, when I found my suitcase hiding behind the door. I was relieved, but if it had been his intentional crime, what would it have been? One more thing. Finally I walked into the room by using the key the clerk handed to me, then I found someone taking a shower. I was freaked out and dashed to the front desk. What the ???? I don't know who were using the room, but I don't think they were hotel guests. I thought I would never write the review, but I couldn't resist. I'll never use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say in the other review!!!”
Reviews.Author: millions1v
Reviews.Content: There was nothn really wrong with the hotel just that it had an old little tv that was not cool and that's it room was nice and cozy room wasn't really big but it looked clean and looked very nice And don't mind stayn there again

Reviews.Title: “Just don't bother!!”
Reviews.Author: J0N587
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the hotel I was told that a room hadn't been reserved (which was the fault of my travel agent) but I was told not to worry as they would sort it out. But they needed my credit card to secure a room. Our room didn't have a number as the A4 sheet had fallen off the door. When we entered we were met by a cold draft as the sash window was broken and wouldn't close correctly at the top, this combined with a radiator that hadn't been bled since they built the hotel was just great. The tap on the sink and the shower head were not secure they both moved about quite alot. Tried to phone reception to report this but guess what...the phone didn't work. The bed frame was a king size with a double mattress on which jut looked odd! By this point I was literally crying with laughter it was so rubbish there was nothing else todo!! The reception staff didnt sort out the reservation problem over the four days I gave them. Luckily it took one 5 minute conversation on my mobile (because you cant make international calls from the front desk) to sort out the problem. That didn't stop them charging to my card anyway. But I guess I should of expected it!! Plus side location is brilliant. Better plus side there are plenty more hotels to stay in in the same area!! Really just don't bother!!

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever stay here & I offer apologies to 1st time NY visitors; this is disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: maurawilson
Reviews.Content: The Board of Health should shut this place down! I have traveled to many places in the world including budget hotels in Russia... this was the most disgusting place I have ever stayed in! First room key wouldn't work. Second room I pulled sheets back to look for bedbugs - found small black hairs on top of the sheet and under the sheet. Third room had no hairs but it was disgusting in many other ways. Carpet was old, stained & had huge folds in it; closet door couldn't be shut because of a huge fold in front of it. There were holes in the ceiling, & between the wall and top of window ledge with cracked plaster or sheet-rock. The closet ceiling was falling in and moldy. The wall between the toilet and shower was also water damaged and looked moldy. The floor in front of the heater/AC collapsed down when you stepped on it. Room was so small -about 12 inches between bed & heater & could only fit 1 nightstand. Second nightstand was at foot of bed and the drawers wouldn't stay shut; I'd have to hold the drawers closed with my hand to pass by it to get into the miniscule bathroom. Bathroom had a new sink & toilet and flooring, but the sink hung over the toilet by about 10 inches so you had to sit on the side edge of the toilet and the sink still pressed into your arm. I was so embarassed for all visitors (hotel had many international guests) that I ended up by apologizing to everyone I rode on the elevator with - telling them that hotels in the US and NY are not like this; several people told me they were happy to hear that because they were horrified at the place. YES, the lobby and bar area look lovely.... the rest of this place (I was on 3 different floors) should be condemmed!

Reviews.Title: “Not pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Hallsworth24
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location as it is walking distance to Times Square etc and central park, however it is also across from a building site and got scaffolding erected. Not sure what the work actually was though that represented the need for scaffolding! The Hotel wasn't clean, the carpet in the rooms was filthy (take slippers), bathroom a bit grotty but shower was powerful. Beds are very comfy and clean, so it didn't really spoil the break. The doorman wasn't too polite but was okay when he wanted a tip! and you tip for everything so beware!!!! Drinks expensive - 9 dollars for a Whiskey and Coke but you can expect that anywhere. Well placed for breakfast. Wouldn't recommend but not a total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “THEY SCAMMED US FOR $104 EXTRA DOLLARS”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeArc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline and stayed there for 4 nights. They insisted that we give them a $100 fully refundable deposit for "incidentals" but refused to elaborate on what those were. Since I paid $25 for internet access with a different card, I knew it was not that. Nor was there any kind of refreshments in the room for purchase. They ran the "deposit" as an ATM withdrawal! In addition, they first led us to a floor that was full of paint fumes and in the process of being renovated. Since I have COPD and Asthma, we asked for another floor. They then took us to a room with no heat which was ridiculous since it was 24 degrees out! Finally we were taken to the floor above the paint fumes and had to call down for towels. The bathroom was funky. I would never return again.

Reviews.Title: “A very cold disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ColdGuest
Reviews.Content: My brother and I wanted to surprise our father on his 80th birthday by bringing him to New York, his birthplace. We were happy with the Ameritania's location but disappointed with the conditions we were subjected to during a frigid arctic cold-spell. The room was unacceptably cold, with a constant icy draft blasting through the windows. We had hot water only three out of 5 days. Cleaning service skipped cleaning the toilette and washing the floor. We were happy to have a good breakfast of croissants and coffee each day until we learned that it was not complimentary, (even though no signs were posted indicating the hotel charged for what most hotels comp). They tried to stiff us with a bill our last day adding insult to injury.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again!”
Reviews.Author: libeng
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would write a review on a hotel, but I actually felt compelled to come home and write a review for the Ameritania so I can save others from making the same mistake we did! AWFUL hotel. Extremely overpriced. Don't be fooled by the pretty lobby.... the upstairs does not compare! Do yourself a favor and stay at Dream... its only block north, less expensive, and beautiful! The rooms can be small, but they are clean, updated, and worth every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: OBXer1428
Reviews.Content: I had no clue about this hotel before arrival. We arranged to stay here through an air/hotel travel package with one of the on-line agencies. This is an older hotel in the process of being renovated. The lobby is nice and modern and sports a bar/lounge. Our room, on the 12th floor, over looked Broadway and we could see the intersection of 54th and Broadway from our window. The room was small, but cozy and just right for 2 people....after all, it is an old hotel. The bed was comfortable and clean. The sink in the bathroom was well below waist level....almost mid thigh. I'm not sure why it was renovated that way, but it's ok....we made the best of it....after all, how much time do you really spend in the bathroom? This hotel is within 5 blocks of Central Park and is on the north end of the Theater district....so, you are within walking distance of all the Broadway shows and also, Times Square. To be honest, the only thing I really missed was an in-room coffee maker...but, there was a Starbucks right across the street. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, keep looking. If you are looking for a decent place to stay that is centrally located to everything in Manhattan, then the Ameritania ischia place for you! One more thing...this hotel is right next door to the Ed Sullivan Theater where the David Letterman show is taped. Long wait for tickets thou!

Reviews.Title: “Brrrr- One Cold Night at the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: CitiChick
Reviews.Content: I needed to spend a night in the city and found the Ameritania to be affordable and have a great location near where I had early morning meeting. Upon arriving to the room found it to be cosy and clean but the heating unit in the window did not work. Called down to front desk and they brought up a plug in electric heating unit and set it up in the room. After getting ready for bed I noticed the electric radiatior had no wheels to keep it off what I would consider a safe distance from the carpet. Afraid that the unit might ignite the carpet in the room while I slept, I turned it off and opted to pile on the bedding from the other bed and burrow down for a cold nights rest.. Will I stay here again...dont think so...

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad budget hotel for New York”
Reviews.Author: JMaren
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here on the 27th November through to the 30th November. I found my room very large for one person, however being on the 1st floor and facing the street it was very noisey, however I guess that is what earplugs are for! The rooms are very dark and the heater/air con is very noisey but at least it worked. The bathroom was basic and clean which is all that was reuquired. It is very close to time square and all the attractions are in easy walking distance which is great! So now for the bad stuff! - There are renovations going on, my floor smelt of paint and the hallway carpet is covered in paint chips dust etc. Upon checking out I was informed that I had no extra's to pay, yet later that day I discovered that I had been charged for water. I have since sent them 4 emails over the past couple of days requesting someone to contact me regarding this charge, they are yet to do so. Therefore I probably would recommend the hotel, if you don't mind a bit of refurb and take ear plugs. However please make sure they do not charge you extra for anything after they inform you there are no extra charges, as they appear to then dodge your emails!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation but great location”
Reviews.Author: SambobUK
Reviews.Content: The negatives first: the rooms are very small and very dark. Also, it is extremely noisy, but mostly down to the shoddy fitting of the air con unit which is half wedged into the window, which you then cannot shut properly as a result! Bath, toilet and sink were all cracked, and the water in the hot water took over 5 minutes to come through the shower. Positives: excellent location, literally 5 mins walk to Times Square, but that's the only positive I can think of. Basically, you get what you pay for, after all when you've got New York on your doorstep, why would you stay in the room??

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: vmorales122
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ameritania Hotel with a couple of friends for a weekend in October, 2010. The hotel has an excellent location! We walked to the MOMA and Time Square and it was great. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Also, we really liked the lobby and the bar area. One of the nights we invited some friends and we stayed at the bar and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Up-to-date Nitty-Gritty”
Reviews.Author: Theetante
Reviews.Content: To address some of the criticisms made in previous reviews with up-to-date news: - the Hotel is in the process of refurbishment - the upper floors are pretty much ready and are so much better. At the moment some rooms are still dark and dingy, so ask politely for another room if you're unlucky enough to be given such a room. Rooms on the "smoking" floor reek of smoke, so if you're a non-smoker don't go there! The non-smoking room I had was about 10 x 9 (Queen size bed) + full bathroom, so smallish but adequate. The bedroom and bathroom were clean, the drawers were clean - there was a pile of plaster dust in the corner behind the TV cabinet which remained there for my entire stay. No bed bugs found. The TV is not the sleekest, but fine. There is no minibar or tea/coffee making facilities in the room. There is an ironing board and iron, safe and luggage stand. Hairdryer in the bathroom. Toiletires and towels were supplied and replaced as needed - and absolutely fine. The bed and the linens were fine, plenty of choice of pillows. I found the room a little chilly and no extra blankets in the wardrobe. Could do with more light in the bedroom and at least one mirror in the bedroom itself. The lifts are slow especially around 9 to 9.30am. The building opposite (on 54th) is being demolished so noise starts at 7.00am. The garbage truck crashes and bangs its way down the road in the small hours, but it's NYC. The decor is plastic and a bit cheesey.....but, it's a budget priced hotel and you come to see the City not to critique the interior design. Reception and door staff were friendly and helped with luggage and small requests. There is a parking garage and a Gold's Gym in the same street. There's a good snack/juice/deli bar at the corner of 54th/8th. You can get a 20% discount card at the reception desk for breakfast at Serena which is diagonally opposite on Broadway - the Continental breakfast is pretty good value @ $14. I didn't breakfast at the Ameritania....it didn't look particularly inviting. I wouldn't have wanted to spend much time in my room, but I wanted a budget priced hotel that was clean and reasonably comfortable whilst I enjoyed going out and about in NYC - so with those critieria, I was quite satisfied. Tip - try a Florentine sundae at Divine Bites - you can always start the diet on Monday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darrensale
Reviews.Content: We were worried by some of the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and the room. The room was basic but had a massive bed and cable tv. The bathroom again basic but had plenty of hot water and clean. I would definitely stay here again. For the great value and location I think it can't be beaten. Jeff the doorman was very helpful. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Danger, Will Robinson!! The negative reviews are for a reason!!!”
Reviews.Author: cutieOhio
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews but decided to keep an open mind since I was not the one who made the reservation. The lobby looks great but is not indicative of the decor of the rooms at all. It's simply a way to lure you in to stay there but the rooms are not nearly up to the same par. The matresses are old, have HUGE divits in them, & all the rooms are very dim. We were given a room on the 4th floor & were greeted with the overwhelming smell of paint as soon as the elevator door opened. When we got inside our room the smell was not as bad but we discovered our window was open about 2 inches. When I tried to push the window down to close it the frame fell off. We tried to call the front desk & the phone did not work. We promptly went downstairs & asked for a different room. We were given a room on the 2nd floor. The sink was slanted so the soap would not stay on the edge, water from the shower splashed everywhere because the only barrier is a plate of glass that goes half the width of the tub, no adjustment for air/heat, water barely came out of the shower head, the matresses were horrible, it smelled like someone was smoking in the bathroom off & on & someone was playing a trumped off & on all night. The next day we asked for a different room & were moved to the 9th floor. The room was still dim but was larger. The window had gaps in different spots around the frame so we heard street noise all night & again the mattress was horrible. The other problem was that the tub drained VERY slowly. Bottom line, if you stay here, BE PREPARED & complain if the room is not good. The staff were apologetic but there is only so much they can do when the building is old, run down & falling apart. I would NOT stay here again. The positive is that the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “substandard-dirty-loud”
Reviews.Author: pam29948
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd read the reviews before we went. Room was dirty, bathroom disgusting (mildew growing on the walls, tub and sink did not drain), AC LOUD, walls cracked, about 1/2 of the TV channels did not work and there is not a single electrical outlet in the room for charging phones, computers etc..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel at best”
Reviews.Author: jmatl
Reviews.Content: Room condition pretty bad but meets minimum standards

Reviews.Title: “Caveat emptor!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernmostTraveler
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the convenient location and "hip" vibe of a cheesy lobby "renovation." In my NYC experience, only the Pod (shudder) has tinier rooms. First room given (1206) smelled of so much perfume-like room deoderizer that only until you actually were in the room for awhile did you figure out that the deoderizer was masking something that smelled even worse. The room had only one electrical outlet (well hidden behind dingy drapes) which was coming out of the wall precariously and used for the window air conditioner. The drain in the bathtub/shower was stopped up and there was no heat in the room (temps went down to the 40s). A torn fleece blanket was offered with the explanation that the radiator had been removed in that room. I then asked the front desk staff for another room. Some time passed before I was escorted to the second room, 706, only a tad better in that it did have heat--sort of--represented by the presence of a radiator. But the "engineer," an elderly, disabled gentleman who spoke little English, had to come up and turn it on. Of course, the door to the "bathroom" (aka closet) copuld not be fully opened because it hit the corner of the bed. Once in the bathroom (good luck!) an adult ( I am not a big guy!) could not sit down facing front on the toilet--only could you wedge yourself in sidesaddle next to the sink and then get up to go beyond the shower stall to get to the toilet paper holder. After finally getting settled in around midnight, I then had to contact the front desk yet again because several neighbors on the hall--members of a tour group--were re-creating "A High School Musical." Wasn't this an episode of 'I Love Lucy?" Just remember folks--if you think it's a "bargain" on-line, check it out first. This hotel ain't no bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Just meh”
Reviews.Author: tripptrapp42
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ameritania hotel with my husband and 2 small kids. The good - the room was big enough for all of us, which I was pleasantly surprised about. The staff was great with restaurant recommendations and the hotel was close enough for my 5 year old to walk to Times Square. The bad - wifi costs $10 a day and when my husband went to sign up and pay, it didn't work. He went down to the desk and they sent him to call tech support - a call they billed us for. Tech support couldn't figure it out so they had to rig it to work. Another problem with the wifi was that the IP address for the hotel has been blacklisted for sending spam so my husband wasn't able to send email without logging in to a webmail account. The floors were also cracked and not level under the carpet. The shower leaked and my 5 year old was unable to flush the weird toilet they had. The absolute best part? I asked the same 5 year old to check under the bed for toys and she found a condom wrapper. Not ours.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it, ya'll.”
Reviews.Author: AthensNikita
