Reviews.Content: My assistant booked this hotel because it was a bargain. And to be clear, a few things about the hotel are quite nice. It has a great location, a nice lobby and attentive staff, and parking across the street which is cheap. Bedding is great. However, the hallway and my room were almost comically bad. The elevator was slow, and the hallway carpet was stained. The room was tiny, with a dim overhead light. The thin carpet covered what seemed to be an uneven floor. The bathroom literally had visible caulk smears, missing caps, and backwards-threaded hot and cold controls. There were lots of unfinished construction jobs -- holes in walls, etc. Not good. And the walls are so thin that everyone passing through the hall might as well have been in my room. I didn't feel unsafe, and I'd probably stay here again if it were even more of a bargain, but I can't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY -- NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: ProudVermonter
Reviews.Content: Service: concierge/doormen/bellhops were extremely courteous and helpful during our stay. Front desk: one (male) desk clerk insisted on checking our reservation (although the staff was labeling and taking our luggage for storage -- we arrived early and couldn't check in yet), before he would allow our two daughters (10 and 13) to use the restroom in the lobby! Very stern, very abrupt, and obviously judgemental of our appearance. (We wore what we usually wear, Lands End-type clothing and outerwear.) Granted, we weren't dressed like NY fashion models, but it was obvious that some biased assumptions were being made about our financial status, based on our appearance. Our daughters are exceptionally polite and were dressed in the same type of attire. Absolutely no need for his customer service "attitude." The cost was $338/night, and was the best deal we could find on short notice, close to Times Square. Several hotels refused us a reservation because they said that even with two beds, four people (two of which are children) would exceed their occupancy limits, and we would have to rent an additional room!! (NEVER heard of this -- plan to look into it further...) We have stayed numerous times at the Edison Hotel on 47th -- old but charming, basic, very reasonable restaurant/family friendly) but we only pay between $225/$250 a night at the most when we stay there. (They were booked.) Hotel theme is VERY modern -- not our "thing" but location, a hot shower and comfortable bed were our priorities. Lobby was bright red, cold and totally a turn-off. Second desk clerk who actually checked us in later that day was very polite. Room: poor lighting, no fan in bathroom, no light over sink, no shower curtain, just a partial glass enclosure that caused water to spray all over the floor during showers. Only TWO sets of towels, etc., and one small round soap, although our reservation was for 4 -- having to request more is irritating and insulting! Bathroom appeared clean enough -- marble floor was crumbling apart, and one large chunk was separated from the floor where it had come out, but wasn't disposed of. Toilet ran on and off all night. Beds were very comfortable. Small, old TV with cable, no real "frills." Windows weren't adequate based on the amount of noise coming from the street all night -- thankfully we could drown out some of it with the fan. Shades and curtains blocked the light very well. Furniture (chair) appeared to need cleaning, which made me really wonder about the beds! Ice bucket, two glasses, hair dryer, iron and board, coat hangers -- yup, that's it for frills! No restaurant in the hotel -- just a bar/lounge. (We wouldn't have eaten there anyway...) No other positive things to say about the place, except that I can assure you we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Matt_Walker
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at - I would not recommend it to anybody. In summary: - the rooms are extremely small. Yes, I know its NYC, but these are just tiny. The bathrooms are especially small and no room whatsoever. We had a lot of luggage and could hardly move in the room. - the beds are uncomfortable - the place is dark and unwelcoming - noisy rooms - the staff are rude. I had the doorman store our luggage, on retrieval I tipped him a dollar and some small change (I was leaving the USA that day and didn't have any more notes). He demanded we tip more as the "usual was $1 or $2 per bag". We only had three bags stored. - they could not find our reservation on check in and took nearly half an hour to get us into the room. KEEP AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but not enough room to swing a cat!”
Reviews.Author: Luce007
Reviews.Content: Firstly it was ROASTING whilst we were there and so we had to have the air con on constantly. This obviously wasn't the hotel's fault but the air con unit was old, not particularly effective and VERY loud. The room itself was pleasant and nicely decorated, it's just a shame that the bathroom was tiny, quite dirty and fairly dated. The sink was cracked and the unit underneath was broken. The toilet wasn't a great flusher. The location was fantastic; really central and everything was close by. The staff were, at best, indifferent. Check in was 3pm but we were unable to get into our room until ten to 4 (not great after you've been up for 24 hours) and have had a long flight. Staff kept coming and going and at no time did they pass on the fact that we were waiting, so we had to keep going to the desk and asking about our room. There was a 'so what' attitude and we felt like an inconvenience. We were on a month long trip around America and generally found that the standard of rooms was quite poor- this being slightly better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, dingy, depressing room”
Reviews.Author: Cinghiale22
Reviews.Content: I booked at the last minute. My first impression, upon seeing the lobby, was that I'd lucked out. However, my room on the second floor was dark, beat up and depressing. The rug on second floor hall is ripped, wrinkled and filthy. Lots of Euro guests - I felt badly that they'd wound up here. The wi-fi is 10 bucks a day, unbelievably slow and loses its connection a couple times an hour. I gave up and went to the Starbucks around the corner, On the bright side: no bedbugs, at least in room 208. Helpful doorman, too. Note to management: you might want to stop placing the cut-and-paste "Sorry you weren't satisfied" excuse/response after each negative post. It really makes you look silly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elseware, there is a noisy bar next door.”
Reviews.Author: Vdoman
Reviews.Content: I was in the city on business and stayed here for nine days. The rooms vary greatly in size. My room was actually of a good size compared to a couple of friends of mine. The biggest problem is that I had a room on the West side of the building. There is a bar next door that has a patio outside in the alley. The patrons are very loud when drunk. The shouting was louder than my air conditioner with it's fan on high! For five of the nights, I could hardly sleep. Repeated calls to the front desk produced nothing. Either the hotel is powerless to do anything... and/or the bar next door could care less. Whatever the reasons, the result was no sleep for me. If you are going to stay here, take into consideration the weather (or time of year), and if your room will be on that alley with the bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Small,dark,depressing,noisy”
Reviews.Author: sh33na83
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews of it being horrible and kept an open mind. Enter the lobby, looks lovely new chairs just arrived. thinking oh it must be being updated. Get room number 1020 and think oh floor 10?! High up, dark corridors, small room,bed,bathroom! Sit on the toilet with your knees out the bathroom door and im only 5'2! Shower smelt damp, slight mould on wall, tv was not the right colour and all blurry, hot water took forever to come thru as we were so high up. Glad we were out all day and only had to TRY to sleep there. A,C going all night outside even if ours was off it was noisy. could of done with a kettle and mini bar. Decoration poor and needed updating.Staff did not offer any help with baggage. good thing was closeness to times square. Hotel i would recommend is empire hotel. My mother inlaw stayed there whilst we were there and that was very nice, we spent our evenings there in the bar/resturant. west 63rd street.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geckojohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway to NYC. Upon first walking into this hotel, you can see the elegance of the trendy lobby - it looks all new. When we arrived, the staff and management were very nice and polite. Our room was much larger than expected - we had a great view of the city, it was nicely appointed and it was actually really quiet. This hotel is in the best location - walking distance everything and super close to Times Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an excellent place to stay when visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location,small,friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 007smiler
Reviews.Content: i travelled with my wife just last week to new york and stayed for 4 nights in this hotel.reading the reviews we were a little worried.but you have to read the good and the bad reviews and make a judgement for yourself.if there is a problem speak to the staff,they know people are writting and reading reviews so they want you to enjoy your stay and put good comments.the hotel is just being modernised but this did not affect our stay.we stayed in room 505..a corner room with views in 2 directions.great.the shower had loads of pressure.very basic but clean room.the staff were very friendly and the doorman /usher helped us out by contacting the shuttle service to arrange pick up times.he suggested an hour earlier which was correct,we would have been late to check in..thanks..ps new york is great.this hotel is ideal for short busy stays in new york

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: MalvolioBlanco
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on the corner of 54th Street and Broadway...so you are basically few steps away from Times Square or Central Park. Though interior of the hotel looks sort of 1970s like (especially the carpets would definately need cleaning or rather replacement) and the room is equipped only with some. I really liked soda vending machine just in front of our door, much better than going for drinks to the reception. So thought nothing fancy, this hotel will give you a great place to sleep over in NY for unbeatable price....

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: mahtoh
Reviews.Content: I was SO disappointed with my room at the Ameritania I actually wanted to leave NYC a day early! The only thing this hotel has going for it is location. My room was disgusting, smelled musty, bathtub was not clean (we wore flip-flops in the shower), and I'm pretty sure there were some type of bugs infesting our mattress. Everyone in our party was itchy and uncomfortable after staying here. We asked the front desk for one simple thing...new pillows...and they were never delivered.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is gross. The wallpaper is...”
Reviews.Author: khctraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gross. The wallpaper is peeling off the walls, the rooms smell, they don't offer free wifi, the walls are paper thin, I asked for non-feather pillows, and they never brought them to me, the rooms are filthy, and I'm pretty sure they have bugs in them. I was actually jealous of the people sleeping on the street. Perhaps Bloomberg can clean up the Amertania as his next project.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Keeper!”
Reviews.Author: 2010traveldiva
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about booking this hotel after reading much negative reviews, but to my better judgement (and budget) we bit the bullet and booked. We visited NY in celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary, and I have to say, we were pleasantly surprised from beginning to end. The staff was welcoming and friendly from the doorman to the front reception, and the attentive housekeeping. The House Manager, S.Ruiz, upgraded us to a King Deluxe, and upon arrival was a lovely fruit basket w/a bottle of sparkling water waiting in our room...it was a perfect setting and snack for the two of us after a long day of flight after flight. The room was spacious and clean, and yes, from other reviews a bit dim in the room and hallways and the bathroom only enough room for one, but nothing that would keep us from returning. The walls were well insulated which prevented noise to be heard within the other rooms and we had no problems with the compact elevators at all. The room and hotel itself served it's purpose for great location, a good nights sleep, comfort, cleanliness, and a hot shower with consistant water pressure (the pillows were perfect)! I would certainly stay again and again, and would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!!! Room had everything we needed!!!”
Reviews.Author: clairesangster
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site regarding this hotel we were real worried that it was going to be awful! But this was definately not the case for us we stayed in room 1008 our room was huge & clean with ample storage. And we had absolutely no problems with water supply infact the shower was great! As for staff they were all lovely & very helpful! I will be travelling to NY again and will definately go back to the Ameritania.... Dont let the bad reviews put you off because if i thought this hotel wasn't good i'd not be putting up this review i feel that all the negative comments are giving a great hotel a bad name!!!! Which it does not deserve! Thank you Ameritania for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite boutique”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: Recommend with qualifications: 1. location - too near Times Sq for my taste 2. the lobby looks very boutique-y. The room was tiny, smallest I have ever encountered. 3. the stay: I requested a quiet room with big A/C, which is what I got. I did not ask for: - a bureau whose two drawers rolled open of their own accord, making navigation around the room impossible. - no hot water in sink or shower - a non working telephone - a dirty toilet that would not flush 4. the remedy: a maintenance person appeared promptly and fixed everything. However, the following morning it still took 20 minutes for hot shower water to kick in. 5. suggestions: stay on a lower floor as apparently the higher you go, the longer the hot water takes to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: CHO2261
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to New York to pick my daughter up from college. I let time get away from me and booked late. I paid over $300 a night for this hotel. It was a total rip off. The room was very cold. The heat would not turn on. I had to sleep in a sweater and was still so cold I dreamed it was snowing. The bed was also very hard. There was only one drawer in the room to store clothes. The safe is on the floor and is very difficult to use there. The room is also very dark. The remote control for the tv did not work well. I could not change the volume. It would only turm the tv on or off some of the time. They charged $14 a day for internet service. I certainly did not bother after the first day as the connection was terrible. The computers downstairs off the lobby did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeM2
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York and we need to be budget conscious and I think the Ameritania serves that purpose. We used the SuperShuttle to the hotel, which was a scary ride if ever I wanted to be on one, but nevertheless got to the hotel. The reception was clean, but very dark. We felt the staff were ok, not over welcoming to International Guests. We also noticed that they too were of many different nationalities themselves. The complimentary Tea and Coffee is non existent, or at least was never offered or shown to us. The room was ok, it was all we needed and the bed was comfy and clean. The hotels loation is great, clsoe to the Late Show and a few minutes walk to Times Square and Central Park. If I travel to new York again, Iw ould select another hotel, just to try and see if I can find something ebtetr in its price bracket. If I have extra budget, I certainly will find something better. Otehrwise for a young couple, not not party animals who don't plan to spend their trip in the room, this serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “NOT RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: KandR56
Reviews.Content: This is the first review i have ever written for a hotel, yet my stay here was so disappointing i felt compelled to comment on this accommodation. I recently stayed at the Ameritania in July, and although the location was ideal for sightseeing, it is undoubtedly its only redeeming quality. When we arrived at the hotel the staff were unfriendly and unhelpful (which continued throughout our stay), our room was small and in poor repair, but most frustrating was the fact that staying on the 12th floor of the hotel meant that the water pressure was so pathetic that the shower was a mere dribble. Furthermore, it seemed impossible to get hot water and even more frustrating was the fact that staff seemed unwilling to help resolve these issues. In addition, i would like to provide a warning! If you should request a pick-up service to take you to the airport, be sure to VERY CLEARLY specify the exact time you would like collection, otherwise you may be stood on the hotel porch at 4.30am waiting for transport that is unlikely to make an appearance due to staff error! If you're planning a visit to NYC DO NOT go to Ameritania!

Reviews.Title: “Nice; Serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: WDC_GB6
Reviews.Content: For a weekend excursion to NYC, I wanted somewhere to crash after full days and clean myself up for the nights. With those expectations, I have to echo what's already been said here. The hotel is amazingly located; exactly what I wanted. The staff was professional and pleasant. The room was indeed small and basic, the only lighting was by lamps, the TV was wonky and the hallways were dark. But who cares? Other than sleeping, I was in the hotel for maybe 4 hours the whole weekend. My room was adequate, clean, and a good choice for my money. And for NYC, it was a bargain at the height of the summer. They have a room to leave your luggage in so after your check out, you can still enjoy the city 'til you catch your flight/train without having to haul your luggage around town. You can buy wi-fi for $10/24 hrs and there is a computer in the reception area to print your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - did the job”
Reviews.Author: NY-travalers
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location and the price was decent $200 4-5 blocks from time square right on broadway. The dave letterman show was right next door. The hotel is really on the corner of 54th and broadway. The hotel room was small with one king bed in the middle. There were a lot of small things that i could see might bother some people. Not sure if this room had yet to be renovated or what. - tiles cracked and loose in bathroom. - tv didnt work at first. needed to wiggle the plug and reprogram the remote. - slight water damage to one corner of room - expossed pipe in bathroom All in all it wasnt that bad just small things. The location more than made up for the little issues. We were there to sleep and bath so they didnt both us at all. Had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: davcates
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did not have a very good experience while staying at this hotel. We booked our trip through Expedia and payed for a Queen bed and a non-smoking room, not to difficult right? We arrived around 1:00 am and checked in. The staff was not friendly and maybe said 15 words to me upon my arrival. We got our keys and went to the room. The room was small but that was fine, until we noticed the bed was also too small. They gave us a double bed. I was told that because we ordered though Expedia the room we paid for could not be guaranteed. We were given an upgrade but when we arrived in the room the stench of smoke overcame us. I went back downstairs and settled for the smaller room for the night. We were given a "free upgrade" to a larger room a couple days later. We arrived in our room to find two double beds. Our original problem was not resolved but I was done arguing with the impolite staff. As we went to shower for the night we noticed a leaky ceiling above the toilet. I called the front desk staff and informed them of the leak and asked them to come fix it in the morning. I reminded them on my way out the door the next morning as well. Needless to say, I reminded them about the leaky ceiling for the next three days with no resolution. Whenever we had to go to the bathroom we had to put a towel over our heads to avoid being dripped on. The bathroom floor always had a small puddle. To be fair, not all the staff was impolite. Some of the front desk staff were polite but my first two days in dealing with them were not pleasant. There are other problems that we had but I don't want to take too much time. I do NOT recommend this hotel to anybody even though the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: hfudge
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Yes, the Ameritania is not the most gorgeous of hotels but I went to New York to see Ellis Island, Status of Liberty, a broadway show, empire state, etc etc NOT to sit in my hotel room!! Yes the room was somewhat dark, yes it was small, yes the bathroom was a postage stamp, yes the decor was a bit worn BUT staff were very pleasant, location was right smack in the centre of it all, the rooms were cleaned every day, beds made, fresh towels...we literally got up at 8am and got back about midnight. Room was somewhere to literally fall into bed after a days walking. BEST holiday EVER and hotel did not retract from that. It was cheap and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “RUN--DON'T WALK--AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: MEC2010
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on Thursday, June 24, 2010. The temperature was in the high 90s, but I'm from Florida. I'm used to the heat. However, in Florida we have this thing called air conditioning. The lobby seems to be air conditioned, but our room wasn't. There was an a/c unit that looked like it had been installed back when a/c was invented, but it wasn't blowing out any air, and the settings didn't seem to work. We asked for a new room. The next room was slightly cooler, but again no air coming out of the a/c unit, and the temp was set to 60 degrees! The two rooms we saw were small and dark. Even with the overhead light on, it was dark and dingy. The view out of the windows was of some some sort of dirty alleyway. We never slept in the beds, but they looked lumpy. The hallways were also dark and scary and had a wierd smell. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location as others have mentioned. I have to say that the staff was very polite and tried to be accomodating. They switched our first room with no questions asked, then checked us out again without question when I refused the second room. I have traveled a lot over the last 25 years of my adult life. I have traveled for work and for leisure. I have stayed in inexpensive motels and luxury resorts. This is the second worse hotel I have stayed in in all those years. This is the first review I have written about a hotel because I want to warn anyone else that may be considering this hotel to stay away!! There are so many hotels in NYC...GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelmingly Brown”
Reviews.Author: Eugenius
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was recommended by an online Hotel booking agency and the price for a room for 3 was good ($120 per night) However the decor is very brown and overpoweringly so.The Hotel is in a great location (10mins walk to Times Sq and 10mins to Central Park) but it is in need of a serious makeover. First problem was when we checked into our first room and the sink did not empty... we changed twice more and it is obviously a systemic problem in the Hotel(sink will take 15~20mins to empty )and so we decided to put up with it and stay.Beds were clean and comfy and the Air con worked so from that point of view it was ok. There is no restaurant but thats all right as you have all of Manhattan on your doorstep.Staff were courteous,friendly and helpful. Small bar was useful for a refreshing drink in the evening. Overall it could be much better but the brown decor made it feel dark and oppressive.Not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: FranLouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic value for the price we paid. The room was small - but that is to be expected in NYC. We travelled with a one year old, they gave us a proper cot and there was a plentiful supply of milk in the lobby all the time, so we didn't need a fridge. It's very central - close to Time Sq and Time Warner centre for shops etc. We also had two other couples in our group. One of them had a really spacious room. Staff were helpful and friendly and we would definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: Jackie2mac
Reviews.Content: I had read some bad reviews of this hotel and was slightly worried. However, I was pleased with the hotel. Our room was fine, everything we needed and the beds are so comfortable! The hotel is in an excellent location and it is right next door to this cool mexican place called Iguana. They have excellent food and it has a club downstairs where my friends and I had a brilliant night. I recommend the apple slush margarita!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Very Friendly and Helpful Staff and Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieA_10
Reviews.Content: I must say after reading all of the bad comments about this hotel I was a little worried about our choice before we got to the hotel. Then I remembered that most people never take the time to write a compliment but they will write a complaint. The room was a reasonable price, great and helpful staff, room was always clean, no dark hallways, temp was perfect in the room, and the location was the absolute best in the city. The staff helped us with cars, limos, directions, luggage, and we even needed to check out late... they were very nice and didn't even charge us. Thanks, for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - I'd return anyday”
Reviews.Author: chrisdm2312
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was kind of scared about staying in this hotel. However, when we arrived I realised that this hotel was a little gem in the heart of broadway. The lobby was nice and sofisticated, the staff were friendly and helpful. The lift took forever but it wasn't an issue. The hallways where also nice, minor stains on carpet but nothing too bad like other people have said. When we got to our room it was lovely, on the 8th floor. The bathroom was small, but it was clean and the shower was amazing, nice and powerful and prefect temperature. The Bed was nice and comfortable too, the only reason I couldn't sleep first night was from the noise outside so take ear plugs. The room was very clean and wasn't dark at all. The only issue I had was with the blinds as they where slightly broken so let a lot of light in early mornings. The maid came everyday and gave us clean towels. Overall, the holiday and hotel was a great experience. I'd certainly return here and recommend this hotel to friends/family. Thank You Ameritania.

Reviews.Title: “"I'd rather stay on the streets"”
Reviews.Author: petey69
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. The rooms were the size of a jail cell. The building was soooooooo old, you felt as if you might fall through the floors. The radiators had no heat, so we were offered portable heaters in the rooms. The bathroom was soooooo small that you had to turn sideways to sit on the toilet. For over $200 per night, you would expect more than a 12" TV. T

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joannewilde
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the best location. Staff were great, rooms were clean. We have been to NYC before, and this place was spot on for the price we paid. Only negative comments are that the bed was a too soft for me and gave me a bad back and the corridoors smelt really bad!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of professionalism”
Reviews.Author: brekbrown
Reviews.Content: I am so upset and disappointed with the initial contact with this hotel BEFORE I even have a chance to stay. First of all, I attempted to make a reservation and was kept on hold for over 5 minutes - so I hung up the phone. Secondly, I called back to attempt to complete this reservation and was called "sir" (I happen to be a woman with a deep voice). I expressed my disappointment to Diana (I think that was her name) to no avail. Thirdly, I attempted to register a complaint with the Manager in charge of the Reservation Desk (Medela-not sure of correct spelling) and was disconnected before I had a chance to speak with her. If this is any indication of what to expect after I arrived I would truly be disappointed. Last of all, the first point of contact should be a true indication and the pulse of the business. That being said...this hotel is in a world of trouble. Needless to say due to the unprofessional demeanor of the employees that I was in contact with I did not make a reservation...service to a possible guest is not high on their priority. Professionalism is none existent.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy for NYC”
Reviews.Author: krush1974
Reviews.Content: As a former New Yorker and now a frequent visitor of Manhatten this hotel is the best deal and best location for the money. The staff is polite and helpful, the rooms have plenty of space and a good size restroom. The building is right behind David Letterman and walking distance from all of broadway and even to Central Park. I have stayed all over NYC and this is a great deal. I book via CRShotels.com and get a great rate every year. I am booked to return this September.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in numerous hotels on New...”
Reviews.Author: Tkaiserman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in numerous hotels on New York but have never experienced the filth on the room that I just lived through in my recent 1night stay. The carpet was so filthy that I laid out towels wherever I walked and I wore socks full time. The white towels became black from just being laid on the floor and walked on in stocking feet with no shoes. Now that is filthy. Other people changed rooms but due to full occupancy I couldn't. change. Suggestion: check your room for cleanliness before you accept it.

Reviews.Title: “building site”
Reviews.Author: suluking
Reviews.Content: The foyer of the Ameritania is a building site with hoardings all over. No bar or seating area! We stayed here 3 years ago, it had a lovely cocktail bar and comfortable lounge. When we booked this trip the Ameritania was too expensive, so we ended up in the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. We decided to visit the Ameritanis for cocktails one evening, only to find the bar was non existant and the lounge area was gone!! Imagine if we had managed to secure a booking here, how dissappointed we would have been. It was a lovely hotel, but at the moment, check what state of "improvement" it is in

Reviews.Title: “Good location however rooms leave a little to be desired”
Reviews.Author: alandlisa
Reviews.Content: We spend 7 nights here in October 2008, the location was good however the room wasn't great. The bed was not comfortable at all and the air conditioning was not working fantastically well. Overall we wouldn't stay in this hotel again and we didn't!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and okay but nothing great!”
Reviews.Author: ugagirl96
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Ameritania for a weekend trip. The hotel was clean but the first morning we had NO HOT water! The management was very nice and adjusted our bill a little and we did have hot water for the remaining days of our stay. Great location. The rooms are small (like most NYC hotel rooms) and a little dark but it was clean and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, excellent Location, but take ear plugs!!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn17
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about staying at this hotel after reading some of the poor reviews on this site. However, I have to say that we enjoyed our stay here, and I did not find anything to complain about. If you stay in any hotel in NYC, you expect noise, so my advice is take ear plugs! We did this, and had 3 nights of blissful sleep in a very comfy bed. It did not bother us that the bar was closed, as there are so many places around the hotel, and we wanted to be out and about exploring. The staff were very friendly, and helpful. Yes, the lighting was dim in the lobby, but it was not as some folks describe it in terms of being dirtly and dingy! This hotel does not claim to be a boutique hotel, and is in the process of being refurbed. However, it is value for money, excellent location, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: adino
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick, polite staff. Room on the second floor, end of the hall. Very scared by the hallway, with old and very large stains from an important water damage. Room with 2 comfortable and clean double beds, OK bathroom, good water pressure. Room clean but 'tired', very small, tv on a dresser between the 2 beds, no space to walk around, the drawers of the dresser don't stay shut. The door has to be banged shut. The location is great, one block away, on 7th Avenue, the Stage Deli is to be tried!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Friendly centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dealseeker91
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ameritana hotel. We were in New York to sight see so spent very little time at the hotel. We found the rooms clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We did not mind having no dining room as there were lots of places within walking distance. We found it close to the theatre and to the subway lines which we used a lot. If you are looking for no frills and mimimum expense this is the place for you.We found the doorman especially helpful and friendly.We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T TAKE YOUR SOCKS OFF ! !”
Reviews.Author: RGBWarwaickshire
Reviews.Content: New York is a fabulous place to visit and we recommend everyone should do it. But 'AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS' ! A filthy, dark & dirty place, with no food, or even as much as a drink of water. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dark, Delapidated”
Reviews.Author: JBKlo
Reviews.Content: Stay only if you have limited budget. The wall paper is minutes from falling off the walls, the carpet is gross, the bathtub filled up with foaming gross water when trying to take a shower. Housekeeping must be in short supply because towels didn't get replaced, the nightstands were visibly dusty. I found a questionable pill on the bathroom counter when I checked into my room. The TV was one step away from having rabbit ears. In the lobby the chairs have grease stains from peoples heads, the table tops are chipped, the halls are dark..to hide the state of the place. I've stayed at several boutique hotels in NYC and this gives boutique hotels a horrific rep.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the exaggerated Internet photos fool you”
Reviews.Author: Delta54
Reviews.Content: It's just not what the photos promise it to be. The rooms are equipped with doors that are not even closed properly. There was a crack of light coming over every door, giving it a 'dormitory" feel. The deadbolt on the door of our room would not work and after requesting a change of room, could not have it as the Hotel was full. An "engineer" played with the lock for a while and left without it being fixed. He assured us we would be "fine" with just using the chain lock. NOT. Immediately walked 2 streets over to the Novotel and booked the remainder of the week with them. For $50 more per night, it was well worth the change. For our 1 night stay here we piled our suitcases in front of the door and slept in our clothes. The reception desk were very pleasant and visibly embarrassed, understanding and apologetic with regards to our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and dark!”
Reviews.Author: Caoimhe27
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel late in evening, walked down a depressing dirty hallway to an even worse room. Room was dark, dirty and claustrophobic. I immediately requested an alternative room, I was offered a smaller version of the room i was already given soi stayed put for the night. All trough the night there was a loud noise from the heating system, kept me awake half the night. The next morning i was straight on the phone to my traval agent to arrange alternative accomodation, I simply could not bare another night in this hotel!!! Even on a budget I would never recommend the Ameritania...

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at The Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: JenniferR82
Reviews.Content: As a young professional taking an affordable trip to NY with some girlfriends we stumbled across The Ameritania Hotel. While it was in an excellent location that's absolutely all it had going for it. The pictures online do NOT represent the hotel at all and I swore to myself as soon as I walked into our toom I would be writing a warning on here for people thinking of staying here- quite simply- DON'T! We went just last month- mid-February and we quickly realized there was no heat on in our room. The room was teeny tiny- which is by NY standards normal; however the dark, damp and cold feeling was not at all what we had hoped to experience With nothing but a space heater arriving at 11:30pm we were so excited to be in NY we grabbed a few drinks at the nearby convenience store and made the best of it. When we woke up in the morning we were frozen! The little space heater that had been placed in our room wasn't doing the trick and the bathroom was letting in a terrible draft. A glorified hostel, I hope everyone travelling to NY on a budget can find an alternative. NY is such an amazing place with so much to offer, I hope your trip will be as amazing as mine, minus the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Noisy And Dark Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrdoover
Reviews.Content: The location and price for this hotel are really good, and the rooms have large bathrooms and closets. But the rooms are very, very dark (if you wear makeup, you might want to bring a flashlight). The radiator made so much noise it woke us up several times a night and the response to our complaint from the guy at the front desk was "welcome to my world" and "do you need heat?" So be prepared for noise if you stay here in winter and need heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mitchsea1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Ameritania for 4 nights. The staff was always friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, cleaned each and every day and toasty warm with a blizzard outside. What more could you ask for at a great price and a perfect location for going anywhere North, South, East, West in Manhattan. If you are looking for lavish amenities, you can find them elsewhere, but you'll pay for it! I'm enjoying the city and just looking for a comfortable place to crash when my day/night is over. Great value......great place!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, But Good Value and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Brklynz20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania Hotel in a Delux King room for 4 nights partly on business, and partly for an extra day or two of fun. Overall, no complaints. The room was very simple, but functional. The hallways were a little dark, and the light in my bathroom wasn't very bright either (interesting for trying to put makeup on). The bell staff were great and extremely helpful. They helped with bags, directions, parking tips, and even arranged for a car service (no more expensive than a cab) to get me to LaGuardia airport upon my departure. The location of the hotel was ideal. Close enough to walk to many sights...literally 3-5 minutes walking from Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, the Time Warner Center, right around the corner from the Carnegie Deli, and (literally) just on the other side of the corner from David Letterman's Theater. This was truly the best part. Being a young female traveling solo, I was concerned about location, safety, and te ability to walk around in comfortable areas to be able to explore, eat, etc. The location of this hotel provided just that...super convenient Like I said above, not the Ritz Carlton, and not the place to stay if you expect world-class ammenities and pampering and gadgets in your hotel/room. This was a relatively simple hotel, basic provisions, and perfect for someone who isn't planning to spend much time in the room and is instead using the money they saved by staying here to go explore the infinite experiences New York has to offer. I'd stay here again for sure, and certainly hope to do so!

Reviews.Title: “One Night”
Reviews.Author: carolinainthemorning
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty good value for the inexpensive price. The hallways are dark, but the rooms are good. The hotel caught on fire the night I stayed there. Everyone got out ok, the FDNY were wonderful and the hotel comped our rooms of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GopzLondon
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but I think the Ameritania deserves one. I was there for 9 nights at the beginning of Feb. On arrival I was very pleased with location. We got an airtrain from JFK and then the E train which took us literally to the doorstep of the hotel, and it only cost $7! Way cheaper than a taxi. Anyway on getting to the room it was small but clean, and comfortable, didn't need much else to be honest, I mean after all we were in NYC! After 5 nights we were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of their suites, and again its not the fanciest but hey it was an upgrade nonetheless! (If you don't ask you don't get) I have to say Yudelka on reception was fantastic!! If you need to hire a car go 2 blocks down onto 52nd and 8th and theres Dollar rent a car there and they are very cheap compared to everyone else in my opinion. We also managed to get tickets to the Letterman show which is right below the hotel, you can go in there any weekday and request tickets (they're free). Anyway to summarise WHEN (not if) I go back to new york I would def stay at the Ameritania again!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: xshoegalx
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The loaction is amazing, very close to Central Park and Times Square. 2 extremely comfortable double beds and power shower - big thumbs up! Will definately stay here again when we next visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING BEEN TWICE AND WILL GO AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: travelagent46
Reviews.Content: Not one to write loads but just want to say what a fab hotel and fab time i had. Been here twice and (if i can ever get a good deal) would definitely go back. I am thinking of returning for my honeymoon and will speak to hotel direct in regards to anything special that can be organised. Would recommend this to EVERYONE

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AngeliqueCornwall
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania Hotel is in a great location for sight-seeing and shopping in New York. 5 minute walk to Times Square, 10 minutes from Central Park. Friendly staff, particularly those on the door. Quiet, comfortable hotel in general. Cosy rooms. No amenities but we were hardly there to have used any. Visit the mexican restaurant next door and try getting tickets for the David Letterman show just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Where being a guest means your needs are truly met & your comfort matters.”
Reviews.Author: PlaysByTheSea
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Ameritania and what I noticed from the start was the warm attention the staff gave its guests. They did everything to make me feel welcome and comfortable throughout my stay. And although I would suggest an update to the room I stayed in (the mattress dipped quite a bit and the bathroom could use some work), I was comfortable throughout my time there. Prior to my arrival I happened to speak to the hotel's manager. I mentioned that I would need a refrigerator; it was waiting in my room nice and cold when I arrived. The location of the hotel was convenient for my needs and within walking distance to many points of interest including Central Park, right around the corner from the Letterman show and many other interesting spots. One point to note is that the hotel has a bar but unfortunately it is not operating. It would have been a nice treat to be able to just relax in the hotel and have a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: born2run83
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews about the Radisson Lexington Hotel we changed to Ameritania glad we did nothing wrong with this hotel is in a good location,pretty clean and friendly staff only fault it has is it has really dark rooms and lobby's anyways we only showered and slept there why sit in your room in the middle of nyc

Reviews.Title: “Really tired looking, but good value”
Reviews.Author: lepperacaun
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the corridors are really tired and depressing looking. The toilet was right next to the sink and the bathroom door didn't lock properly but the shower was really nice. The rooms were always spotless every time we came back. One positive point about the rooms is that it was always lovely and warm which was great because it was something like minus 5 outside. There was no longer a bar at the hotel when i stayed, but they were serving free coffee which i though was really nice, and the staff were always helpful. Overall i would definately recommend this hotel as its in am amazing location, and it doesn't break the bank. I mean in fairness the rooms were terrible but who cares? They were clean and comfortable and how much time do you spend in the room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: shesewsowell
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Ameritania in Ocotober '09. Couldn't ask for a better location and though the room was small, it was very clean and the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom had great hot water and a wonderful bathtub for soaking, not too fancy but very functional. The staff was polite and helpful and the lobby was fun. Loved the big red velvet wing chair! I would say for the price we paid, we got our money's worth. If you are looking for a nice safe place to sleep and park your bags while you see the city Ameritania is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad....”
Reviews.Author: MERKPHARM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania hotel for 3 nights this month. The hotel is dodgy, but you CAN get lucky here. I say that because as slong as you don't get a room on the 2nd or third floor, you'll probably be happy. Our 9th floor room was clean, the water quality was good (contrary to other reviews here), the internet was BLAZING fast (most internet in NY hotels is SLOOOOWWW because of sooo many users and poor connection in NY), and the bed was very comfortable. Complaints: Internet is too expensive for daily use. There should be a discount plan available for more than one day like in other hotels. Most floors smell like smoke. Definately needs some serious carpet cleaning in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL AND PERFECT LOACATION”
Reviews.Author: maddy1212
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by the manager who happened to be talking to the Doorman. He walked me right to the front desk and checked me in. Room was clean, just a bit dark. I like a lot of light. The internet worked Great and the staff was helpful when I needed directions to my meeting. A few of the women that work behind the front desk are really cute and it is worth stopping in just to check them out. The most disappointing part of the Ameritania experience is that the Bar is not open downstairs. It was raining out one night while I was there and I had to run outside to bring my business some place else instead of what looks to be a nice relaxing atmosphere they have set up in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Fraz17
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I enjoyed a Thanksgiving shopping trip in NYC staying at the Ameritania. This hotel is in a fantastic location for tourists as it is around the corner from there theatre hosting the Dave Letterman Show and is only minutes from Time Square. The hotel it's self is quite basic and would benefit from a bit of a make over however it was clean and safe and the staff that we interacted with were friendly and helpful. There was an issue with the hot water one of the days but our room was warm which I was worried about having read other reviews. The hotel didn't have a restautant facilty but given the location this was not an issue. It is also very conveniently located in relation to Dollar car rental in Midtown (W52nd St.) which is very useful for anyone considering renting a car for shopping in Woodbury Common Premium Outlets. It's only two streets up which is ideal for dropping off the bags!! In summary this hotel is not plush but if you get the room for a good price which we did then the location is the main selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: McNAustinTX
Reviews.Content: Ameritania is a great hotel: euro boutique place, nice lobby, marble in bathrooms, close to subways but not in the middle of times square, friendly European staff It's always my first choice when traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, basic, good on a budget, central location”
Reviews.Author: Anon0818
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ameritania in February/March 2008 for 3 weeks. Price: The price was cheap for NY. I dont think we paid more than AUD$160. But we also booked few months in advance, and it was non refundable. I should note - at the time, the Australian dollar was about 60 cents to the US dollar. So accommodation prices were SUPER expensive for your average Aussie. Room: The room is small and just enough to move. This is New York - we didnt expect much space. The lighting is dim. We struggled to fit 4 suitcases in there. The decor was dim and dark coloured. The windows opened but with great difficulty. Our room faced the street but we were above the 4th floor and avoided any traffic noises. Our boiler/heating seems to break down every 2nd night. We constantly called maintenance to come into our room to check it. But of course, he kept assuring us that it was working fine. There were at least 2 nights we woke up completely cold - and we all went to sleep in our coats, beanies, scarves (it was snowing on the street outside). The rooms were clean and the beds were made every day. We found we had to take the toilet roll off the holder for them to replace it every so often. We were unsure of how the tipping system worked for housekeeping - but we did eventually leave a "thank you" note and a tip for housekeeping - our beds/linen were changed with greater efficiency and neatness. The carpets were a bit shoddy looking, but because they were a dark colour, I must admit most of the grot on the floor escaped my notice. Just make sure you bring a spare pair of thongs with you to avoid the grot on the floor. We did a lot of shopping in NY and left tons and tons of paper bags and boxes for housekeeping to dispose of - and they did it efficiently every day. Bathroom: The bathroom was neat and tidy. Soaps, shampoos and towels were replaced every day. I found the bathroom small, and a bit dated, but again, I didnt expect much space in New York and for the price we paid. Service: New York is all about the money - the more tips we gave, the better the service. We ordered books and electronics from amazon.com and had them delivered to the hotel. They promptly delivered it to our room without any issue. I found the front desk staff was nice and willing to listen to our complaints about the heating in our room - they always sent someone up as quickly as they could. Location: The location was FANTASTIC. We were right above the Late Night with David Letterman show. The subway was close by and easy enough to go uptown or downtown. Time Square opened late every night and it was only about 10-15 minute walk. I found the area rather safe - its a good location. All of us girls felt safe walking late at night on the street. Overall: We really only used the hotel for sleeping, showering, a quick change of clothes before we left to roam New York once more. New York has so much to offer for entertainment, the small stuff with accomodation seems to be an afterthought. I guess we weren't in our room long enough to nit pick the small stuff. I was happy with Ameritana - the staff was nice, and if you want a budget place for sleeping and showering only, then the location of this place is fantastic and for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid, filthy, wet dark rooms and water”
Reviews.Author: Chrostalk
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night, and it truly was the night from H#*L. We were in a room with a damp rug, and sloped floor beneath it. Water damage evidenced in the hallways. There was not one lightbulb higher than 25 watts. I am not exaggerating.When we asked for help with lighting, there was no solution to be given. Lights had wire baskets over them in the bathroom so it could not be changed by the guest. We could barely see to use the bath. The WATER.....tub and sink water cam out brown. We were advised to run it for 15 minutes before using. What???!!! GIve me a break! It was awful . The tub would not drain, it took over 15 minutes for thee water to leave. It also left behind dead flies. Gruesome. We asked for bottled water to be brought to us for us to use to brush our teeth. We were sent one bottle with their compliments, lol. We were in a bind because we were there to see a family member perform, and had to leave for the show. We would have run in the other direction if we could have. When we arrived back at about midnight, the room was like ice. There was no heat at all. Management took us to another room from hell...this time half the size, and with a full sized bed only. Again no heat. We were brought a space heater, very grubby, to assist us because there was no other room to again shift us over to. We were exhausted, having been traveling since 5 the previous morning. When we tried the heater, it was ALSO non functional! You just cannot make this stuff up!!!!! We decided to stay only due to sheer exhaustion. Which was also the reason I am ssure I could fall asleep that night. This room, however had a bathroom that was lit well, and had clean water. It was on the same floor as the first. It was their smallest room. The rug was filthy, Please do not even think of this place. Management was very friendly, btw, and we just wondered if they were completely blind, or thought that we were stupid to not notice the sever deficiencies! This place should be condemned, I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my gosh - what a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireMandy
Reviews.Content: I am not fussy about hotels, but this was a joke. Expensive and misleading, the room was tiny, as was the bathroom; there was no attention to detail (taps broken, window broken, door insecure, lift broken, telephone broken, only two towels for three; no facilities (bar was always shut). Promo pictures didn't relate to anything we saw. Redeeming feature was the location (if you really want to be v central), and the staff were pleasant but just ineffective.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: AshbyWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Ameritania on November 30th for a 5 day break.Flew Continental which were amazing-cannot fault them.Newark cab driver-fantastic!Hotel??????? Dark dingy lobby area dirty floors and unhelpful reception staff.Bar closed as it was the whole 5 days we were there.First room was on third floor and was in one word DIRE!Filthy bathroom-smelly sheets on the bed and no bedside lights working only a main ceiling light with a ver low wattage bulb-maybe done that way to disguise the rotn and dirty carpet.Returned to reception and requested very politely another room and they finally found us one -room 216.If you ever have the misfortune to stay at this hotel refuse this room at all costs.You would not dare walk on the carpets in bare feet as the stains are too numerous and unmentionable.The view from the windo was the central heating flue and the stair well attached to it appeared to be covered in rat poo.The bed was a king size and was clean-bedside lights worked which was something but the air con machine attached or should i say partially attached to the window let in very cold blasts of air .The radiator was balanced on cardboard and the heating in the hotel was finally switched on on Dec 1st for twenty mins and when we asked at reception if we could expect it on later in the day the male Receptionist looked at us as if we were mad!We also asked for another quilt on the bed as it was so cold and damp in the room but to no avail.There wasno tea or coffee in reception no daily newspaper as promised and the bar was never open.Because it was the monday after thanksgving weekend we had no luck getting a room at any other hotel from the Waldorf downwards!Plus the tree lighting at the rockafeller centre really pulls in the crowds. In a nutshell there will be a major complaint to our tour operator and Abta re this hotel and its cockroaches in the bathroom-oh did I forget to mention those?The list can go on much longer. However despite this appalling hotel we had the most fantastic time and saw as much as is humanly possible in 5 days and Applejacks Diner just up the street is GREAT!!! all food and staff are awsome.Gray Lines bus trips are ideal and good value to learn your way around this great city.We will be back but no way at the Ameritiana.Only good thing is the location

Reviews.Title: “NYC - the place to be”
Reviews.Author: SuperHan
Reviews.Content: the room was huge, excellent comfy beds and nice and warm, ensuite bathroom was dodgy - taps didn't work properly and you either froze or were scalded - kept having to get the engineer to fix it. free tea, coffee and drinks from downstairs bar which you could take up to your room. Great location, about 5 blocks down to Times Square and literally on the same corner as the theatre where the David Letterman show i filmed, got free tickets & had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotAlbanyNy
Reviews.Content: Location is everything when in NY for the Macys Parade and it was a great spot even though the parade route moved since we made this reservation. The place is very very old. The room was tiny, but clean. The bathroom was so small two people could not stand in it at the same time. They charged extra for wireless, had no amenities such as coffee available in the building. The biggest problem was how hot the rooms are no matter if you had the air on or not. Also the "safety Officer" kept coming on a loud speaker saying everything was fine they were just having some issues with the fire system. Im fairly sure the smoke detector in our room was not hooked up to anything. Of course I couldnt sleep after that. Doorman was great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: skml
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were really pleased with our 4 nights stay at the Ameritania Hotel. It's location was excellent. We found the staff all very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and quiet, lovely crisp white bedding and the bathroom was perfect we didn't expect to have a bath and a shower which was definitely a bonus. We would reccommend it to anybody who is considering staying in New York. It was very good value and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location! Price worthy if you don't stay indoors”
Reviews.Author: natibek
Reviews.Content: I came for 2 nights only, just to "feel" New York so this hotel was perfect for me. Reasonable price in the heart of the center of Mannhattan - which is suberb!!! Rooms are reasonably clean though look and decor are quite old. They could use some renovations but it might change the prices... The old window-AC in my room blocks the window so no view over Mannhattan, which is a shame, and it was very noisy: I wouldn't reccommend it for the summer if, like me, you can't stand heat. The staff is extremely helpful and cooperative. Maps, taxis, explanations, and more - with a great smile and kindness. Internet access is expensive! This hotel is great for budgeted people - solo travelers or a couple at the most, who need a clean bed and a hot shower. All the rest is out there in amazing Mannhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Functional”
Reviews.Author: dollax
Reviews.Content: The room does not have nothing absolutely excessively. A good bed, a good bathroom and just. The TV is old, but who goes to the NY to see TV? The localization is really fantastic, still more for tourist. The services are the weak point of the hotel. The Internet is awful and paid. It is a tip: donÂ´t stay at 11Âº floor, the ice machine is there and the racket is irritating.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a room that is super small, dirty, and overall uncomfortable then you will love the Ameritania!”
Reviews.Author: csmithweck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during a surprise trip for his 40th birthday. As we exited the elevator, I noticed the carpet looked like it had severe water damage and smelled like a molding wet towel. When we entered our room we were shocked to the very, very small size of the room. (The pictures/advertising is very misleading) The bathroom was worse! I am a tiny person , but I had extreme problems just trying to use the toliet. I had to turn sideways to get to the toliet because the sink was placed directly in front of the toliet. The entire bathroom needed a good dose of clorox bleach since mold was a part of the decor. The shower door had a crack in the glass and their idea of a repair was tape! I have noticed from other reviews that the management responds to each bad review with the same copy/paste "So Sorry" response and from looking at how many bad reviews and the time span of these that the Ameritania has done nothing to improve their hotel. I am just sorry I did not look at the reviews before staying here!

Reviews.Title: “location is the only thing going for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: moulin36
Reviews.Content: We stayed in floor 10 and EVERY MORNiNG without fail we were woken with an almighty crash of the heavy fire door opposite...everytime we were dozing back to sleep there it was,absolutely intolerable. Having stomped out to the corridor pyjama clad on morning 2,I asked the chambermaid if she could possibly stop banging the door...did it make a difference? No. That aside,the smell of the corridors were thick with stale odour like fresh air had never visites. The bar was never open and from other reviews it seems this was the same for them.The hairdryer in the bathroom worked 2 days out of 5...bonus! In summary,this hotel has the potential to be a goldmine for the owners,the location is second to none and if that's what you're after,its bearable. But attention to detail ie. Torn fabrics,stained carpets,foosty smell would go a long way to improving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: UWS_Kid
Reviews.Content: Never again. I should have known better. The internet reviews weremisleading. The bad omens started when we got off the elevator on the 11th floor. It was dank, dreary, the rugs were rumpled and the wall paper corners were turning down, a hotel down on it's luck. The room was far worse. The plaster over and around the window was flaking off and the room smelled of wet plaster. If you travel with a woman who puts on makeup, bring a flash light because the bath light was enough to let yo see there the flush handle was.The shower, though cute, looked as if they were growing cultures for the swine flu vaccine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hotel a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: JMel
Reviews.Content: I think most points on this hotel have been adequately covered in recent reviews. There is no question that the hotel has a prime location, close to most Broadway shows. The main problem is that it has seen better days and is in desperate need of a facelift. Personally that didn't bother me as it all added to the amazing experience of being in New York, but there are probably better budget hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “ehh...not terrible, not great.”
Reviews.Author: groves96
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night (Saturday) at this hotel. We checked in and were given a room on the 10th floor. I am well aware that city hotel rooms are smaller and was fully expecting it, but this room was ridiculously small. You could not have the closet door and the door to the room ope at the same time. The room smelled funky (like mold) and the airconditioner did not work. I went to the front desk and the agent was able to find another room on the 2nd floor that was much more acceptable. The only issues in the 2nd room, which I had no choice to deal with, were that there was no hot water in the shower and the shower only had half a shower door, so the water from the shower got all over the bathroom. The plus side to the hotel is that it is very close to the theaters, so I could walk to the August Wilson theater.

Reviews.Title: “location.. location but noisy! cold! bad service”
Reviews.Author: michandy6
Reviews.Content: I was one of 3 couples that spent 2 nights at this hotel we all complained of freezing rooms after the first night and the 2 couples with views complained of jack hammering all... night which continued into the second night. We all asked for extra blankets on the 2nd night with the response there was no blankets left, my poor travelling companions dealt with not only being cold but with also no sleep for the second night.In my room we had no view of broadway but walls but was grateful when we had a little mor spring in our step in the morning. After travelling 5 weeks around Europe and USA and 3 of us with birthdays I was the unfortunate one who was not acknowledged by this hotel. A note would have been thoughtful. I know our travel agent made every hotel aware of milestones within the party. Yes.. located well but as for anything else FORGET IT.. I am sure there is somewhere better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: confidencecow
Reviews.Content: Out of all of the reviews on here, I'm surprised that nobody has mentioned the beds. Easily the most uncomfortable, awful beds I have ever slept in. The hotel itself is nice. Nicely decorated, clean, helpful staff. You really can't beat the location either. But really, those beds were awful. Besides the beds, there was no thermostat control in the room, so we had the choice of broiling heat, or running the noisy air conditioner. The window opened, but wouldn't stay opened. The television was old and had a lot of static, but who stays in hotels for the TV anyway? Also of note, the room was remarkably small, and while small rooms are standard for hotels in the city, this was small by even those standards. One last positive note, the water pressure for the shower was excellent, easily the second best part of our stay next to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, slighty tardy surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: Sharpshooter357
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent; ten yards around the corner is Broadway; with Times Square about 150 yards. The hotel staff are very good, pleasant and helpful. We travelled with my wife's brother and his wife - our room was a reasonable size whilst their's was half as big again - however, our bathroom was a good size whereas their's was rather small (swings and roundabouts). One of the reviews I read about this hotel stated that there was tea/coffee available in reception (24hrs) free of charge - wrong - no tea and coffee - no facilities in room either. There is a bar but that was never open. There are areas of the hotel which need some money spent - like new chairs (or at least covers) in the reception area; new carpets in bedrooms. The floor in bathroom was made of marble tiles - one was badly broken and in serious need of attention. Our room faced into the central space which looked filthy (needed cleaning or painting); left blind down to mask the view. However, apart from air conditioning noise it was nice and quiet. Brother-in-laws room looked out onto Broadway and, despite a better view, they had traffic noise to contend with

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Nursey2009
Reviews.Content: My friend and I kicked off our 3 week trip of america with a 4 night stay in NYC and the location of this hotel was excellent. Easily within walking distance of times square, bus tours, central park, 5th avenue and broadway. The hotel was comfortable however the rooms and beds were very small. We were on the top floor and the lifts took ages to arrive but we had no choice unless we wanted to run up 12 flights of stairs in the new york heat. The air con in the room was also very noisy we had it off most nights. The main issue however was the water it was either freezing cold or boiling hot and the tap was faulty so there was nowhere in between. When we got maintance in to have a look he said we had to wait for the water to come from the basement so let it run for 10mins until it was hot!! However that did not work so we gave up and lived with cold/boiling hot showers! One other minor grumble was the lack of glasses and ice bucket even though there is an ice machine, however we were supplied with these as soon as we asked. The hotel in general is also very dimly lit and the bar was never open. We were barely in the room though and loved the city so it was a fine hotel for our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Phew, I was worried”
Reviews.Author: Findochty
Reviews.Content: Hi, My friend and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. When we arrived there, they had us booked in to a double room, when I said that I had specifically asked for a twin room (love my friend dearly, but won't sleep in same bed!!!), they said that they did not have one available, but they had upgraded us to a king size room. I said that this was not good enough. They obtained a folding bed for me. They were going to move us the next day to a twin room. However during the night we soon realised that if we were at the front of the hotel, it would be noisy. So we opted to stay in the room we were given. It was large, the bathroom was a good size. We were in room 712, just in case anyone wants to request a room. You have to expect noise. Goodness you are in the heart of new york city. The location is fab. Only a five minute walk from central park, 5th avenue, times square, broadway etc. So to anyone already booked, dont worry and to anyone thinking of booking, its a great, value for money hotel. And the room was cleaned every day, beds made, fresh towels Go for it. Regards Happy travellers

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel. Serves Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: davidnorton
Reviews.Content: I took a group of travelers here for a few meetings with companies. The hotel has a perfect location. I would recommend getting a room with a street view, as the inside rooms do face each other. The front desk staff were second-to-none. We were checked in prior to arrival (which is helpful considering I had 12 rooms booked). The price they gave us for group travel was not matched by anyone in the area. They even gave me a better room for being the booking person at no extra charge. The bar is small but friendly. I appreciated the morning coffee very much, as we tried to make the most of the nights in the city while still having morning meetings. Overall, I would most certainly stay here again. Not only is this hotel part of a great group in NYC, but the hotel is fantastic within itself.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: hithyrd
Reviews.Content: Many people are going to New York to see the sights so you'll want your hotel to be a base where you can just crash for the night. This is exactly what we did and it fits that purpose. The room was clean - mine was large but I did book the deluxe room as I saw they had a promotion when I booked. The hotel is very dark - the rooms and the hallways - if they only sorted that out it would give the hotel a much better feel. You're 2 minutes from David Letterman and 10 minutes from Times Square - it's a fantastic location and allows you to walk rather than taking the subway. When we checked out they did charge an extra $10 or so onto our bill which was some occupancy tax that wasn't on my original confirmation so just something to bear in mind. Also we asked them to book us a taxi and they had some problems with getting the cars so we shared a 'limo' with another party. This was fine by us but they still charged us the same price - I did expect a slight reduction. Not sure if this is something they do regularly to make money???? Tip: Cafe Metro which is one 'Avenue' over is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: gembx
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews the night before i left i was worried...untill i got there. The location was fantastic and staff are really helpful and friendly. The room was so clean, cleaners came every day, and it was big enough. I dont know why the other people who stayed here had comments so harsh. Who watch s TV anyway when staying in new york?? Yes it was an old TV but signal was perfect(for what we did watch it) If i had to complain it was that our room looked onto 4 walls of the hotel but after our trip i was grateful of such a view! Who wants to look onto a busy street with taxi s and cars beeping all the time, i was lucky it was 4 walls we looked onto. Ok it was cheap but 100 times better than i could have imagined. The other people must be used to staying in 5*+ because i had no complaints! I WOULD stay here again and cant wait to go back, please dont be put off by the other bad comments, im definately going back there!!! Our belongings were safe(someone commented on the cleaners) there were no cockroaches(again some other comment) and it was absolutely fine in every aspect. Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid Avoid AVoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: c_bolt9
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel after being reviewed from the times. All I can say is clearly it was a set up as this was one of the worst hotels I have ever been in. We stayed in the Chandler in December 08 and although small it was clean, modern and very comfotable. I would reccommend this to anyone. Where do we start with this place. First room smelt of mould. Had the wall paper hanging off the walls. It was simply a disgrace. By the way we paid extra for this room (Deluxe). After complaining we were moved to a second room. Air conditioning unit poored water onto the carpet floor so when turned on the carpet was drenched. The shower took 15 mins to warm up. There was no plug for the sink. We must have been lucky as the sink in my parents room did not let the water go down. The chair in the room was dated and ripped and the Beds were basic. The next day we thought enough was enough and walked to the Hilton two blocks away on 1335 Avenue Americas and booked into there. Fabulous. Would recomend this place for an extra $60, as well as Chandler (near the Empire States Building) Do not be fooled by the pictures on the website for the Ameritania as cleary not all the rooms are like this. Maybe just the one which the Times reviewed. To add insult to injury they wanted to charge me for a duluxe room after we were moved to a standard room. After refusing to pay they eventually changed this which is detailed on my receipt. However on returning home they have charged me for the duluxe room whichI am still trying to get back Seriuosly avoid this place but if you do book it make sure you avoid rooms floors 4 & 11 and demand a modern room. P.S - In speaking to othert epople thay had also been moved and were glad to be leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... The hotel not so much”
Reviews.Author: Mup3t
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Ameritania Hotel from 1 to 6 of September... We arrived at JFK late so we took a cab to the hotel (45 dollars). When we arrive at the hotel we liked the entrance and the lobby... The staff was also very nice. Then we went up to our room (Room 420) and I must say we was very dissapointed... We've stayed at small rooms before but this was really, really tiny... Only had space for the bed and a 1970's TV... The window was stuck so it didn't open and it didn't isolate the light in the morning. The bathroom was also tiny and nothing special. The AC was also boiling when we first entered the room... We had to turn it off. Our luck was that we went to dinner at Times Square and when we got back the room temperature was lower (and nicer). Overall, although this hotel has some good points I would recommend that you stay somewhere else in New York... There are better places for not much more money. I hope that this have helped and any questions feel free to ask ;)

Reviews.Title: “Location superb but that's all that's good about it”
Reviews.Author: Elvisiswithme
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 4 nights staying at the Ameritania Hotel New York. The location as everyone else has stated is excellent. If you are arriving from JFK airport then the subway is just a block away, will save you money instead of using cabs. The Ameritania hotel is just far enough away from the madness of Times Sq but central enough to not have to walk far before you are in thick of it. My friend and I were over to attend a friends wedding. The hotel is fairly basic. I must say unlike some we did not have a small room it was large enough for 2 double beds, wardrobe space, tv unit, safe and desk. My friend smokes so we had a smoking room on the 3rd floor, which was a it smelly but then I'm a non smoker. The room was very noisy, there seemed to be a permanent generator running outside the window a constant smell of chinese food. All in all this hotel is absolutely fine if all you need is somewhere to crash and a fantastic location. What else do you need in New York if you're on a budget?! The staff were great, the bar was good and the room was clean. However, if this was a romantic weekend booking then I would think again, I would not stay here with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gloeire
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, travelled with husband & friends. We got good size room with good size bathroom.
