There was plenty of room for suitcases and all the shopping! 3 friends shared another room which was very small in comparison, there was not enough room for 3 suitcases and their bathroom was tiny, you had to back into it! Overall hotel was clean, good price and good location. Safe were quite friendly for New Yorkers! We'd recommend it to others no problem, just off broadway beside David Letterman show, about 10 minute walk from time square. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Position for seeing the city”
Reviews.Author: macduffLancashire
Reviews.Content: First impressions of hotel was it looked a bit dated. The bedroom was smaller than expected but adequate(you don't go to New York to sit in a room), the bathroom was large and the bed was very comfortable. Everything was very clean. There was no view from the room window but hey wait while you hit the streets! The only compaint was that there was not enough cupboard space and there were no facilities in the room for making tea/coffee. This hotel is in a fantastic central spot for getting to all the sights, 10 mins stroll to Times Square and about 15 mins walk to Central Park and there are plenty of bars and restaurants and coffe shops very close by. If you want a clean comfortable budget hotel this was ideal and I would stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit dark in places, but good, clean and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: JTop
Reviews.Content: I do not understand the other reviews given recently to this hotel. I can confirm there is wireless because I am writing this review from my room at the Ameritania. The price is steep though. 35$ for 3 days. I have paid more in other places though. In regards to cleanliness I have absolutely no complaints. My room is adequetly clean. It is a bit worn just like the rest of the hotel, but come on, its new york city. Its suppose to be a bit worn. The rooms, hallways and lobby could use some more light though. Concerning the size of the rooms I do not understand complaints about this. Its a bit smaller than your avarage hotelroom yes. But I could still swing a tiger in here without its whiskers touching the walls, let alone a cat. I did not talk a whole lot with the staff. They were friendly and effective at checkin, but were unable to recommend a steak house in the area and in failing to do so instead directed of to an english pub (Old Castle) where they however did give 10% discount to Ameritania guests. Last words will be on the location because seriously thats why you really book this hotel. Its right on Broadway, and close to the park. Disregarding everything else in this review you should choose this hotel just for that (and the price obviously).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: MichaelHongKong
Reviews.Content: I think that it was the worst hotel which we have ever been. Cockroaches running here and there, very weak shower water, no hot drinking water suppy. Dusty carpet, dirty beddings, leaking bath tub, dim corridor, slow motion elevator......

Reviews.Title: “Average don't expect a lot”
Reviews.Author: GeoMoo
Reviews.Content: We looked for months at reviews on hotels and it was sucha hard choice to make. Unless your staying at the Plaza, you probably won't find great service in New York. We eventually decided on the Ameritania. To make it easier for you to read I have bulleted my review: 1. Great location (few blocks away from Central park and Times Square) all walking distance 2. Bell Hop Service - decent 3. Exterior Hotel Appearance - not that appealing 4. reception Appearance - ok, seems stylish, but rather dark and quiet 5. Reception Staff - average, not all that fluent in english... even the American ones had trouble understanding me... all I wanted was a Pen.... long story. 6. Elevator - Gross 7. Lobby Toilet - Gross 8. Tea and Coffee - non exhistant bar was always closed 9. Passage Ways - clean but a bit dark 10. Room - very small but comfortable bed 11. Carpets old and dusty but clean 12. Bathroom - this was ok, but old fashioned plumbing 14. Furniture - slightly damaged but who cares (chips on the corners) 15. Electronics - ancient, TV was like the 1980's so was the huge bedside alarm and telephone But we hardly stayed at the hotel, but on average it was ok, and at least the beds were cleaned daily! Ok if your on budget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Karatedoc
Reviews.Content: To say that our experience staying at this hotel was horrendous is an understatement! Everything about this hotel is cheap, tacky, drab and be quite candid disgusting. We arrived in New York after a seven-hour flight and we were hot and in need of a shower. We booked into ourl room; went into the very small shower room and tried to turn on the water - guess what, no water. Apparently, the hotel was having problems with the water supply to our floor so consequently we just had to use baby wipes to freshen ourselves up. The rooms are very small (not enough room to swing a cat) and the dim lights hide a multitude of problems. If you are looking for a room merely to sleep in and you don't mind where it is then it will undoubtedly fit the bill but if you are looking for an "all-round" hotel experience then my advice would be stay well away. There are other hotels in this area which are more modern, better located, offer better amenities at roughly the same price. A resounding " do not recommend" is the only recommendation I can give.

Reviews.Title: “cheap”
Reviews.Author: billboy22
Reviews.Content: no bar or coffee in lobby good locaton room small facing a wall bathroom small

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ragtradeEastCoast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter and "older" mother after losing out on my prior room. These reviews had me SO unsure what to expect. Yes some rooms ARE small but this IS New York. The room we had was amazing. Down comfortors and pillows armoire and a walk in closet. Comfy beds. Bathroom was small but no smaller than a guest bathroom in a private hoom. Staff was courteous and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Awful - if you have booked this change it!”
Reviews.Author: keelan2121
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Ameritania for 5 nights last November and this hotel is horrendous! The rooms are extremely dated and unclean, the hallways smell like sick and urine and due to the 1920's windows the noise levels are appalling. If pushed for a positive remark about the hotel, i would say that it is in a great location. It was not one the the cheapest hotels in NYC but it is by far one of the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kamery
Reviews.Content: We stayed to attend an event at Central Park. The location was perfect for everything we wanted t do, including shopping and a visit to Times Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room (on the 11th floor) was clean and comfortable. I have stayed at many national chain hotels,etc. in the city. They are fine, but we liked the character of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: SusanMEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Had read a lot of mixed reviews about this hotel before we went there, and was a bit worried about what it would be like however I was pleasantly surprised. The location is superb - which is what everyone has said, but also I found the staff helpful. We had asked for a roll away bed which wasn't there when we arrived, but we just asked and it was brought up - no problem. Other reviews had said no hot water, but the showers were fantastic! It's quite tricky working out how the taps work, but once you do no problem at all. Yes, the room was noisy, but that is because it is in mid town Manhattan - and traffic goes by all night, but just keep the window shut and the air conditioning on if it is too hot and you don't notice. We got clean towels and sheets daily, the room was fine for us if a little cramped but we were never in. You really are in the centre of things - five minutes to Times Square, two minutes from central park! Would definitely stay there again when visiting NYC. Thoroughly recommend this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Dingy Dirty Dump!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sofiazeta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009 for 5 nights. We were given a room on the 11th floor which was extremly dusty, had smelly curtains and carpet and a very unsavoury big black mark in the bath. To prove that the room was not cleaned up to standard, I placed a line with my finger on the very dusty cloak radio which remained there for the duration of our stay. We were lead to believe that there would be a 24 hour cappuccino machine at our diposal, however this was unavailable. The staff werenÂ´t particulary helpful and the lift was on its last legs and grubby! The only positive thing that can be said about this hotel is its location. Very central and accessable.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the Lift”
Reviews.Author: cmd00
Reviews.Content: We stayed this weekend just gone for Saturday and Sunday night...It was diabolical. First things first after a long flight from Ireland we wanted to have a shower - but the water was freezing. When we told reception, they didnt even seem a little bit bothered about it. They said leave the water running for 10/15 mins and it wll heat up?? Our room was not very clean and the bathroom was very old, tiny, the shower leaked everywhere and the toilet would not flush. Then on the Sunday morning we were rushing to get Broadway tickets and our lift stopped mid-floor. When we pressed the speaker - it didnt ring to anyone. Then we pressed the alarm, and kept pressing it..it was hot in there and we wre there for 15 minutes. Eventually we were shouted at to stop pressing the button, quite rudely. The lift moved and we got out on the 2nd floor - but there was no one there.We walked downstairs and there was a man there who asked how we got out. We asked him had he not let us out and he said "no, it must have been God??" No one apologised at all or asked us were we alright! Final straw was when we had no towels left for us in our rooms and we had to ask and wait - again. It was all a very odd experience but it did make us laugh. At a time now where customer service is key, I would seek out a bargain elsewhere rather than stay at this hotel....nothing about it was good and the people were just downright rude!

Reviews.Title: “Eh Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: monkey24
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the hotel around 10AM, we were pleasantly surprised that a room was available at so early a time. We were given a room on the 11th floor. The hotel had a nice lobby and hallways, but the room did not have the same matching quality. The bed was ok (could tell it was worn and old) and the room was very dimly lit. We didn't have hot water and it took several phone calls to the front desk and almost an hour before we found out there was a problem with the boiler and the whole building didnâ€™t have hot water. Eventually, after over an hour, we could take a shower. The bathroom was very small and the toilet was pushed up so far against both walls that it made it hard to flush. The base that the sink rested on was made of wood and completely rotting away. The TV worked half the time we were there (three days) and took several phone calls to the front desk to have it fixed. Overall, the price is good, the location is good, but that is about it. If you're picky about the way your room looks, then I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: Tephlon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights. The lobby looks great ad expensive, the rooms aren't as good. Room was clean but had a slightly used look to it. The door to the (more than adequate) bathroom wouldn't close. Lack of closets was a bit of an issue, as we don't really like living out of our suitcases. Check in was quick, staff was very nice/professional. Location is GREAT. (4 or 5 blocks from Times Square, around the corner from the Letterman show)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarpeNoctum_23
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel with a great Midtown location. NYC hotels tend to be expensive and are often not worth the money, but this hotel was actually pretty good! It was pretty clean and the furniture was in very good shape. We had two people stay in a standard room and two in deluxe - definitely choose deluxe if you decide to stay there! believe me, it is worth it! I stayed in the deluxe and the room was pretty spacious and nice. The standard room was small, the kind where you come in and there's just the bed, not really much space to put the bags down and walk around. The view from that room was a lovely brick wall of the adjacent building. The staff was very nice and very helpful when we needed information on getting to the airport. Overall, it's a great hotel for staying in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “do you like a flea bag?”
Reviews.Author: deboles
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling with a strict budget in mind do not stay here! Shall I list a few reasons?: Broken elevator, dirty rooms, constantly flowing toilets, broken shower head, leaking tub, lumpy squishy mattresses, dark rooms, ill-fitting, in-window AC so street noise is ridiculous ALL night. I could list More but my blood pressure is getting Higher and Higher! There were many foriegn travelers there and I was embarrased that this was their US experience....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to rest your head - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jbrett
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you just want to rest your head, and what more do you want when you are in New York. The room was clean and the staff were friendly. The bathroom was tiny and we had a few problems with the shower but it soon rectified itself. We stayed on floor 11 and had a good view out of our window. The room is basic, bed, tv, phone, radio no mini bar or fridge. There are some nice diner palces nereby too. The best thing about this hotel is the location, you are just a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park. We walked most places and didn't even use the subway but we did use the hop-on hop-off bus which was great. I would have no qualms about staying here again for the price you can't beat it for location

Reviews.Title: “Botox makeover...”
Reviews.Author: HangLekiu
Reviews.Content: We entered the hotel and was immediately impressed by the chic lobby. Post-modern deco that was more Sanderson than Hilton. Our initial thought was, we bagged a bargain. Unfortunately though, with this hotel, beauty was skin-deep. The rooms that we were assigned to were done-up in a manner akin to a shoddy botox job. Squirts of modern touch, did not do enough to conceal its underlying shabbiness. Peeling wallpapers, blinds that would not stay up, toilets that do not flush well. The safe, which sat under the old fashioned tube telly, had four exposed AA batteries adorning the thick steel door. We ended up locking our valuables in our suitcase as we weren't sure that it's safe to store our things in a safe that has exposed electronic circuitry. Better a canvas bag than risk our valuables locked away for good in a steel safe! During our stay, one of the two lifts broke down. Rush hour was especially bad as we had to wait up to 10 minutes at a time to get from our floor to the lobby. Going down the stairs is an option, but with a stroller and kid in tow, not a practical one. On the subject of kids, if you are travelling with one, this is definitely not the hotel for you - unless you are in the habit of travelling with a kettle. There is no restaurant in house nor was the bar ever open for us to fill up our flask with hot water. When asked about the kettle-less hotel, all the staff could offer was, "Bring the bottle of milk downstairs and the houseman can heat it up with a microwave". In the end, we got into the routine of filling up our flask twice daily at the ever-friendly Starbucks across the road. We are not spoilt travelers as we have stayed in physically shabbier hotels. But on these occassion the hotels first of all, do not try to sell itself as something it aspires to, rather than what it really is. Secondly, we have somehow been somewhat lucky that the shabby hotels we've stayed in are manned by friendly staff. Unfortunately, the staff at Ameritania, were curt. During check-in we were not greeted by the receptionists with the usual pleasantries as one would expect at hotels. In Japan, they would lose their jobs to Aibo the robot - cold and emotionless. Upon returning our room keys, I waited for the receptionist to say that all is well and done. But all I got was, "Is there anything else you need?"... I bid my farewell for the first and last time. I did get the feeling however, that the hotel does not care if I would return. As mentione by many reviwers, the hotel location is about the only positive thing about the hotel, especially for the price we paid. But do keep your expectations in check!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vicky_b_09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania hotel for two days for a quick tour before we headed down to Florida for the rest of our holiday. I trawled the internet looking for a reasonably priced New York hotel, only to find our budget stretched to B+B's and hostels with shared bathrooms. I came across the Ameritania on the Travel Republic website where the rate was approx. Â£100 per night and after looking up the hotel on tripadvisor I was dubious about what we would find upon arrival. We were very pleasantly surprised by this little hotel. The room was adequate and had plenty of space for the two of us to share. We had a room on the 6th floor, with a view over part of broadway, it wasn't quiet at night but then I wouldn't ever expect a New York hotel to be, surely that's part of the experience? As previously mentioned by many other reviewers, the location is amazing! 5 mins away from Time Square with good transport links to everywhere. We used Time Out's 2009 guide and managed to find a couple of nice restaurants. One that was especially unique was El Centro (at the corner of 824 Ninth Avenue & 54th Street) a small mexican restaurant which is amazing inside. Really good food too! Try the Iguana Bar next door to the Ameritania for amazing cocktails, mmm! I was quite shocked by how expensive New York hotels are but I was so glad we managed to find the Ameritania. A hidden gem who offer good value prices rather than ripping you off. You shouldn't be coming to NY to enjoy the inside of a hotel room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: tonybeardsley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and having read most of the reviews prior on trip advisor had alot of concerns before arrival. true to the reviews the hotel is poor by any standard. The reception staff were unhelpful when asked for information and general questions. There is a bar which has been closed for some time and has no other area for any form of catering. There are two lifts of which one was broken during our stay which was a real pain for the duration of our stay. The general up keep of the building is very very poor. Paint work and wall paper dirty and peeling while the carpet looks well past its sell by date. The room itself as many other people have said is very dark. in fact the main light in the room is pointless as there are two wall lights which give more light. The room was very dim and was added to by the fact that everything in the room is a dark colour. The carpet was in poor condition and smelt old and stale. The bathroom was atleast clean although the bath was tiny. The room was generally small and dingy and to be honest quite depressing. I have heard other horror stories of no hot water,broken windows and lack of air con. We had none of these problems, although I was given the tip to ask for a room higher up to avoid the noise from the street below. There was only one good point to the room as the bed was very comfortable. In the room itself there was no facilities for food or drink....no kettle for example. There is a T.V in the room although many of the channels had poor reception. We stayed in this hotel purely for the location it is really good, walking outside turn right and you can see time square. If you are going to stay in this hotel(dont!) There is a fantastic Mexican restaurant as you turn left out the hotel. This hotel has one major redeeming feature though as they have a doorman called Jeff who happens to be one of the friendliest and best sources of information i have ever met. This hotel is lucky to have this guy as he is real gentleman. Cutting to the chase this hotel is very poor and nothing more than basic at best but the location is excellent. I certainly would not stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “-9 degrees with air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: sassy1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two night before boarding the queen mary. The temp when we arrived was -9 degrees when we were taken to our room the air conditioning was on and the window would not close, it was brass monkeys. The room was dirty but we had hot water which was a blessing as we were freezing. The location is fantastic 2 steps out of the hotel and you have times square.

Reviews.Title: “crap hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: castewil
Reviews.Content: superficial makeover fails to hide that this is an old and poor quality hotel. rooms are noisy, poorly appointed and not clean. Okay the location is pretty good but that's about the only positive point. I would NOT recommend this hotel unless you're adamant on having a hotel on broadway.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION - shame about the noise outside!”
Reviews.Author: GLCDover
Reviews.Content: Was concerned about this hotel having read previous reviews. However, hotel was fine, ideal central location. We were 4 females, 2 adults and their daughters (17 & 18 yrs), we shared a room that had 2 double beds. Room was large enough for us all, bathroom was adequate with plenty of hot water. Room was very warm but we managed to turn the heating off! Being close to Times Square etc. it was very noisy and we found it difficult to sleep. Doorman very friendly and helpful. Only gripes were that they have stopped serving complimentary coffee in reception, the bar was being refurbished and there was a smell of stale smoke in the corridors New York was interesting spent 3 days on tour buses! Extremely cold during our 5 days there. Enjoyed our break but went home extremely tired!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: pemtca
Reviews.Content: It's not luxurious, but if you want a comfortable, clean midtown hotel for a great price it's hard to beat the Ameritania.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean comfortable - AMAZING location”
Reviews.Author: malibu21
Reviews.Content: We visited New York and stayed in Ameritania for 3 nights in March and I knew what to expect thanks to trip advisor. From my previous posts you will see I'm not a negative reviewer, however, Ameritania was basic, but the bed and bathroom were clean, and cleaned every day we were there. The room we had, 408, faced onto Broadway and an office block so it was really noisy and you had to keep the blinds closed or the office workers would get an eyeful! The windows are paper thin and ours didn't close properly which made the noise worse but to be honest we were so shattered every night after sightseeing around amazing New York, we left the tv on low & we soon nodded off. If your a light sleeper, as many reviews have said, ask for a room without a view. We asked for a non smoking room and when we opened the door we were hit with the stench of stale smoke & cigarette butts had been thrown out onto the balcony - so it was def not a non smoking room. I couldn't be bothered complaining about it as our room was actually quite nice compared to other pics of rooms I'd seen on here so we just sprayed the room with copious amounts of deodorant/perfume & opened the windows - which was fine cuz the room was roasting anyway. Couldn't get the smell away from the bathroom tho even after 3 days! On the day we left there were 2 women checking in & the man at reception asked if they wanted smoking or non smoking & when they asked about best rooms he said it didn't really matter - obviously smokings allowed in every room then they'l just take the ashtray out & say its non smoking! Sorry I know i've gone on about this a bit but i HATE the smell of smoke! Only other bug bear was the tea/coffee making facilities which were meant to be complimentary had an out of order sign on the whole time & I saw one of the cleaners using it to fill up his bucket! And the staff at reception were ok but not the most forthcoming - I didn't feel like I could ask them anything without being a pain. Doormen on the other hand were fab. When you step out the hotel you are literally 5 mins from times sq, 10 from central park and it really is the best location! The tag line for the hotel chain was, budget accommodation in the best locations & this was def true! New York is an amazing place, we were totally shattered by the end of the 4 days but we managed to do everything we wanted so really, the hotel didn't matter. We were on a budget, so this was ok for us, but if you can afford it, pay a bit more. We went to see the sights of New York not spend 4 days in a hotel room. We had a fantastic time in New York but the hotel wasn't the best. Tip - go to Ellens stardust Diner for breakfast, lunch or Dinner - it was so fun & really woke us up in the Morning! Also Famous Famiglia Pizza, I know its a chain but the pizza is AMAZING!!!! And I'd recommend top of the rock as opposed to Empire State for a view. Oh and Godiva - AMAZING chocolate covered strawberries - expensive but sooooo good! Any questions, just ask!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel with all you need and that location!!”
Reviews.Author: pinin_prestatyn
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from six nights at the Ameritania, 23-29March 2009. I had previously read some negative reviews, however they mainly seem to have a problem with the size of the rooms and the lighting. I honestly couldn't give a rats *bottom* how big the room is, you're at the hotel to sleep and as long as there's a bed in there I'd be happy! *THE ROOM* I was pleasantly surprised. My room (1122) was higher up and did not have the excellent view afforded some rooms, I requested this as I'm a light sleeper and the receptionist said "it's either a view or quiet, you can't have both" I'll stick a picture up of my view, overlooking other rooms. I was happy with this as the room was, as promised, blissfully quiet. The room was a decent size, including a television with 30-odd free channels (including NY1, Which has the temperature displayed permanently - handy) a safe to store valuables, Powerful shower in the bathroom with complimentary shower gels, shower cap etc, and a writing desk with a lamp. The rooms ARE dingy, but if you put the main light on along with both bedside ones and the one on the writing desk, there's enough light. The air conditioning unit was loud but pumped out plenty of cool air, a must as the rooms are heated more than I was comfortable with. The windows open too which is a bonus. An ice bucket was provided: I stuck loads of ice in this from the ice machine on our floor and used it as a fridge! The room was cleaned to a high standard daily. The room was clean when we arrived. The corridor carpet appeared stained, like it was damp, and a trip to the ice machine in stockinged feet confirmed that areas were wet! No idea why this is, but just wear shoes and you'll be fine. The room was not wet or damp in any way. I managed to block the toilet (!) and a quick call to reception, a handyman came five minutes later and unblocked it. A couple we arrived with had a couple of issues with their room; the air conditiong didn't appear to be working for one. I have no issues at all with the room, I thought for the price it was excellent! Staff were helpful at all times. *HOTEL* The bar is no longer open, this isn't really an issue as there are two good bars right next door, or plenty more in times square and surrounding area. It can be expensive though around this area, especially if you are travelling from Britain, as the pound is so weak against the dollar compared to what it was (1.35dollars to the pound when we went!) I'd recommend Greenwhich village for a good night out at cheaper prices, more studenty = cheaper!! and better atmosphere, less touristy. But I digress... *LOCATION* The hotel is in a fantastic location: right in the heart of the action. You have the following within a ten minute walk: the empire state building, Central park, FAO Schwartz toy store, Radio city music hall, Fifth avenue Times square and all the broadway shows. The rockefeller centre, macy's and most other things are just a little further. You can see times square lit up like a beacon as soon as you leave the hotel! It's also right next to the Late show with David Letterman, unfortunately they were not filming on the days we tried for tickets, But I'd recommend you do so if you have more than 4 days there. You can do the main touristy stuff in a long weekend, if you don't mind walking! *SUMMARY* so in summary then, I'd have to give this hotel 8 out of ten. The location is one of the best, my room was clean, a good size, and had everything i needed. The staff were helpful. Everything worked. It was cleaned daily. The door staff would help you hail a cab any time. If you want the best location and don't want to pay top dollar, this is your hotel! ignore those moaning about trivial things - remember you'll only be at the hotel to sleep and shower! I would definately stay again. *TIPS* get your essentials from the DUANE READE stores, they are all over and far cheaper than elswhere. You can use most cards over there, my HSBC one was 2.5% up to five dollars for withdrawing money: that would have been better value than using the post office to get your dollars, and you wouldn't have to lug it around at the airport either. I'd just take my card next time with hindsight. Take out a bus tour, I'd recommend City sights NY. it's $80 for their complete bus ticket, that includes the uptown and downtown Manhattan tour, Brooklyn tour, Brooklyn at night tour (unparalleled views of brooklyn bridge and Manhattan at night) ferry around manhattan cruise, Entry to either the ESB or top of the rock observatory and a Statue of liberty and Ellis island immigration museum tour. By far the best way to view manhattan, the guides are knowledgeable and you can use the bus like a taxi service to any destination! Hope this doesn't look like complete waffle and comes in handy to someone! if anyone has any questions for a brit that's just returned from Manhattan, feel free to contact me. Regards Matt

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan on a budget”
Reviews.Author: walkerwink
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is outstanding! It is near Time Square, Central Park, and all types of transportation. The staff seemed to be less than outgoing, but hey It's New York...no southern hospitality here. The hotel is small, the rooms even smaller and the elevators are tiny and slow. I was unable to adjust the room temperature, as the A/C-heater unit had seemed to be on its way out of service. The marble floor had loose sections. The fixtures in both the shower and on the sink were loose. And the TV was the same model I had in 6th grade...."I'm 29!"....So overall the Hotel is very clean, affordable, and in a great location....But if you can afford to spend a few more dollars elsewhere, spend a few more dollars elsewhere. E.W.W------Chicago, IL

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: minika
Reviews.Content: I've been on the journey with two other girlfriends and stayed in NY for 4 nights. Hotel is located on excellent place and most of NY attractions are really close, as well as metro station. We had reservation for 1 Triple (1 bed and a rollaway). As we came in hotel they gave us a suit for the same price, which we appreciate. The third bed at our suit was not fresh made, the bedding was dirty. Otherwise the suit was clean but really dark. The stuff seamed nice and friendly but as I asked what are the options for buying ticket for Mamma Mia, they served me a story as they are the only one who can provide us a ticket for a very good price of 150 $. As we got our tickets from them , waiting at reception, we found out that the price on the ticket is 67,75 $. We got seats in the back, and as we came for the show, there were still tickets at the ticket office. We felt cheated by our receptionist and were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What more can you ask for on a Trip to New York - We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: KAShepherd
Reviews.Content: We went to New York on Jan 31st till 4th Feb in 2008. I feel it neccessary to write this review as the hotel does get a bag of mixed reports and after booking and reading these I was quite worried about what we would find. The Hotel is small, contempory and clean. What more can you ask for when you are never in your hotel anyway? We arrived to be greated by friendly staff and shown to our room by the porter. Our room was small but clean, we wouldnt have wanted it any bigger. The bathroom was small too but clean and adaquate for what we needed. There was enough room to put our clothes away in the wardrobes and draws and a desk for all our bits and peices. The bed was comfy and the sheets were changed every day. The only problem we had was that the heater was on full blast and we couldnt turn it down, we never complained about it as it was Janaury and I would much rather it be hot than cold, we just opened the window a little while we were out. It was noisy on a night but you cannot complain as the location was fantastic. The bar was really nice in the hotel too, the staff were friendly however it did get quite busy. We know a few people who have been to NY and stayed in a worse hotel and been miles out of the city. When you step out of the Ameritania you are on Broadway, 5 minutes stroll to Time Square, 5 minutes to the bottom of central park, 10 minutes from Rockafella and Empire state which is nothing! We were amazed by how central it was for what we paid. Well worth staying in if you are going on a 4 day sightseeing trip like we did!

Reviews.Title: “tiny and noisy”
Reviews.Author: travelingSavage
Reviews.Content: Just as other reviewers have said the pictures are very deceiving because our room looked nothing like the website. The lobby was nice but beyond that it was really disappointing. We booked this hotel through Hotwire and when we checked in I heard the lady go to the back room and say â€œhotwireâ€�. I have a feeling they give all guests who book through outside vendors the crappy rooms in the hotel - be warned. Our room was so small, had a view of a dirty smelly interior area and was right next to the elevator so you could hear the doors opening and closing all night. Iâ€™m not sure what the rooms on the other side of the elevator were like but I imagine they were bigger and had better views! The bedroom was big as the bed. There was no space to walk on either side of the bed it was so small. The TV was so old and basic channels didn't even come in. We had a choice of about 8 channels total! The bathroom was so cramped you couldn't sit on the toilet without banging your knees against that wall - you had to sit diagonally. The water was really hot - that was about the best thing in the room! The hotel was heated by old school radiators. The radiator in our room was slanted and had a steam heating contraption that made so much noise I couldn't sleep at all. We eventually had to turn on the fan but that just made the steam come out even louder. We eventually turned off the heater and turned on the air conditioner â€“ not a pleasant night sleep at all. When we went down to complain they told us that was the only room they had which I donâ€™t believe. I will never stay at this place again no matter what the deal!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: LDAandCSH
Reviews.Content: It's not luxurious but it's very affordable, and clean and the location can't be beat! I will stay here every time I come to NYC from now on

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: marsabez
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice staff, and a location that cannot be beaten. Would you expect luxury for the most affordable price? Certainly not, bit we will stay again here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: happycaroline
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel - we paid about Â£100 a night, although I think you can get it cheaper if you look on their website. The lobby is modern and nicely decorated, with complementary tea/coffee for guests. Staff are friendly and polite. Our room (615) was really big and very clean- we had a really comfy kingsize bed and still plenty of room either side, with a reasonable en-suite bathroom. I feared the worst as I had heard that you have to pay a lot of money in NY for really basic rooms. I would say by UK standard, it was a nice 3* hotel. The location was good too - right next to Time Square, so pretty central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gabstar73
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent,about 2/3 mins walk from times square and across the road from the subway. There are shops,restaurants and theatres linning the streets-truly buzzing but not particularly noisy. The lobby was lovely, very contempory and there was free coffee on offer all day, every day. Three of us shared a room and the room was plenty big enough. It was nicely decorated,comfy beds,cleaned daily and all you could want from a hotel room really. The doormen were really lovely and helpful, hailing cabs in the middle of the road whenever we needed them. I would reccomend this hotel and hope that one day I can go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dont book here”
Reviews.Author: xK9x
Reviews.Content: We bookd Ameritania through Best at Travel as it was decently priced and lets face it, when you're in NYC you're really only needing a hotel for a bed at night, but anyway, it was a big mistake booking into the Ameritania!! Looks lovely in pics, very deceiving and also looked lovely from the outside and in lobby but as soon as we got in the lift and shown to our room we were not happy! It was damp and smelly, very out dated and absolutely roasting hot, very uncomfortable!! Rooms filthy and bathroom tiny tiny!! We complained a few times about heat and also the horrible smell we kept getting from our bathroom, and i must say it was fixed as soon as we complained and eventually we had to get our heater switched off (you cannot contorl them yourself) and it was still uncomfortably hot and this was when it was -6 degrees celsius outside!! It was an absolutely brillaint location though, within wallking distance to everything which was the one good thing about it! On our last day there as we waited for the taxi to take us to airport we sat in hotel lobby and watched the 'fix it' guy use the tea/coffee machines hot water function to fill up a dirty bucket then proceeded to go and fix a blocked toilet!!! Dont use the machine!! Although we were not happy with the hotel we still had an absolutely fantastic time in NYC but next time we'll be paying that bit extra for a nice hotel! Dont book in here!

Reviews.Title: “Aggressively Dingy”
Reviews.Author: yucked_out
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very dissapointed by this dirty hotel. Our cramped bedroom had peeling paint, scuffed furniture, mysterious smudges on the sheets and a horrible musty smell. The carpet wasn't dark enough to hide a mosaic of stains and we felt uncomfortable taking our shoes off. Cobwebs and mold sprouted in the tiny bathroom and the water was either scalding or freezing. We had planned to stay for two nights but fled to another hotel the next morning. Judging by the other reviews on this website, it sounds like we got off easy.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: JOGLeeds
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in a fantastic location this is the hotel for you. If you want 5* accommodation forget it. This hotel is showing it's age and could do with a lick of paint here and there. The room we stayed in was very clean and tidy, and it was warm as well. We did have trouble with the old radiator making a lot of noise but once we turned it off the clanking and banging stopped. The bathroom was clean if not on the small side, but again if you want a 5* bathroom forget it. The only complaint my wife had was the lighting was on the low side and she found it hard to put her makeup on ( I of course did not have this problem). The corridors to the rooms were also on the dull side and the carpets were thredbare in places but I was not in New York to look at the decor. The staff were very helpful and the free tea and coffee 24/7 was a good thing when we came in after a full day and night out. The bottom line is if you want a hotel close to Times Square and on Broadway that is not going to cost the earth this is the one for you. Just remember that New York is the city that does not sleep at night so any rooms looking out on Broadway can be a little noisey.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Marsies14
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel room, $169/night, which is a fantastic deal for the location of this hotel. It's at 54th and Broadway, which is just down the street from Times Square. The hotel itself is just OK, nothing great. Small rooms and an even smaller bathroom, but we were able to walk to EVERYTHING!! There's a subway stop 2 blocks away that took us to Soho, Battery Park, and Penn Station. It is a little loud at night being in the middle of everything. But if you don't plan on staying in your room and just hanging out in the city, this is a good hotel for the price. This is a 3 star hotel...remember that when you're booking. Mainly a decent place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: sianypop
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say! I had saved 4 years for this holiday as a treat for myself and my mam and we were not disappointed! I, like many others read reviews on here and started worrying that i had made the wrong choice but fear not the hotel is everything you need on a sightseeing holiday! what people are expecting i really dont know. Its clean and tidy, fair enough it could do with abit of attention, especially the decor but the location more than makes up for it. The hotel sits between 54th street and broadway, 5 mins to the right is Times Square and 5 mins to the left is central park. what more could you ask for. you basically sleep in the hotel and thats it. our room was spacious, two double beds, bathroom was a good size aswel. There is free tea and coffee in the lobby 24/7. Unfortunately they no longer serve bagels, the bar is no longer open and the diner across the street has shut down but being on broadway there are loads more places to get food and refreshments! so please dont be put off by negative comments! i will definately consider staying here again, as would love to return in a couple of years. New York has so much to offer!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lancsfox
Reviews.Content: Great location. Couldn't be better placed for Times Square, Broadway Central Park etc. Room spacious and cleaned everyday. Free tea and coffee 24 hours in the lobby. Lots of restaurants nearby. Only fault with hotel was very poor lighting. So much so found it difficult to read. Would stay there again purely from a location point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: AppleLichfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November.Location was great sort of middle of Manhattan.Not far from Central Park in Broadway district. Hotel could do with a bit of renovation and the lighting was very drab,which spoilt it or was it used to hide flaws?, but all in all clean and pleasant,all that you need .Free coffee in the Lobby.Bed was massive 6ftx6ft.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel In NYC !!!!”
Reviews.Author: DMC9
Reviews.Content: What an aweome jewel hidden in the theater district!!! Nice, CLEAN, spacious rooms. Great shower with strong water pressure and always hot water. Friendly, helpful staff. The location is superb!!! Times square, NBC Studios, Dave Letterman's Studio, Broadway theaters, Radio City Music Hall, Rockafeller Center and 5TH Avenue shopping (just to name a few) all within a few minutes walk. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to NEW YORK CITY =)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: mj12982
Reviews.Content: Room was small however it was not bad. I had everything I needed. Staff were accommodating and most of all, the location is EXCELLENT! It's just a few blocks away from Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “middle of manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sheaGermany
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the ameritania in october/ november. my friend was running the marathon and it was close to the finish. it was our first time in nyc and the location is just great. we walked a lot and lots of things are nearby. times square, central park, even rockefeller center, st. pathricks.... the hotel is okay- nothing more. its very dark - so was our room, no good light for reading or writing. our room was very small, the bathroom even smaller. we could not sit on the toilet! there was a hole in the floor under the carpet- we had to watch our steps very carefully. it happend twice, that we had no towels - we had to complain, than we got towels. it was very,very noisy. our window was broken, so we could hear the noise much louder. we liked the free coffee in the lobby and the people working in the ameritania. the recepionist was really helpful and the doormen very polite. we had warm water all the time. the heating is very loud, but we didnt use it in the night. the hotel rooms need a renovation very badly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. So noisy”
Reviews.Author: LyndaJ0nes
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous time in New York. 7 women celebrating friends 40th birthday. The hotel itself was fine, but it was so noisy, we had a room on the corner of the hotel (room 305), friends fronted hotel, we all struggled to sleep. Traffic noise was horrendous. We were woken about 4a.m every morning by the garbage trucks which line up outside the hotel, if not that a passing fire engine, which in New York have to have alarms blaring whatever time of night it is. In our room there were four of us sharing, but everyday we had three towels left in the room, picky I know, but having to ask every day for an additional towel gets tiresome. There is no bar or catering facility within the hotel, but you can aquire tea and coffee from the ground floor and take it to your room. The hotel is clean and we enjoyed our stay, but if you have trouble sleeping, ask for a room to the rear, otherwise you will not sleep. The hotel is in a fabulous location, I have trouble sleeping anywhere, but all of my friends commented on the noise.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: VeronRedditch
Reviews.Content: the hotel location is fantastic very central to time square just a 10 min walk away central park 15min walk away. When I booked the hotel it was fanshion week so the hotels were mainly full. After reading your reviews I was not sure I made the right choice but yes the rooms are small the bathrooms very small but when you are visiting new york what do you want a big room for you only sleep in it , most of the time we were out sight seeing no time to spend in our room. The rooms were cleaned daily, the staff were friendly and the free coffee service in the loby was great. Would recommend this to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - made my stay”
Reviews.Author: darinawhite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my mother. It was my first time in New York and I really think this hotel helped make my holiday all the better. The location is unbeatable. Right on broadway - just a few blocks south of Central Park and about 10 blocks North of Times Square (about a 10 minute walk). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room was small and out-of-date and the lighting was dim, but you're in New York - what could you possibly want with a fancy hotel room when you'll be spending every waking moment out in the hustle and bustle!! The beds were very comfy, so that's all you need. The bathroom was very nice with a hot powerful shower. Everything was very clean. We were worried that we wouldn't be able to sleep with the noise of Broadway outside our window, but we had no problems at all. And it was lovely to come home every evening to a nice cup of free coffee / tea / herbal tea in the resident's bar (no longer actually a bar). The room is a bit run-down, but it's comfy and relaxing. A tip: stroll down to a theatre (there are so many to choose from) about half an hour before a show and see if you can get tickets. We were really lucky with this and saw an incredible play for next to nothing. And get breakfast around the corner in Bagel Stix on 8th and 53rd - very popular (i.e. busy) bagel place with more types of cream cheese than I knew possible!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location - wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Watson75
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a week in New York in this hotel with my adult daughter. We were both delighted with it. The location is so near to Broadway and Times Square. It took us 5 minutes to walk to The Lion King, about 10 minutes to Wicked etc. It was surrounded by great places to eat, near to the tube, near to lots of shops. We could not hear a sound from the other bedrooms which was great. The bathroom was fine, once you realized that the taps had to be pushed back and not clockwise, as I am used to, to get hot water and great pressure. All was very clean. The hotel has no bar now but has a good lounge with very good coffee and various teas on offer 24 hours for free. The porters and staff were very helpful and good to us. I would have liked one strong light for makeup but otherwise I agree with soft lighting as it is much more eco friendly. I thought the bedroom and corridors were OK and sufficiently well lit always. I would much rather pay for a good location than fancy wallpaper etc. After all, you will not have to bother about getting taxis and we bought a Metro card for a week and used it to get to the rest of Manhattan . What more could anyone ask for at the price? Would definitely stay there again and recommend it. If you are the sort who prefers to pay for fancy decor and up to the minute fashion, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: EnglandDanny75
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel its the worst place we have ever stopped in our lives!!! The reception is deceivingly pleasant but that soon changes when you make the dull and dingy walk to your room!! We were given a room on the second floor to start and the dim lit corridors stunk of stale smoke and when we got to the room it was cramped, smelt damp and was over looking a brick wall!! We complained (the first time we have ever complained about a hotel room) and were moved onto the 6th floor into a similar damp smelling, small room in serious need of decoration. 2 of the 5 lights worked, there was wall paper starting to peel off the walls and it had a dirty feel throughout!!! The bar was closed throughout our 6 day stay and upon questioning why, we were simply told "it just is". The only positive is the great location with Times square to your right and central park to your left. We can't stress enough to not stop here as it ruined our stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “second visit...as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: CollegeboundNY
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited NY this past March to visit prospective colleges and stayed at the Ameritania. Well she is now living in NY attending school and my wife, daughter and I stayed again at the Ameritania while moving my daughter into her dorm. We were not disappointed. Staff was friendly from the moment we left the cab with too many boxes and suitcases sitting on the curb for my daughter's move. The doorman got everything into our room before we knew it. Room was surprisingly roomy (1001) with a great view of Broadway towards the park. Everything in the room worked great. There was a nice alcove for our luggage. No waiting for hot water, TV worked fine with a good picture. Air conditioner kept room comfortable. We could turn the air off at night, open a window and have lots of fresh air. When we would return to our room, it was always cleaned and had fresh towels. We have now stayed here twice, and had similar experiences. Staff was always helpful, room clean. great location, good subway access (two different lines). The lobby is a comfortable and airy place to relax out of your room. Since I now plan to visit NY more often, this will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: corndogManchester
Reviews.Content: brilliant location staff very freindly 24 hour deli across the road complimentary tea and coffee downstairs you come out of the hotel turn right then right again to times square or turn left to central park which is amazing the tv is a bit small but who wants to stop in and watch tv in new york so much to do you are surrounded with cafes and bars we had a front room did not here any noise at night to tired to listen for it free safe in room cant complain at all would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DMSY
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 28-30 July at the end of a 5 city trip throughout US. We had stayed previosuly in 2005 and although room not great was serviceable. On arrival this time we found that the 'double' standard room really should have been a single as so tiny and claustraphboic. On complaint we were told that is what we paid for and were offered an upgrade at an extra cost. Upgraded to a ' luxury' room!!! Perhaps we had been spoilt at other 4 fabulous hotels we had stayed in. 1st night no hot water in adequate bathroom next morning power goes off as dressing to go out for day - not good when you've just washed your hair. That evening again power went out as getting ready to go to a show. Seems this room had a problem with electrical overload!!! Did get my upgrade charge back when complained. The good things about the hotel is that the beds are comfy but the bad are the rooms are too small, the corridors are dark and dingy, smell of cigarette smoke and the lifts are poor. The hotel is in an excellent location but all in all I think the Ameritania is a tired hotel at the end of its day and in need of a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Location..location...location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldnut
Reviews.Content: I've never understood anyone who complains about small bathrooms in hotels, why is that so important?! In a city like NY you spend as little time as possible in your hotel, there's too much to see and do. We had a HUGE room with 2 queen beds, a walk in wardrobe, maid service everyday, a deli on the corner for fab breakfasts, free tea/coffee in the lobby, a lovely concierge and very helpful reception staff. The location is unbeatable, we walked just about everywhere, central park 5mins to the left, times square 5mins to the right. We only used the subway just so we could say we did! Only gripe is the lighting - very dim everywhere. Particularly tricky putting on make-up in the bathroom! The bar was also a bit dark, but we never actually used it. The hotel organised our taxi to the airport, we had a wonderful young chatty driver in a lovely comfy car, and got to learn a lot more about NY!. We had no problems at all at this hotel, and am confident that even if we had, it would have been sorted efficiently. We would definitely return, my kids loved it too!

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as the other reviews say”
Reviews.Author: kitcatb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania Hotel over 4th of July weekend. After reading most of the reviews I was a little afraid of bringing my family to this hotel. I have been to NY many times and have stayed at many hotels and this one was just as good as the others for the money you pay. The room was small, but very clean. We always came home to a clean room with fresh towels after a very long day of sightseeing. As for the bathroom, that is our only small complaint. The shower has no curtain, just a half glass wall. If you have a family that is not modest then you will be fine, unfortunately for us we like our privacy. The staff was very helpful when asking for directions or even looking up the next days weather on his cell phone! I also loved the coffee bar. The best cups of coffee I had in the city came from the hotel. So in a nutshell, yes the rooms are small, the hallways are dark, but since the price was right and the location was great , there really is nothing to complain about. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: NIRE_8
Reviews.Content: Styed here for St. Paddy's day 07, the worst place i ever stayed hands down.. My friends and I had to move rooms twice, first time the hallway leading to the room had a terrible smell of dampness which was also filtering into the room. On the second occasion the shower and the toilet stopped working in the bathroom. Eventually we got moved to an upper class suite, which at best was average. We all agree we would never stay at this place again. To top it all of, for the previous four times i had been to this great city it was the most expensive and by far the worst......... Never be back..........

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: aloveit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania Hotel earlier this year with my parents. I'm 15 and loved it. Why is everybody complaining? The doormen were lovely and as soon as we stepped out of the taxi put our bags on the rail and carried them to our room. The reception staff were very friendly and kind, they helped us with directions and helped us work the safe. We had a gorgeous room with 2 double beds on the 1st floor. There was loads of room! The bathroom was quite small but still big enough to use, although the shower was a bit hard to work. View of Broadway from the room was so nice!! The T.V also had good channels. From the hotel is a short walk to everywhere! Very close to Times Square and the subway station! The free tea and coffee downstairs was nice. I would recommend this hotel it was really cheap for flights and a hotel (we flew from the UK). It was my fave holiday!! And if you don't like the room then get over yourself you're in NEW YORK!!! P.S the beds were soooo comfy!! Would defo go back

Reviews.Title: “Horrible !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyshoe
Reviews.Content: Two female friends and I booked 3 nights in the Ameritania 24-26 July 2008 We were under the impression this hotel had had a recent refurb - and looking at the pictures it looks pretty impressive for the price. We were given an upgrade - goodness knows what from. The self-service coffee/tea area in the lobby was filthy and generally the public areas were dirty and furniture grubby and worn. Our suite on the second floor was depressing - very worn carpet , beige/brown dirty furnishings and the bathroom was so tatty . On a plus point - one of a very few - the bed linen was clean and beds comfortable. The staff were generally very helpful - but having stayed one night - it was enough. We checked out !!!!! Not at all impressed !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morganita
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ameritania with 2 of my friends for 2 of us it was our third time to N-Y the check in was really fast and when we got into the room it was small and smelly but not so bad...It got worst at night , I was on my bed when I saw a cockroach on the floor and then a second one on the wall, one of us went to the front desk and ask for an other room but when we opened the door of the new room we realised that this room was occupied.... we finally decided to leave the hotel ..... I really don't think this hotel deserve his 3 stars ,the only thing good about this place is the location...

Reviews.Title: “Ameritania - my "love/hate" relationship - 3rd Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'm crazy. It is a dark hotel. The staff is quite helpful, they know me and deliver the room and floor I ask for. Is the lobby edgy and hip or just cold and somewhat spooky? I'm probably too old for this place but the location is just UNBELIEVABLE! I'm near Broadway, Carnegie deli, great restaurants. Letterman is just around the corner, the Park is a short walk after a tough business day. The water in the shower may be cold unless you get up early, beware! For Manhattan, the rooms are really not that small (I didn't say anything about the bathroom though). Yep, a "mixed review." The price doesn't crush me and I don't have a Park Plaza hotel budget. So until another member gives me a hot new Manhattan hotel tip...the Ameritania will probably get stay #4!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mlee0707
Reviews.Content: I was very unsatisfied with my stay at the Hotel Ameritania. Half the stations on my TV wouldn't come through, and the sound kept going in and out. My toilet had a crack on the back and there was a huge hairball in the tub stuck on the drain. Ewww. A weird, high-pitched hissing noise kept coming out of the heater every 30 or so minutes, which made it unbearable to sleep (and I am not a light sleeper. The sounds of taxis and the city didn't keep me up). I wasn't expecting the same kind of quality I'd get at the W or the Four Seasons, but for the price I paid (avg. of $300/night), I expected a clean, comfortable place to rest my head. Instead, I dreaded coming back to the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “You could do worse, you could do better.”
Reviews.Author: homesick_and_grumpy
Reviews.Content: If the Ameritania were anywhere but Manhattan Iâ€™d be outraged. For $269.44 - an online bargain price, by the way - you donâ€™t get much in NYC nowadays, and this joint is living proof of that. Not that it was miserable, or dingy, or tremendously unpleasant...itâ€™s just that in terms of decor, hospitality, and amenities, the Ameritania has all the charm of the finest state-run hotel in Minsk circa 1972. My room was laughably small, even by New York standards. The mildly- saggy queen platform bed not only dominated the room, it WAS the entire room. You had to crabwalk around it. If you got up on one side, youâ€™d trip over the door of the woefully-undersized room safe; if you got up on the other, youâ€™d immediately walk into a wall. There was no room for a desk, which is fine if you enjoy doing everything - eating, reading, computing - from bed. The only seating alternative was the toilet. My particular window looked up Broadway, the view only partially obstructed by a very large billboard on the debris-filled rooftop across the street (see photo). I imagine the views on floors 7 and below would be progressively less interesting. In the window was a cheap, dinky little air-conditioner, the kind you see on sale at discount drug stores for $79. Heat, were it necessary, would likely come from the little radiator stuffed into the corner. 54th Street and Broadway is a mixed blessing of a location. On one hand, youâ€™re right up the street from Times Square, near to buses and subways and convenience stores and ATMâ€™s and a thousand souvenir shops and restaurants in which no respectable New Yorker would be caught dead. On the downside, the parade of honking taxis barreling down Broadway begins at dawn and only subsides after midnight, replaced by the rumbling of ominously large trucks throughout the wee hours. The bathroom was clean and functional, although the slippery plastic tub was an accident waiting to happen. One thing about my room so intrigued me I just had to take a snapshot. The microscopic afterthought of a â€œclosetâ€� was so tiny that the hangers were too close to the wall to hang straight (see photo). In my several decades of hotel stays, this was a first. I didnâ€™t explore the hotelâ€™s other features, if there were any, although I have to admit being mildly impressed by the plastic/fantastic lounge/bar area, which looked like a set built for the Austin Powers movies, except maybe less comfortable. In summation, the Ameritania is outclassed by most of the hotels in its neighborhood, but itâ€™s not dreadful. If you just need a place to crash after a hectic business day or a night on the town, and you can score a decent price, then this may be it. If youâ€™re looking for amenities, pampering, or a romantic getaway, keep looking. PS: I have stayed here before, in one of the larger single king rooms, and it wasnâ€™t all that bad. It certainly was roomier.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: arisis212
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, but very clean. Beds are clean and very comfortable. Parking is very close and affordable. I paid around $200 for one night stay. A very good value for the money. Location and price really can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with Ameritania, its great!”
Reviews.Author: Nic2006
Reviews.Content: I researched this website incessantly for reviews before travelling to this hotel, and was pleasantly surprised with it. I don't understand why people moan about the bad quality/old decor, this isn't a 5* hotel, it is above basic for a reasonable price! Every hotel in NYC is really expensive, but this hotel I would definetly go back to, the location is amazing!! You step outside and turn a small corner and there is Times Square. Don't read the bad reviews, just book it, you will have a fantastic time. I werent going to New York to stay in a hotel! Room is small, but this is NYC! Beds were so comfy, the actual bedroom is small but is expected but who cares!! The bathroom is nice. Everything was absolutely fine, if you are a snob and only like staying in Hiltons and such - then perhaps this isn't for you, but otherwise just stay here its fine!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Hanisa
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I couldn't see that I was getting much more from other hotels even though they were more expensive and I must say that I made the right decision. It was well worth the little I paid! The location is spot on - you can't get much better! Close to Times Square, all the main shopping areas and Central Park. And the David Letterman Show is right on your doorstep! The room was actually a lot bigger than I had expected and it was nicely decorated. The bathroom was small, but we didn't find this a problem. The only negative for the room was that it was too warm, even when freezing outside and our radiator was off. You can hear the traffic, but what would you expect in the heart of NY? I actually found it comforting! What I didn't appreciate was the poor consideration shown by other guests. We were woken up by people having lengthy conversations in the corridor, or even shouting to each other! So if you are considering staying here, please think of your fellow hotel users!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco ....”
Reviews.Author: colemans
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I thought we had made a terrible mistake - however we were pleasantly surprised by the accommadation. The room was quite large - two double beds, plenty of floor space for 3 suitcases and paraphenalia required by three adults. Walk in wardrobe/cupboard. Bathroom adequate - all clean with fresh sheets/towels every day. Once we worked out the shower system it was fine - powerful and always hot.Yes, the rooms were dimly lit and had a brown/beige decor BUT it is advertised as art deco (The Rockerfella centre is art deco and just as dimly lit - no one moans about that!). Have stayed at another hotel one street away which had a terribly small, smelly room. OK the view was not brilliant - a bagel shop & rough roof top but we were not there for the room view - ideally situated for all the NY attractions. Walked everywhere except down to Battery Park - took a Taxi costing $15. Free tea/coffee in lobby 24/7. Often took the stairs going out as lifts were busy, but one was always available on return to room. Overall the hotel was quiet inside - our room was on 6th floor opposite lift and this caused no problems with noise. Yes we could hear traffic noise but hey this is the city that never sleeps! Buy the New York Pass - we had a 7 day pass and it was fantastic - used it several times every day and it makes eating at Planet Hollywood a dream - go straight up the stairs or lift no matter what size the queue, go to the front show your pass and hey presto instantly get taken to a table! AND $10 dollars off for each person with a card! You really won't have enough time to go to all the attractions - but you will probably visit some that you might otherwise not have due to the cost as the pass covers entry to a wide variety of places. We visited Empire state day & night, the zoo twice (to revisit rain forest & polar bears!) and did full circle line boat trip then again at night. You cannot use the pass for the same attraction more than once per day.

Reviews.Title: “Photo's are not everything!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wilma30
Reviews.Content: We were advised that this was a nice hotel to stay in by the the operators who we booked the trip through, we struggled to get accomodation in our price range due to the time of year in NYC (peak season), for the money we paid we expected a good standard of hotel having being to New York before. On first impressions the hotel looked OK the lobby and bar looked very nice indeed and we thought we had landed a decent hotel, the lifts were very slow and old, on stepping out I can only describe it as a scene from an old private eye film with water stains on the carpet, holes in the ceiling, wires hanging down and a red fire exit sign lighting up the corridor. Our room was small and very noisy as our room was on the corner of Broadway so you can imagine. The air con in the room worked but turned out that it was just slotted into a hole in the window and was very noisy so that along with the traffic noise, do I need to say anything else. We had a chair in the room and this was not moved the entire time as we think it was holding up the wardrobe that housed the TV. Be warned the toilet takes a while to flush and careful you don't bang your head on the glass shelf above the toilet when you stand up as I did everytime, also don't spend too long in the shower as the water runs quicker out of the shower than it does down the plug hole, you can end up stood in a lot of water!! I have to admit the room was clean and the bed very comfortable and we had maid service every day, the only upside is that when you visit NYC you don't spend a lot of time in your room so it did provide what we wanted in having somewhere to sleep and get changed it could have been bigger as not much room to move around, also no storage in the room either!! The hotel itself is very well located, you are in the middle of it all and the staff very friendly, especially the door men, they couldn't help us more, also please sample a few of the cocktails in the bar they are the best bit about the whole hotel, overall we paid a lot of money to stay in the hotel and it wasn't worth it so I would not stay here again and wouldn't want others to waste their money either.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: mayabenrud
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the ameritania for three nights over Easter weekend. For $350 a night we should have been given more than bad/cheap coffee in the morning. The room was small which is typical for New York but, the TV was a 13 inch 70s model that only showed static for half the time. The beds were like laying on a haybale. The down comforters were thin with hard clumps of feathers in them. It was the worst night sleep I've ever had. We booked online and were told at check in that when we left we would be able to pay using other methods because the initial credit card was just used to reserve the room. Well as we left there was a whole different story. They wouldn't change the tender and also refused to give us a reciept for the nights we were charged. They were rude and it wasn't worth the money. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, but there are plenty of better hotels located just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: pinky1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ameritania for 5 nights in November 2007, we had never been to New York before so I pained over where to stay, money was an object and I didn't want to pay too much! We booked through BA as they had the best price for this hotel. The location is excellent, it is just a stroll away from Times Square and the nearest Subway. The room was average, could do with redecorating but it was clean and the bed was VERY comfy. To be honest we did not care that much about the decor as we only used the room to crash out in after long days sightseeing and shopping. The staff were friendly and helpful and we had no problems. In a nutshell, this place is excellent value and if you intend on being out all day and want somewhere reasonable and clean to sleep then pick this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “'Not bad for the price you pay!'”
Reviews.Author: aka_dale
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend booked this hotel in October 2007 for our 4 day stay in New York city in March 2008 with British Airways Holidays. We chose the Ameritania Hotel because it was value for money and it was located not far from the main attractions in New york itself. The hotel review on the British Airways Holidays website looked promising with its elegant pictures and descriptions of the hotel. We went ahead and booked it, costing us Â£316.00 for the four day duration stay at the hotel. It was only after we had booked it, we came across the Trip Advisor website and began reading the reviews of people who had recently visited and stayed at the Ameritania Hotel. Majority of the reviews we read about this hotel were not very promising and otherwise very negative. We took our chances and arrived at the hotel, the door staff were friendly they helped us take our our luggage from the reception to our room. Reception staff were friendly and we were checked in quickly and effieciently and our room was ready for us to use, even tho some website state the room wont be available til 1500 hours. The lifts in this hotel are very slow, so i suggest you ask for a room on a lower level, then again if the room is on the Broadway side then expect it to be very noisy at night times as the Broadway can be very busy until the early hours of the morning. when we booked the hotel we requested a room with two bed which we got, so no real problems here. The beds are comfortable and clean, the television channels are not very clear and only a few work. The bathroom door had no lock on it, the window in the bathroom window only slided up a few inches and was very stiff which was no help when the bathroom got steamed up. To flush the toilet, we had to stand there holding the button down as the toilet pan cleared away slowly. The decor of the hotel is no where to matching those pictures shown on the British Airways Holidays website. The Hotel is run down, very old looking, stained carpets and very dim lighting. The hotel has 24hour free tea and coffee facility in the reception/bar area. For all you guys who love your tea and coffee i advise you take your own from your country of departure. The hotel uses 'Liptons' tea and filter coffee, which both are niether strong in visual or taste. However there are plenty of Starbucks Coffee shops within walking distances of the hotel if you want a good quality cup of tea or coffee at reasonable prices. (I do recommend Vanilla Latte from Starbucks, absolutely delicious!) The hotel does not have a restaurant, so you will need to go out for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I highly recommend that you do not eat from the store/cafe across the road from the Ameritania Hotel entrance, its not busy and the food is held under hot lights all day long. The hotel is in a good location, close to Times square, Central Park and the theatre District on the Broadway. If you wish to go and see a show, Chicago or the Lion King are the shows to be watched. I recommend this hotel for young couples and people on a low budget who dont mind staying in a hotel with minimum facilities. If you like a hotel with alot of facilities, then i do not recommend this hotel to you, if you just want a bed to sleep on and a wash then this hotel is for you. Dale Birmingham, UK

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: coastguardchick0530
Reviews.Content: We took a trip of 3 girls to the big city and had an excellent time! We stayed within walking distance of times square. Central Park, China Town, Little Italy, and shopping is so close! Most of the time you can just take a $5 taxi ride to your destination. I loved the bagel place across the street for a light breakfast. I would recommend and stay at the Ameritania everytime that i come back to the city. On the downfall, the rooms are quite small, but what do you expect. The only time you are in your room is when you sleep. I would recommend two double beds, over one king bed. The room is a tad bit bigger. But overall, good, clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Absoulutley EXCELLENT Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Girl_Manchester
Reviews.Content: On first impressions of The Ameritanna Hotel, The doorman was welcoming & helpful when i was checking the receptionist was quite polite, she asked me for $100 security deposit which i was a bit suprised by as nobody beforehand made me aware that this is what the hotel would require until we checked out. On arriving on the room it was a decent size accomidating 2 double beds and a nice size bathroom. The beds are like Heaven to sleep on!! LOL. The location is perfect for a trip to NY as it so close to everything with it being a few blocks from Times Square. I would say the majority of places are within walking distance of this hotel. The free tea & Coffee bar was appreciated after a long day of shopping!!! I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel and will be returning to it again next January.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BLUEVINYLMASTER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ameritania in November 2007. Thought it was a good hotel. Been New York before so I knew were to look and have to say the Ameritania was value for money for the location alone. The room we stayed in had a huge comfy double bed which was great sleeping in after a day walking and a night in the bars. We found the room to be clean and well maintained. The lights in the room were dimmer than were used to at home. My only concern was the window. Didnt really block out much noise, didn't bother our sleep though. The bathroom was small though. Nothing to do with the hotel but whatever you do, DO NOT book a car with Gotham Limousine, They are really bad. You can get a mini-bus from the hotel to the airport for bout Â£30 ($60)

Reviews.Title: “not great...”
