Reviews.Author: europenylover
Reviews.Content: staff - the staff was very helpful. we took a red eye and got to new york bright and early. we were originally going to just have them hold our luggage while we wait until 3pm to check in; however, we were able to check into our room at 8am without additional charge. they were also able to hold our luggage when we checked out so we can explored the city until we had to go to the airport. room - not so great. the bed is quite comfortable and clean. however, the rest of the room is horrible. the carpet is dirty so i would recommend bringing a pair of slipper to walk around in the room. the bathroom window has cracks. the tub has cracks. there was trash on the floor when we first got in. i know that we dont go to new york to stay in a hotel room but i did not feel comfortable in the room. location - is great! we were able to walk to time square, central park, and rockefeller center. the famous carnegie deli is one street down. subways are also one street down. i would not stay at this hotel again only because i need to feel comfortable to unwind after a long day of walking and sightseeing. if you do not care about it, book this hotel for its location and price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eve029
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after reading the reviews but the friendly and attentive attitude of the staff ensured we had a pleasant stay at the hotel! The location is great, especially if you plan to see the city on foot. The rooms are decent for sleeping, although remember to check that your window is actually properly closed as it can get quite chilly if it has been left open (as ours had by the previous resident). If you're looking for a decent, clean hotel with a good location then go for this one. If you are looking for a hotel room where you can spend the evening in a spacious and "homey" atmosphere I would book some other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but hotel in poor condition!”
Reviews.Author: poppy888
Reviews.Content: My family decided to spend Christmas in New York, so this holiday had been booked for almost a year. We thought this hotel was central so that was our reason for booking. We had booked six rooms and hoped we would have a view of New York! On arrival, It is tired and run down looking. Everything is a dingy shade of brown, the lighting is minimal. We were told that five of the rooms were on the 12th floor and ours was on the 8th floor. When we saw our room, 811, I could have cried. We had been travelling for hours and were now faced with a dark, dismal depressing room that would not have been out of place in a one star hotel. It had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, the bath was almost the size of the sink. Then I saw my families rooms, which were bright, airy and spacious. I phoned reception and asked for another room, this was organised immediately for room 618. It was still brown but quite spacious and it had a larger bathroom. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. The view from the window was of the other residents rooms, there were some sights!! However, the hotel is in an excellent location, just minutes from Times Square. There is a 24 hour deli across the street, which caters for everyones needs. There is free tea and coffee available in the bar area, but be prepared to pour in the dark, as they have a desk lamp and no other lighting!! As this was a birthday surprise for my Father, we booked the Rainbow room at the Rockerfeller centre for Christmas lunch. It was just fantastic and the view was spectacular! We did all the usual sights and then booked flights from JFK to Buffalo and toured Niagara Falls. It was freezing with plenty of snow, it was a great day. We used Majestic Tours and they were wonderful, we just couldn't recommend them enough! Overall, I feel this hotel is built for location rather than comfort, however a three star hotel should not be providing 1 or 2 star rooms. In the end, we got moved to an acceptable room, but why even assume that guests would even contemplate staying in below standard rooms, why not put us into the better room to start with????!!!! We met a guest in the lift who had moved 4 times! We felt the staff were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff leave a very clean and tidy hotel, but it is difficult to make a poorly lit, brown, tired hotel into anything better! Our stay was not marred by our experiences, we had a great time, but after having spent nine days in this hotel, we were looking forward to getting home to "brightness"!!

Reviews.Title: “not bad, worth a look”
Reviews.Author: littlemisssunny30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania for four nights at the beginning of December and was booked through our travel agent. The holiday itself was booked almost a year in advance and couldn't wait to arrive in NYC as it had always been a dream to visit. On arriving at the hotel my first appearance was that the lobby and reception area were a little dark but clean and contempory looking. There is apparantly free tea/coffee available 24hrs a day I believe in the lobby but we didn't make use of this facility so not sure how good that was. In our experience the reception staff and porters could not have been more helpful, and were very accomodating. I am chlaustrophobic and can't use lifts, and when we explained that the room we were given on the eleventh floor was unsuitable we were immediately changed to a room on the third floor. We were a little dissapointed with the room itself at first but appearances can be deceptive, and we found both the room and bed to be clean and very comfortable. It is true that the rooms are very small but we found them to be big enough, after all you'll only be sleeping there. As we were there in December it was very cold but the heater in the room was very effective, a little noisy but nothing ear shattering and there was plenty of hot water for a shower. We were a little unlucky that we had quite literally no view of NYC from our window (just a view of part of the roof in fact), but if your after a view you need to just step outside and look all around you. If like me you aren't a lover of lifts there are stairs but be warned they are hard work to climb and the stairwell looks very old, cold and dark (not very inviting). The location of the hotel is fantastic though, we walked everywhere! The hotel is literally just off broadway, which if you follow all the way down leads to times square. Overall I would say check it out, it's not a bad place to base yourself if your simply in NYC on a budget sighteeing break. It's comfortble, clean and good location with helpful staff. I think it's only downfall is that the rooms need modernising a little and they need to improve the lighting situation throughout. Hope this helps......enjoy NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirly77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times with my company for a twice yearly trade show, and every time we stay, everyone complains. But it's cheap so we keep going back. It's kind of a craps shot. You may get a teeny tiny room that barely fits the bed in or you may get an ok sized room. The heater will break, make lots of noise, and may possibly explode and spray you with steam and water (this happened to a co-worker). In Summer the air conditioning is very loud too. This past stay was in 719, which was a good room, however it's right in front of the Coke machine. And they decided to start repairing it at 11:00pm (I went to bed early and had to get up very early for meetings). When I called the front desk to ask him to stop (it was so loud), they said they would. But 30 minutes later, he was still there. So I told him to please stop. Another 15 minutes and he was finally done, but I had missed hours of sleep. This could have been done during the day when people are not sleeping, but my guess is this guy works cheaper at night? Their are only 2 elevators for many rooms/floors, so you may end up waiting 15 minutes to get in one. That's annoying. I guess you get the picture, but I would recommend anywhere but here...

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: WordEmUp
Reviews.Content: I had to go on a business travel in NYC during Dec so I figured I would try to save the company a few dollars (nice of me, huh?). I found the Ameritania Hotel at Broadway and 54th at a really good price (average nightly rate of $335 in December). The amenities looked decent enough so I pulled the trigger. I would say for the price and location (esp in Dec in NYC), it was between "Average" and "Above Average", but I went ahead and rated this hotel at "Above Average" since this was my first stay with them. Let's start with the pros: They have a user friendly reservation interface and were flexible with making changes to reservations. Once at the hotel the staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel appeared to have gotten a face lift recently, so that was nice. The bar was nice and cozy. The location was really good - it was not in the heart of Times Square, but a 5-7 minute walk and you were there. The room was big enough for 1-2 people. The bed was more than big enough and comfortable. The heater worked REALLY well! The shower was good (good pressure, hot water). The deli across the street had pretty good food and a nice salad/hot bar. They have access to wireless internet. Now for the cons: Despite the recent face lift, you could still tell that the hotel was old, which is not a HUGE deal (an old building in NYC, go figure!). The floor was pretty un-level and creaky, at least in my room. The carpet in the hallway on my floor (8th) looked like it had some water stains/damage. The TV looked at least 15 years old and was pretty small - it's picture was pretty bad, but you aren't getting a hotel for the TV, right? The bathroom was decent size but still seemed a little small. Although a small thing, the toilet paper was pretty bad - my office building has nicer TP. The closet was not particularly deep - my shirts and jacket had to be angled to fit in so the door closed. One of the electrical outlets didn't work. Overall, the price + location relative to what I got made this hotel slightly above average. If a few of the little things had no been present then I would give this rating a solid "Above Average". I would *probably* stay in this hotel again, but would not stay there if the same small things were not fixed my second time around. This is a good hotel if you are on a budget yet still want a good location in Dec.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, I guess.”
Reviews.Author: VacaTime-7
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed here from December 8 to December 10, 2007. The first impression when we walked in was a good one. The lobby is stylish and the bar area is great...but... 1. Hotel staff was rude and unhelpful (with exception to the bellboys and the bartender). The rest were quite unpleasant, particularly the girls at the front desk. 2. The drain in the bathroom was FULL of hair and was discusting to take a shower in - water wouldn't drain 3. The second floor of the hotel looks like a tornado hit 4. There is nowhere in the hotel to buy a drink / no vending 5. The heater in the room was so noisy, we couldn't sleep and we're told that this is 'normal' sound. The girl at the front desk said 'mine sounds like that at home, it's normal'. 6. The window in the bathroom did not fit properly into the hole made for the window, therefore there was about a 4 inch space (kind of cold when you're showing). 7. Front desk failed to help us when we couldn't dial out from the room 8. Front desk failed to mention that our room was not available and initially stuck us on the smoking floor even though 1 of us was highly allergic (this was mentioned when we booked). Good Points: 1. Good location 2. Overall, clean and presentable room (stayed on 12th floor). Would I consider this hotel again... no (mainly because of the front desk staff and the type of experience they turned this into for us). Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again, AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckybella
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel in good faith and were completely disappointed by it. On entering the hotel we were offered no help with our three large suitcases, even though there were 3 porters in the the lobby chatting regardless of us!! The lobby was very shabby and dark with worn seating. After checking in we made it to the lifts, again no help was offered reguarding our bags. After the struggle to our room, we were greeted with a nightmare!! We specifically asked for a room not next to a lift, and guess what we were the lifts neighbours!! The rooms door would not open fully as it hit the bed!!! By the time we pulled in 3 suitcases the only way to get to the otherside of the bed was to roll over it!!! The bathroom was dirty and the carpet was extremely worn!! We went back to the front desk and complained we were given a new room. Again with no help with our luggge we went to our second room, in the lift meeting a guy who had changed rooms 6 times in 24 hours!!!! This new room was even worse than the first!! The bathroom was a disgrace with bloody tissues in the bin [a severe health and safety problem] and toilet seat thats paint had chipped away so much rust had been exposed!! Once again we went down to the lobby and complained!!! We were told that because we were not 'cash paying guests' they could do no more for us!!! Yet they had taken our money some 8 weeks earlier!!! We spent the first morning in New York looking for another hotel, for which we found the magnificant Warkwick!!! Needless to say on returning to the UK armed with photographic evidence we recieved a fulll refund!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in good location but the room we stayed in was depolorable”
Reviews.Author: ABD123BHD
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a 4 night stay in this hotel. This hotel should be closed down it is absolutely appalling. The carpet in the room was black with the dirt. The bathroom was tiny. New taps and shower head were put in but did not fit properly and there was space around them. We had no hot water for 2 days out of the 4. We did not sleep for the four days as there was a rattling noise from the radiator. Someone came to the room to bleed the radiator on the first day but it did not do much good. The only time we spent in the lobby was on the last day waiting for our taxi to bring us to the airport. It was dark and gloomy and definintely in need of renovation. The seats in the bar area were old and shabby and the tables were full of coffee stains. The only thing the hotel has going for it is its location. I definitely would not go back to this hotel and I cannot believe it is graded a 3 star hotel it should'nt even be a 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ejones999
Reviews.Content: Well all of you who knock this hotel must live in a perfect world! Reception found our booking straight away and we were up in the lift to our room (519) within 5 minutes or so. Lifts were fine no delays - the room was lighted adequately with a room light as well as 2 side lights per bed and a lamp on the desk. The only slight snag was with the door to the bathroom - it would not close properly as it looked like previous tenants had tried to knock it off its hinges. Bathroom was ok with plenty of hot water and towels.Only slight criticsm was no slip mat in the bath/shower - it was very slippery! We knew that there was no food/restaurant in this hotel but free tea/coffee in the bar area.There are plenty of places nearby for breakfast / other meals. Within 10 minutes you can be in Times square, on the Top of the Rock, shopping in Macys or climbing the Empire state building or if you prefer; a quieter time in Central Park - all within walking distance! For the price we paid this was a great bargain. Yes you do not get luxury surroundings but we did not pay for them or expect them. If you want to spend a great deal on a hotel room that you only sleep in then go and spend double the money and more elswhere - this was great for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel to avoid problems we experienced”
Reviews.Author: LindaG_7
Reviews.Content: Oh dear, how disappointed we were with our room. I had read reports regarding this hotel but, as our friends had stayed there last year, we thought all would be okay. We were originally told, on booking, that we would have an upgraded room. We paid extra and when we arrived we were told that both rooms were an upgrade. Our room was on the 11th floor, and was small, dingy, the bathroom smelt terribly of damp, we were awake a lot of the night by rattling pipes and then, in the morning, we found a cockroach in our room. Yuk, how horrible was that. Our friends' room was also on the 11th floor and was slightly better than ours, although the power supply fused twice whilst the hairdryer was being used. We were moved to a better room on the 10th floor, but when our friends complained about the standard of rooms and the problems with the electricity supply, the woman on reception was stand offish and unhelpful. We thought that the reason she was behaving like this was because of the many complaints! Strangely enough there was no manager available to deal with any complaints. We did speak to another couple staying at the hotel who said their room was fine, but they had spoken to other people who also had problems! To summarise, I would suggest that you look at other hotels and check their ratings on Trip Advisor before booking. If you can, go somewhere else other than the Ameritania!

Reviews.Title: “cozy and familiar”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGiallo
Reviews.Content: When visiting NY I always try and stay at this hotel. I love the location. There is a Starbucks right across the street. It's easy to catch cabs and near a subway stop. There are lots of good places to eat nearby. I also like the Lounge. It's a good place to meet people before you go out to dinner. The staff is always friendly to me and the doorman always helps me with some very heavy bags. I have never had a problem with this hotel. I stay here three times a year.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased!”
Reviews.Author: KirkcaldyGirl
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from an 8 night stay in the Ameritania and it was absolutely fine. I'd read the reviews before I booked, but I'd also looked on their website and thought the hotel looked nice, and since it was quite cheap, decided just to go for it. Leading up to our holiday I was a bit nervous as more bad reviews kept appearing but I was very relieved when we arrived. It looks just like it does on the pictures on the website so no nasty surprises. Our room was a decent size, clean, had a safe, TV, small bathroom but powerful shower...what more would you want? I was really pleased with the Ameritania and would stay again and would recommend it to friends. We paid about Â£80 per night for the room and I think that's a really reasonable price for a decent, stylish hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for NY”
Reviews.Author: chilli5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, it's got a stylish flair, and the staff there is friendly and responsive. The room itself was clean and comfortable but a little stuffy with traces of old cigarette smoke. The TV only received a few channels, not even that well, but we weren't there to watch TV! Would have liked to have had WiFi as an option. In all, a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling place - deserves to go out of business”
Reviews.Author: Montydog
Reviews.Content: We were sent here by friends who admitted later they had only looked into the lobby and thought it looked nice. It is run down, the rooms are tired, furnishings worn and badly lit (to hide a multitude of sins no doubt). We got there to find our room was freezing - the only way to close the window was to stand on a radiator which then broke. The safe was not working. The reception staff were brusque to put it mildly. The hotel car service was a rip off - $18 to Port Authority so I took a yellow cab for $3.80. There is no breakfast service even - let alone a restaurant - just weak American coffee stewing 24/7 in the bar for free of charge use - they should pay you to drink it! We were there for two nights and they did not make up our room so when we returned after the wedding we went to, we had to make our own bed - and all for a 'special deal' of over $260 per night!!! This is a classic example of a building that has had it, but they try to make it appealing by doing some 'interior design' work on it - I shall go back to staying round the corner at the Novotel on Times Sq - just one block away and excellent every time and a lot cheaper as well as better. Good news - fabulous Italian restaurant nearby - Blic at 7, East 54th Street is just great and nearby! Sinatra used to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: ScotTraveller_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unfriendly and a rip off. Was supposed to stay in a triple room and ended up on a camp bed. Over priced for what it is. The staff hard spoke to us and were not friendly at all. Said absolutely nothing to us when we checked out. I definitely wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Holidays9999
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very small rooms on all but the 11th floor. We spent the first night in a terrible room - noisy, small and with a most unhelpful bathroom configuration. We were moved to the 11th floor. An improvement apart from the visiting cockroaches - two of which we killed on our first morning. Ok after that but not a great start. Carpets old and dirty, no restaurant or other facilities (except bar). Very close to the centre of Manhattan and only two blocks from nearest subway. Staff generally helpful, especially the doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Taralach
Reviews.Content: The standard of the accommodation was extremely poor at $400 per night (incl taxes) for a "double double " room (i.e. two small double beds) for myself, my wife and daughter. The hordes of school kids in the lobby and the semi-dark corridors adorned with dark brown painted doors doors and brown carpet were an ominous foretaste of what was to come. And so indeed it transpired. The bedroom was gloomy with only one small window, half of which was taken up by the air conditioning unit. The decor and fittings mirrored the corridor outside - predominantly dark brown, dingy and shabby. The air conditioning was so noisy it could only be switched on while the room was unoccupied. The choice at night was to be kept awake by the noise of the air-conditioning or by the sweltering heat. As a result, we left New York exhausted. The bathroom was a miracle akin to fitting a quart into a pint pot. Never before had we seen a WC designed to fit partly under a wash hand basin. Apart from the location, the only positive comment is that the bedroom and bathroom were reasonably clean, although there was a heavy unpleasant underlying smell in the bedroom that lingered in the nostrils and probably emanated from the carpet. There was no point complainiing to hotel staff since, when booking in, we were assured that we were being given one of the best rooms in the building and as similar complaints from previous visitors on this site have clearly been ignored. Never again as far as we are concerned. The last thing you need on holiday is a sense of dread when it comes time to go back to your hotel. The Ameritania might be worth $100 per night but certainly no more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Finlaysmum
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania is in a great location, right next to Broadway and very close to Time Square. The room was clean and comfortable, if a bit drab - lots of dark brown - could do with brightening up a bit. Hotel staff were friendly. Would stay here again, if only for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel86
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in this hotel in August 2007. For my first trip to NY it was in the prefect location at the top of broadway just 5 mins from times square and 5 mins from central park. We changed room twice in search of a room with a safe (although the hotel seemed safe enough that it wouldn't really have been too awful not to have one.) The rooms were clean and there wasn't a lot of noise at night (except the air conditioner which was ridiculously loud at times). We had booked an non-smoking room but ended up in a smoking room but you really couldn't tell, there was no lingering smell of stale smoke or anything like that. However the bathroom did smell and opening the window didn't help. The smell subsided after the matinance staff cleaned the room. When booking the room be sure to specify the number of beds and if you want a safe. There is a kenko's across the street with internet access. A good hotel for students, tourists on a short visit but probably not the best for families/ business/ romance. Stay here if you want easy access to Times Sq, Central Park, 5th Ave shopping etc. and will not be wanting to spend a lot of time in the hotel as the rooms are quite small. The best thing we did was to get the tour bus ticket offer for 3 days which allowed us to go on the main downtown loop tour and then use the buses to get to the Statue of Liberty, UN, WTC, History Museum, Chinatown etc. etc. which worked out much cheaper then using the subway everytime for each of those trips. Its also means you can do the night tour which gives us the view of manhattan from brooklyn at night which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, after looking around”
Reviews.Author: mechcr8r
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for Anniversary trip with wife. Room #505 must be larger room - living room + bedroom with nice king sz. Pros: LOCATION (Broadway Shows, same bldg as Letteman, midway between Central Park & Times Square) Clean. Private bath. swanky lobby. we had happy staff. AC (but window units). Interesting/authentic feel. Cons: TVs didn't work well (tried to watch news for weather), bath lighing, didn't get everything during apparent renovation. Batteries missing from remote - had to borrow from safe to make work. SUMMARY: I'd be good with staying here again - so if you can't decide, or your know than me (not difficult about New York), feel confident booking this hotel. On my next trip I'm gonna look around a bit more... My TRAVELER PROFILE (so you undertand my perspetive): spend 90~110 nights per year in hotel rooms. Mostly Doubletrees, Hmptn Inns, Embsy Stues, & Hiltons. I'm a "6~7" on "Pickey" scale of 10 - I want things clean, comfortable, & operational with a hotel staff that appreciates your business.

Reviews.Title: “A good spot”
Reviews.Author: stretch61
Reviews.Content: We went to the Ameritania on the 24/28th of nov 06, what a nice hotel in a good spot on Broadway next door to the Ed Sullivan theater where the late show with David Letterman is made.I went with my partner and 6 yr old son(at the time),we had a great time there. It was a 5 min walk to Time square and about the same to Central park, all the places we went to you could walk there, it's the best way to see New York. The hotel itself was clean and tidy the staff were very helpful, and the rooms were clean and a good size, we didn't have a view but that didn't matter because we were out allday and most of the night so we only used to sleep in it anyway.There was a diner across the road as you come out of the hotel next to the gift shop, with a good range of food and all the coffee you could drink, all the places we ate in were reasonable with the prices. We thought it was a good hotel in a prime spot and would go there again. Only downside was they don't have any food there. Oh and you must go up the Empire state if you get the chance, the views are breathtaking, also try the Manhattan cocktail in the hotel it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: sazzer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very hot New York! we stayed at the Ameritania Hotel, which after reading some reviews i was a bit worried. But i have to say the staff were very helpful the rooms clean and the bathrooms clean with plenty of hot water. For what you use your hotel room for this hotel was more than adequate. The location was excellent, and Applejacks diner around the corner was great for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Ameritania Nightmare !!!!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_place
Reviews.Content: Absolute nightmare !!! We had a fire during the night & there were no fire alarms in the room, woke to the sound of what we thought were ash carts!!!, only to look out of the window to find the Hotel surrounded by fire engines!!! The fire exits were so small & we could not see for the smoke, when we got out there was no staff to find out what had happened or what we were to do! It was Hours & hours later that we were told we could re-enter the hotel & GO BACK TO OUR ROOMS! Most of the reception area was gone! Apparently it was a electrical fault but this was never explained as the staff were so rude & unhelpful!! NEVER EVEN CAME TO OUR ROOM TO SEE THAT WE WERE OK,OT EVEN A NOTE !!!! I RECOMMEND THAT YOU STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: Sparky68
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and a friend booked to stay at the Ameritana through Virgin Holidays. I did not read any reviews until after the booking had been made and i have to say that all the way to the states i was slightly concerned as to what we would find, but there was no need to worry. We arrived just after 3pm in the afternoon (which is when checking starts) we were greeted by a very polite man behind the reception desk who undertook our checking in very quickly and efficently, by 3.15pm we were in our room with our luggage which was brought up for us by a very helpful bellboy. The room was perfectly adequate in size for three adults and the bathroom was not small as some people have said with plenty of hot water, the room also had a VERY effective air condtioning unit which was very welcome as they were experiencing a mini heatwave in New York while we there. Overall we throughly enjoyed our trip to New York and our stay at the Ameritania Hotel This is my third trip to New York and the comment that somebody has made about this being the worst hotel in New York is wrong that accolade deserves to go to the Quality(!) Inn on 47th street.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the WORST hotel in all of NYC”
Reviews.Author: jmtiburon
Reviews.Content: How could this hotel be rated a 4-star hotel? The only good thing about this hotel is its location. The staff was polite too. But the room sucked! Had we stayed more than 1 night, I would have definitely requested a room change. But because we were just staying there one night, we decided to suck it up. The room was the size of a walk-in closet. The carpet was damp and a bit smelly. It definitely needed a nice steam cleaning. The hallway to the room was poorly lit. The toilet wouldnt flush. The bathroom was without any toilet paper. There was barely any hot water AND absolutely no water pressure at all in the shower. The towels were horrible. We had to use the hair dryer to finish drying ourselves and to take the lint off from the towels. For the price we paid ($242) for 1 night, I'm sure we could have found something else a lot better. Never again will I stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ameritania NY, one of the Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: Bossk
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in NY and me and my girlfriend decided to book at Ameritania Hotel for our 10 nights trip. Since the beginning we were greatly surprised by the beauty of the Hotel : large rooms with king beds, very clean bathroom, excellent service and general mainteneance. Personal is very kind with customers, morover it's possible to have FREE tea/coffe 24 hourse per day at the bar. The position is also another good point, in fact Ameritania Hotel is located at 54th St W Broadway...in other words at Times Square...the very Heart of New York. Subway train is at 1.30 minutes walking, really really near. Considering also the price we payed by booking online, I have to admit that this Hotel is one of the Greatest!!! Recommended to everyone who wants to stay in the very centre of NY without an enourmous amount of money . Bossk

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: Jouby
Reviews.Content: After 10 days in NY and New England, we were looking for a central-located hotel to end our honeymoon trip. A friend from NYC suggested we experience the Ameritania. We stayed at there from Aug 7 to 9. Having read some mixed reviews about the property, I must say we were very impressed by the hotel, the room and the service! The hotel location is perfect, between Times Square and Central Park South,... whitin easy walking distance from lots of sights. We were assigned a wonderful double room, up on the 11th floor with an AMAZING view on Broadway! The room was clean, quite and the air conditionning was working very well. The bathroom was quite large -compared to Paris size! Although located in a busy district, the property was safe and quiet. As for the staff, Silwia at the front desk was professional and friendly. When checking out, Jeff the valet kindly took care of our tons of luggage and arranged a town car to drive us to JFK. Great service! Merci! We highly recommend this property and will surely return there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Just Book It!”
Reviews.Author: mommamoe
Reviews.Content: Convenient , Super Location. Friendly Staff...Bellman Jalal and Jeffrey extremely courteous and helpful! 2 Comfy Double Beds in a clean, large enough for 4, room in the heart of the theatre district for a bargain price! Paid $274 total for this gem. Similar accomodations easily cost 400-500. Parking on opposite corner $23 for 24 hours...all around best deal...JUST BOOK IT!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location clean rooms - hotel just needs freshened up”
Reviews.Author: 1STTIMEBERLIN
Reviews.Content: Hi stayed here for 4 nights with my wife and 2 teenagers. The Location is excellent - just round the corner from Broadway/7th Avenue. Everything is easily reached on foot - central park 5/10 minutes. Timesquare again 5/10 minutes, top of the rock and empire state easy walking, 5th avenue, bloomingdales macys etc all easy to walk to. Great place to eat breakfast opposite the hotel (the europa cafe) also good for lunch. Rooms quite good - the twin room was very big it had 2 double beds, our double room was also quite big (ask for one on the 8th floor at the back of the hotel much quieter room 815) Rooms in reasonable order, clean bathrooms clean also. The hotel just needs a new lick of paint and wallpaper and lighting to bring it up to date. Great free tea/coffee in the hotel lounge available all day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: glass0ni0n
Reviews.Content: Went with my dad for 4-days/3-nights, all I can say about this hotel is it's a great deal for the location you get. Unlike other cheap/good-location hotels in NYC you do get your own bathroom at this hotel... always nice. The rooms are VERY small - if you want a nice big room, look elsewhere and spend more... if you want to go to NYC to see NYC then this is a good hotel. The view is terrible, but who cares, you're a 10 second walk from the Ed Sullivan Theater - if Dave is taping that week you get to enjoy all the whacky stunts they do out on W 53rd, which is less than a 1 minute walk away. There is a subway stop across the street (W 53rd and Broadway), lots of restaurants, and a convenience store open 24 hours right across the street. Central Park is about a 10-15 minute walk north, Times Square is about 5 minutes away, as is Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal, etc... Go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, broken toilets, and somehow it's all our fault?!?”
Reviews.Author: acs9000
Reviews.Content: Two coworkers and I booked rooms here on a last-minute business trip. Two of us got rooms through hotels.com - the rooms we got were tiny, with bathrooms so small and cramped that you had to step out of the bathroom to close the shower door and had to sit side-saddle if you wanted to use the toilet. And, we were the lucky ones. The third room had a toilet that was already clogged and broken when my coworker checked in, and had an air conditioner whose only setting seemed to be " jungle-like humidity". And, this was after he was checked into an already occupied room and had to call from the room to find out a) what room he was supposed to be in, and b) get the key to that room. Of course, the desk acted like it was his fault that he took the key they gave him and went to the room they told him was his. Lastly, the elevators are awful. The down arrows for the call buttons don't light to show you that they work, and the lights on the lobby buttons in the elevator don't light either, so you're never sure where you're going to end up. And, it's much faster to take the stairs, either up or down, especially when you're on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Whataboutya
Reviews.Content: New York - Ameritania Hotel Date: 13th July 2007 Reviewer: Donna White, Belfast, N.Ireland This was my first visited to New York. I was greeted at the hotel by very friendly and helpful staff. You could not beat the location of this hotel, very central to everything, 10 minute walk to Times Square and 10 minute walk to Central Park. The rooms and bathrooms were very small but clean and tidy and fresh towels and linen everyday and fully air conditioned. The size did not matter to me as you only slept and showered in your room. Staff were very helpful regarding tourist information and booking tours. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York but if you like plenty of space in hotel rooms this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: Staid there from May 7 - May 10 You can not beat the location. It is a short walk to Times Square and Central Park and therefore the location is great if you like staying in the Theatre District. The rooms are small with even smaller bathrooms so that you can not sit straight on the toilet without orthopedic assistance or permanent knee damage. The staff actually was friendly and got me a bigger room after the second night which did not resemble the shoebox I had staid in earlier, but the bathroom challenge continued. I suggest for future reservation to get a room to the back and not the front as the 54th street could be noisy during the night. It is an Ok Hotel like the rest of the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: thisiskristine
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't so bad. You can't beat the location - 5 min. walk to Times Square and 5 min walk to the Subway. The room is small, but really are you going to NYC to stay in your room? My friends and I just slept and showered in the room. We were really never there. If you want a place that's in a central location and you're not planning to stick around in your room - stay here. It's really not as bad as people say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average rooms, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Tredcon
Reviews.Content: To start on a positive note, this hotel is in a great location. It is close to Times Square and is right near the famous Soup Kitchen from Seinfeld. Although it was closed when I visited in winter. The hotel room itself was okay, but I question the cleanliness and think there may have been bed bugs because I got bitten by something while sleeping in the bed. Also, there was no fridge which was annoying if you wanted to keep some juice or water handy and there was no kettle if you wanted a coffee. There was a 24 hour deli across the road though. The worst part of the Ameritania was the service. It was appalling. The staff were rude and sneered at you if you asked for help. I was quite upset by this considering the rates were quite high. Really, the location was the only saving grace for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Traceymbelle
Reviews.Content: After we booked to stay at the Amertiania I found the online reviews. To be honest my Partner and I thought we had made a huge mistake after reading these. We arrived at the hotel on 10th June, we were greeted by very friendly doormen who took charge of our luggage as we booked in. As we were booking in I requested a smoking room so had to wait a while longer for it to be prepared although a non smoking room would have been ready straight away. Upon entering our room we found it to be very clean and had all the facilities that we felt essential, a comfy bed, safe, air conditioning, plenty of storage space, good shower, tv, iron, ironing board, hairdryer. We were very pleasantly surprised and relieved. We stayed at the Ameritania for a week and have no cause for complaint, it is ideally situated on the corner of west 54th and Broadway. (little tip if getting cab from airport and driver not familiar with Hotel, tell him its next door to Letterman theatre, they all seem to know that!) On the day of our departure we asked the doorman to book us a cab to take us to the airport, he offered us the use of the Hotels car, which we booked with him. We found this a more pleasant experience than the yellow cab that we arrived in which was grubby. Overall our stay at the Ameritania was very positive and we will be staying there again when we return to New York in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Where's a flashlight when you need it???!”
Reviews.Author: JawjaPeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip because of the convenient location. Bad decision! The hotel looks and feels shabby - maybe that explains why they apparently don't use a lightbulb over 25 watts. The elevator was so dark you had to bend down to see which buttons represented which floors. The rooms were dark, bathroom small (no counter space at all!) and no internet connection in my room. Traffic noise was horrible. The carpet in the room was very worn. The carpet in the hallway was very stained. I won't be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trippinLa
Reviews.Content: Great location around the corner from Letterman and close to Times Square. Small room slightly run down and staff just OK. Asked for a taxi to JFK and they set up a limo saying it would cost the same but it was more money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: SouthOCtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on a recent business trip to New York with about 12 other colleagues. I arrived alone and had no trouble checking in. My room (#1109) was quite large, with a large bed and a medium-sized bathroom. There was no view, but I didn't really care. I had no complaints about the room at all. My main complaint is about the elevators. When they worked, they were very slow! And they didn't always work. One time when I was trying to leave to go to dinner, the elevators were out of order. Instead of walking down 11 flights of stairs, three other people (whom I didn't know) and I decided to take the freight elevator down. (Bad idea!) The freight elevator was very small and hot. It didn't work very well. We got stuck for awhile. And then when the doors finally opened, we were in the basement of the hotel! So we ended up having to walk through the bowels of the hotel to find our way out. An employee yelled at us and told us we weren't supposed to be down there. (Believe me, we had NO desire to be down there! It was scary!) That was the only drama I experienced during my visit. But I was very unhappy that there was no food in the hotel! (Luckily, there's a Starbucks right across the street. And "Rays PIzza," also across the street, was delicious!) One of my colleagues had a very bad experience! To make a long story short, when she got to her room at 12pm one night, her key wouldn't work. She went back and forth from her room to the front desk six times trying to get a key that would work. They finally sent a guy with the master key to open her room. So she was able to get into her room, but she still didn't have a key that would work! When she called the manager to explain the situation and get a key, he said, "Do what you need to do," and hung up on her! She was so angry that she moved to a different hotel the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mickytickler2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I where there for only 2 nights. When we got there we were greeted by a friendly doorman and equaly front desh staff. Good looking lobby. The reason we booked this hotel was because of it's location, it is the best for the price. When we got our room we where very happy until we found out our air con had not worked, still a great room. We still thought cool great location, we are not going to be in our room long. As my my wife is up the duff I thought I would mention it before we left for a night out. I was told everything would be worked out before we returned. Upon our return I asked if it was sorted, to my suprise the the lady at the front desk told us we should never have been given that room as it was out of order. We where given an up grade to a kings size room. All I can say is this hotel is great location with 1st class staff. One thing if you look to book this hotel ahead of time look to see if david Letterman is doing a show as it's about 20m around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location....”
Reviews.Author: emgi99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid May over a really chilly weekend. I booked this hotel after trawling Tripadvisor for an inexpensive (ok, they're ALL expensive in NYC!) and clean hotel. The rooms are tiny (as expected) but clean which was our main consideration. They could do with modernising but nothing we couldn't live with for a few days. The shower took an age to run hot but was lovely once it did. The lobby was being renovated when we arrived and they'd finished by the time we left. The location was excellent - a 10 minute walk to the heart of Times Square one way and less than 10mins to Central Park in the other. We walked everywhere including very late at night and felt very safe. I would recommend this hotel so long as your expectations of the hotel for the money you have to spend to stay downtown are not high!

Reviews.Title: “Firetrap”
Reviews.Author: burnedByAmerithania
Reviews.Content: This review is written as a warning to anyone who might consider staying at this hotel, or suing them. I had the misfortune of being at this hotel when it caught fire. The building filled with thick, black, putrid, choking smoke and I am suffering from breathing problems as a result. The hotel staff â€œabandoned shipâ€� leaving all guests to fend for themselves. Fire escapes were filled with choking smoke and two of the three were blocked, forcing guests into a third floor hall that was filled with smoke. It could easily have turned tragic. The next morning, the hotel manager, Mark Wellings, had offered to comp me for all the nights, but then reneged and later surreptitiously billed my credit card for over $700 after I checked out. To make matters worse, George Dfouni, COO of Amsterdam Hospitaltiy defended his behavior as being a matter of policy and steadfastly refused to make good on the agreement and soaked me out of a couple of extra nights of income after nearly killing me. I would not have stayed the extra days after the fire if Mark Wellings had not offered to comp my stay. Mr Dfouni also threatened to take legal action against me if I post this comment, trying to intimidate me from warning others about this firetrap. The Internet is filled with extraordinary discontent for this hotel. Google wisely before staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsCH
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location - near to Central Park and Times Square. The rooms are not huge (but not tiny either) and are clean and modern with comfy beds. There is free (help yourself) tea and coffee in the lobby and a bar area. The whole hotel is decorated in an art deco style. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was that all the lighting was quite dim (even in the quest rooms). We were quite worried by some of the comments we'd read about the Ameritania but decided to try it anyway and were glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel stinks”
Reviews.Author: mike190
Reviews.Content: If you like having a hotel room that is a box, no more than 270 sq feet/ than this is the place for you, my living room is bigger than this entire room. The TV was old, and had lines and ghosts through it, so the picture was aweful. The bed was a pad, and had a bump through the middle of the wood that the pad was on, so sleeping in the middle of the bed was impossible, so if your a side-sleeper than this is a bed for you ! The bathroom was a closet, the shower was a joke, it had literally a piece of plastic preventing the water from going onto the floor, no elevation, OH did I say I am 6ft 5 and the shower head was at least 1 foot above my head ? it was impossible to get a real shower, and the level of control of heat and cold was almost impossible to regulate. The rugs need to be cleaned for sure and the air conditioner made a horrible noise everytime you turned it on. Finally the luggage area and closet area was so small that I just left my things in my bag, I have sleep apnea, and so putting my sleep machine near the bed was a task that i have never experienced before, I had to get a 20 ft extension cord and set my machine up that way, and move the clock radio out of the way Their was only 2 things good about the Hotel 1. location- it is next to the Letterman taping/ and about 5 blocks from the center of Times square 2. the maids- they did the best they could to polish a turd

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little room”
Reviews.Author: lovethetheatreinNYC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC with a small group of students (six rooms) and we had a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly and more than helpful. The location is fabulous, the room was small, but what reasonably priced rooms aren't in NYC? The bathroom was European in style, small but fuctional. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows. I would definitely stay again, and would also recommend the Ameritania to friends.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: pixelhead
Reviews.Content: great location and nice lobby. we stayed on a saturday night and booked about a week ahead with travelocity. the room was small, but not a problem for the money. the bed was a double but should have been a queen. the main problem was the bathroom. the toilet is wedged in between the sink and shower as if they'd forgot and stuck it in the only place they had left. you couldn't actually sit on the toilet as intended but had to sit sideways. to open the shower door you almost had to open the bathroom door and step out. very strange setup. at checkout we mentioned we were disappointed with the bed and toilet and the woman at the desk sorta chuckled at us and came out with a printout of the travelocity webpage. see, she says, this is the room you were promised online with travelocity. she couldn't have been less interested in simply saying i'm sorry you didn't have a good experience at our hotel. it was, you got what you deserved. we'll look elsewhere in the city next time we are in for a show. perhaps other, more expensive rooms booked through someone other that travelocity would be nicer but the attitude won't change.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Debbie2112
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in january for 5 nights.I couldn't believe just how good the location was. When we arrived in our room we were shocked.We thought the room would ne small but it was a large room with 2 double beds. There was a safe which is good. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean.The decor is nice.I think the bad reviews from this hotel are written by people who are expecting the ritz for a cheap price.If you want the ritz pay for it,if you want a room to get a good nights sleep and a central location i would expect to pay alot too but we didnt have to pay alot to get that quality because we got it all here. Our room was just above david lettermans studio.When you walk out the door and turn right you are not even a minute away from times square which is amazing at night. We never used the subway once. We walked eveywhere.It is tiring but it is worth it because you see soo much more and by walking everywhere we found all of the good shops. We are fussy about food so we played safe and ate pizza most times and planet hollywood and hard rock cafe. We even met sofia bush at planet hollywood,promoting her new film over there. New york is brilliant.I want to go back.You will never be bored.We got everyting done in our 5 days there. We done rockerfellar and the tour, empire state building,ground zero,times square (every night) brooklyn bridge. and the rest,go to central park its amazing especially when snowing ,My boyfriend proposed to me here which made the trip the most perfect of my life. Visit the trump building. Best thing to do is the build a bear workshop,it was brilliant for adults too. Visit t.its an experiance. Ive went on and on so il finsih my review, New York is the best place to visit.alk everywhere if you want to see it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EJCS
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were a bit a bit anxious at staying here after reading some not so positive reviews, but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel has a fantastic location - most attractions/ shops are an easy walk and there are a number of subway stops nearby to whisk you downtown. We stayed in a double room on the 11th floor, which was rear facing and very peaceful... Couldn't hear the traffic at all and the room was HUGE. Bed was comfy. We stayed 15-22 March which was the same time as an unexpected winter storm blew in. Despite the driving snow outside, our room was v warm, with plenty of hot water. Radiator packed in one night and we were provided with a plug-in heater which did the job nicely. The room was spotless and staff were helpful. We'll definitely stay here again. Local eateries: The deli across the road is good for hot choc and bagels for breakfast, but the deli bar is expensive - thoroughly recommend Mangia & Bevi at 53rd & 9th for a pasta and soda lunch for $7. Great food and courteous staff. Eatery (also 53rd & 9th) also v good for dinner, but it gets busy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_So
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee stayed at this hotel in march 2007 for 7 nights. We chose this hotel mainly because it was cheap. The hotel itself needs abit of a refurb but its certainly not a major problem. The hotel offers free coffee and tea (which you make yourself). Our room was located on the 7th floor, it was a good size and clean. The first thing I did was check if we had hot water, which we didn't so we called reception and they sent a maintenance guy up, he just ran the tap for abit and we had hot water (its a old boiler system). On our first night we got woken up at 2am by the sound of out radiator making a extremely loud hissing noise. The guy at reception couldn't help cos the maintenance guy wasn't there, he just told us to turn the black knob to turn it off but we'd have no heating. The noise slowly eased down but not completely. The next day, we complained to reception and demanded we be moved to another room, so we moved to the 11th floor. This room was much bigger and quieter. We were much happier for the rest of our holiday because we didn't have a noisy radiator but our room was right next to the only ice machine in the hotel. Oh well can't have everything. I do recommend this hotel because it is value for money and location is really good but do try and get a room quite high up.

Reviews.Title: “Joy”
Reviews.Author: tessbess
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three friends in AMERITANIA for a week we all enjoyed our stay and had no complaints it was central for us to be able to see all the sights and when your in new york your not going to be staying in the room judging how small it is when theres so much to see at your doorstep. In the evening then they have a lovely quite bar for relaxing.Enjoyed stay thoroughly

Reviews.Title: “If you've ever wondered what it's like to sleep in an igloo”
Reviews.Author: montrealcritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania in February. It's a fantastic location, walking distance to all the shows and around the corner from the Dave Letterman Theatre. The rooms are really tiny, television channel reception was poor and every time we took a shower, it filled the tub, i.e. poor drainage. But the worst part of the room was the tiny radiator heater, entirely controlled by the hotel. I slept in a wool hat, sweater, flannel pj's and socks and was still cold. Hotel staff was unsympathetic but provided more blankets albeit thin ones. I caught a cold towards the end of the stay and nothing made it more miserable than to wake up in a cold room and return to a cold room every day. My advice: spend extra on a hotel with a good heating system or wait until summer to visit and pray the Ameritania's air conditioning works.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: signora2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was affordable and in a great location. For that, we were not disappointed. Even though we were there in an "off season" and during a terrible cold spell, the hotel was fully booked. It is two blocks from the subway and within walking distance to most theaters and good restaurants. The first room we had was on the third floor, facing the street. It was small, cold and noisey. The next day they moved us to an interior room on the 9th floor that was perfect for our needs. The desk staff was very responsive. Other cons: no coffee in the room, though you can get a cup of coffee 24/7 in the lobby; no concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: squidger2000
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay at the Ameritania with my dad, overall the hotel was lovely and have no complaints at all! we were a bit worried about the size of the room after reading reviews on here but we had a large room with two double beds and a lovely bathroom and a walk in wardrobe (we stayed on the 11th floor). hotel staff are really friendly and you couldnt ask for a better location, close to subways and walking distance to everything in mid town. would definantly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JWaters
Reviews.Content: After looking over numerous reviews of the Ameritania, I must admit I had my doubts, but our king-size room was clean, spacious, & comfortable. For the 4 days-3 nights we were there, the TV, remote control, iron and blow dryer worked fine. The bathroom was larger than in many more expensive hotels with plenty of immediate hot water and free-flowing drains. Our room was cleaned and replenished with towels early every day. The staff was helpful and pleasant - no problems with check-in or check-out. The lobby area was cozy, plenty of seating, beautiful fireplace area and loved the free coffee/tea bar. The location and price cannot be beat. Looking at all Ameritania's good points, the few things needing improvement (elevator, radiator and carpeting) , I would recommend this hotel and visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: lisalewington
Reviews.Content: Dark and dingy, dirty and smelly, bodged and dangerous . There is no way that virgin who we travelled with have vetted this place or thomas cook we booked with, if they have then they were wearing blindfolfs ! The only good thing was the location , you would be better of staying in the ymca it would knock spots off this place . To the people who have half praised this place you are very easily pleased . Group of 6 from bath uk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: LauraM4114
Reviews.Content: I felt I had to write this review after reading some of the scathing remarks on this website. I just returned from a weekend at the Ameritania, and I have to say it was a pleasant experience. I don't know about other travelers, but I didn't go to New York City to worry too much about my hotel room. It was definitely small, but nicely furnished and comfortable. The location is great, right around the corner from the Late Show, and within easy walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, and the theater district. It has a cute little bar in the lobby and free (good) coffee and tea available all day long. If you are looking for a reasonably priced way to spend some time in New York City, this is a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shanogue
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend. It is dark and gloomy. Our room was on the 3rd floor. The elevator was very busy, we oft en had to wait quite a while for it. The carpets in the hallway looked damp and dirty. Our room itself was small. We had a king size bed which was v.comfy but there was barely enough room to walk around it. The room was dark and gloomy. Our view was of a brick wall. The plumbing was ancient - the radiator was very noisy!! I wore earplugs!! The room was warm but not too warm. Electrics in the room were VERY dodgy!! There was a radio alarm clock that worked occasionally if you wiggled the wire! My partner got a shock off the light switch! And when I tried to plug in a hairdryer, sparks flew out of the socket and the trip switch went and we lost all power. When I rang down to reception she wasn't a bit surprised - obviously nothing new for them! They did fix it pretty quickly but I was afraid to plug anything else in for the rest of our stay! The tea/coffee in the lobby area was nice. And location was excellent. I think I would look for somewhere a bit more cheery and modern the next time though! (And somewhere I can plug in things!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenBailes
Reviews.Content: Okay, well I have never yet got lucky with my room in New York, and the Ameritania didnt buck that trend. I took my girlfriend for her first time and her initial impression was not helped by our room - it overlooked the bin area at the back of the hotel with no view at all. Also, the room was freezing. But thankfully, thats where the bad stuff stops. Apart from the view, the room was excellent - it was great in size, very clean, and the bathroom was very nice. The reception were very friendly and helpful (The airline had lost our luggage and the reception desk had loads of experience in helping tourists in this situation), the entrance was grand and the bar was great and very trendy. The location was brilliant and practically on Times Square, so no complaints at all there. For the price we paid, I cant complain about the view to be honest, and I got the overall impression that If we had asked to change rooms, they would have let us, I was just tired after the journey there. Pros: Location Well decorated Very clean and tidy Nice bar Very Very friendly staff Cons: Cold!! Very very cold!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: discerning1
Reviews.Content: I have only stayed in NYC one other time, but do a lot of traveling for work. The lobby was very contemporary and the Twister Lounge, with a FP and free coffee & tea 24/7, was relaxing. The location was unbeatable if you want a short walk to Times Square and the many theaters located on and off Broadway. While others have posted bad experiences, I have none to report. The clean room was amply sized with a small foyer, walk-in closet, 2 double beds (with nice down comforters). The shower pressure was good and the water hot (very). Our room was initially cold, but in addition to the radiator heat, which wasn't overly noisy, the hotel had an electric version already in the room. With both systems, we were very comfortable. No noise from the hall or the street. The doorman was friendly and welcoming. The lobby consisted of some families, and while I was waiting for the front desk to get confirmation of my online reservation, I didn't overhear anyone grumbling. My ears were open for the 3 nights I stayed there (during President's Day weekend), and don't have anything negative to report. Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Changing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joolzief
Reviews.Content: Date:February 2007 We have just had 3 nights at the Ameritania which we chose due to the location and the website. Both looked fantastic. we asked for a nice room with a view on arrival, having read some of the previous reviews. We were given a box room on the second floor with a view of a wall. Avoid the internal rooms. We asked to change immediately and were given another room which had no heating (it was Minus 10 outside) and a gap between the wall and the window, with the wind whistling in. We asked for another room. We accepted it - it was roomy and althought the bathroom was tiny and a bit grubby it was fine. the next day the toilet blocked and couldn't be fixed. We changed again. We unpacked our stuff went out for the day and then came back to the room to freshen up to go out again. The room was freezing. The radiator wasn't working and although an engineer was there within minutes it wasnt fixed. we changed rooms again following a poilte but firm conversation on the phone to the duty manager. The receptionist took us to see 2 further rooms, the first of which was freezing. The second was fine. The receptionist then informed us that she had been getting lots of very angry complaints form other guests and said she would never stay in this hotel!! We were compensated to the tune of about $80. apart form this and the fact that there are no tea/ coffee facilities in the bedrooms it was fine!!

Reviews.Title: “exelent location, and price”
Reviews.Author: miezu78
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 days paid an average of $120.00 per day including tax. (Feb 2007) the location is excellent The tonight show with david letterman is filmed on the other corner of this building. the temp outside was about 15 degrees but inside was hot to hot i slept with the window opened, all nights. the TV is small and jest basic cable, but who cares i wasn't there to watch TV. the room was clean. i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Andrea-Arg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ameritania for a whole week in January. I was concerned about this hotel because of the reviews but, as my parents had stayed there a year before, I thought I might give it a try. Let me first tell you, I wasn't this upset while at the hotel, and had a great time in NYC. But I have to be fair with my review, I don't think a had a fair price on this hotel, sometimes cheaper doesn't mean a good deal. As soon as I arrived I was a bit disappointed, nobody offered to help me with my luggage (and I walked by the bellboys struggling with my suitcases). I got to the front desk and the check-in was extremely fast and nobody walked me to my room. In a 12 floors hotel, with more than 20 rooms per floor, without any help with the luggage... that could be quite upsetting for a vacation starter. Anyway I was able to find my room on the 11th floor. I was quite surprised with it, it was actually more spacious than I expected (due to previous reviews). But, after a few minutes in there I realized it had no save box, the TV was too small and the remotes didn't work. I went back to the front desk and asked for another room. They didn't resist and gave me a new one on 6th floor right away. This one was even more spacious, and even though windows faced to another building, it wasn't dark or unpleasant at all. Unfortunately, the heating system was really old, didn't work well and made a lot of noise (after a while I got used to it). They sent an engineer who couldn't do much that late at night (or so he said). They gave me an aditional electric heater and I thought they would take care of the heating the next day, but they didn't, nor during the whole week. The room didn't have mini bar, and the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. Therefore, you are always obligated to go out if you want something to eat, or even to drink. I once sat at the lobby bar to take advantage of the free coffee, but tables were all dirty, no one seemed to care and it just didn't feel nice. So I never went back to the bar. I should have listened to other previews, this hotel is really old, hallways are really dark and dingy, it could really use a makeover and cleanliness isn't its strong suit. Besides the inconvenients I had, this was not my first time in NYC and I would like to stand out the fact that I know I could have got a much better deal. So finally, I wouldn't recommend this hotel, even if it seems cheap, you could definitely get something better for the same money in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: ls_lptn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location near times square shopping and anywhere else you want 2 go to in new york. Was there for st patricks day, best experience off my life so far. The hotel rooms are fine and lovely views off other buildings from the window. The staff are very friendly and would do anything for you. Broadway right on your doorstep off the hotel and gym down the road. For the price this hotel is a good bargain to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the cost”
Reviews.Author: PatrickN
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I have just got back from a week in Manhattan staying at the Ameritania. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted by Geoff the doorman who helped with our bags and took us to the recepton desk. The hotel is well decorated and has a free coffee point in the bar area which is furnished with large sofas.There is no restaurant in the hotelat the moment... but across the street the 54 Deli was good for take out breakfasts or dinner. The hotel room was on the 10th floor and I would recommend to others to ask for a high room as Broadway is quite noisy. The room was clean and tidy with a californian queen size bed. The bathroom was ok but could do with a little modernisation. On the whole we had a good week there and the hotel is well place between Times square and Columbus circle (Central Park SW corner) . Would go back to the hotel The reception desk staff were friendly and helped us book trips and transfers. I would happily reccomend the hotel to others and will be going back there in the Autumn.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok......”
Reviews.Author: ihateflyin
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend came to New York last year in January, and we had a nice stay in Ameritania.. so although we initially wanted to stay in a different hotel this time round the prices were really good (Â£250 for 5 nights) we decided to stay at the Ameritania, again. Last time we stayed we had a room on the 7th floor, overlooking broadway, this room had 2 double beds which proved helpful in packing, unpacking etc. After requesting a room overlooking Broadway on a higher floor, we were given one on the 12th. This room had one bed which we didnt mind at all. However, the room had so many problems It seriously dented what would have otherwise been a brilliant holiday. The room was very dark, which seemed to be a permanent issue throughout the hotel, from the lobby, the lifts, the hallway and the room. I had to literally sit by the window to put make up on! The hallways and lift did not make me feel very safe, and I would have been terrified if I was staying there alone. The doormen were practically non existent, they were never there to open the door or help us with our luggage, even when they saw us struggling as we were leaving! The radiator is absolutely Terrible. Every single night without fail there would be a loud banging noise which would continue for about 10-15 minutes, this happens at around midnight.. beware. There was also one night when I literally woke up in a sweat, it was surely over 40degrees celsius. I had to stumble to the window just to get some fresh air into the room. The plumbing in the bath was also in need of maintenance, with the water not draining through at a normal pace, filling up very quickly. Although someone came to fix it, the problem was solved for literally 2 hours. And finally.. the bed. It dips in the middle. I found myself constantly fighting against gravity to stay on my side of the bed. It was really horrible. The pillows were also poor quality, it must have been filled with foam or something. The location was really good, subway just a block away and Times Square practically at your doorstep.. If you get a good deal, this hotel would be worth it.. But for a more luxurious stay, go somewhere else. I know we will!! PS. Do not stay at room 1202!

Reviews.Title: “They dont konw what theyre doing”
Reviews.Author: JarkkoK
Reviews.Content: Our company staff stayed in the hotel for two nights and in the first night, we were really tired of jetlag. We fell asleep in 10 p.m. and did not open the TV that night. Two nights after we were checking out from the hotel and clerk said that we watched a movie in our room in the first night (at 11 p.m.), which was not true. We had to pay the 14 dollars, because we were going to the airport and did not have time to argue about it. Hotel itself was just ok (although dirty), but that bs about us watching a movie got us thinking about somekind of rip-off. I know that New Yorkians are not very known for their hospitality, but that really hit the rock bottom. IÂ´ll never stay in that Hotel again and I strongly suggest that no one else would either. Or at least ask them to disabe the TV so you cannot even open it. Otherwise they would suddenly "find" some way to charge you just when you are signing out from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ClassCass
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we could have expected. We booked the hotel a week before we left and got a really good deal. The room was a decent size and bathroom was very clean. After reading loads of different reviews for different hotels we were delighted we picked the Ameritania. Location is brilliant. Bed was very comfortable. We were on the 8th floor. The carpet in hall was a bit stained but there was no musty smell. I have already recommended this hotel to a few people.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful with this place”
Reviews.Author: TravelinManUS
Reviews.Content: Confirmed reservation and rate the week I checked in. When I checked out they charged me 2.2 times MORE than agreed. I protested but of course they run your card when you check in. I have made numerous calls to get an adjustment but they refused. Be careful when you stay at this property. Rooms were very small but typical of many hotels in NYC. Otherwise would have been a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, you get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimv4web
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel location is the best quality of the hotel, the price is right for the location as well. You are right in the middle of the theater district and Time Square is only a few blocks away. Subway stations closed by, walking to Fifth avenue and Central Park. The fun ends here, folks! Oh, and the king bed that we have was really comfortable too. Cons: Dingy hallway and damp, musty smell in both hallway and in the bathroom of our room. Finally found out it came from the ancient heating systems they have. We have to crack the window open in the bathroom (luckiy we are on 12th floor so it was ok to leave window crack opened) otherwise the musty mildew (almost gassy) smell in the bathroom will drift in the bedroom. One night we woke up in the middle of the night to the sound of hissing noises, found out later it was the ancient (again) heater hissing out steam like it was going to flow. We couldn't find any button to turn it down or off, yikes!!! Call to the front desk got us the bellman, who came up 5 minutes later and could not turn it off until he use the face towel to turn a gasket nut at the base of the heater and finally it went out. whew! They did offered to move us to another room but it was 3 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Funky space, great location.”
Reviews.Author: burkely
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights here at the beginning of December for work. The location in Midtown, a couple of blocks from both MOMA and Times Square is outstanding. The hotel is nicely decorated in what is probably art-deco. The furnishing are a little worn, but still much nicer than your average chain hotel. The staff were friendly-ish. I would stay there again and recommend to anyone looking for a reasonable, interesting place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad”
Reviews.Author: LouT
Reviews.Content: Ok, the hotel room was small and the carpets on the halls need a steam badly, the beds are just ok at best, but the location is great, and the bathrooms are big and clean, and the price was really low (for NYC anyway). I guess that's why the Ameritania is average. Has its good, and bad, but if you are in NY you barely use the room anyway. Remember when it comes to the Ameritania, you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel, although a bit tiried”
Reviews.Author: KASStamford
Reviews.Content: Missed our first night at the hotel due to flight cancellation, so arrived a day late and they only had one room left. If I wrote this review based on that room, it would not be good - very small, poky, tatty, etc. However, very helpful and nice staff moved us the next two nights and our new room was absolutely fine. Roomy, clean, nice bathroom. Hotel in great location, but quiet enough to get some sleep. We even had cocktails in the lounge. Bed linen and towels nice and clean. Really enjoyed our stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel.. Can't Beat the Location.. Or the Price!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmosby
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice affordable place to stay in the heart of Manhattan, this hotel is it!!!! It is right beside the Ed Sullivan Theater where David Letterman's show is taped and a block away from the Broadway Theater, where we went to see The Color Purple musical, which was the purpose of our weekend trip to the city. The Ameritana Hotel is surrounded by all that a tourist could want in NYC, great Broadway shows, attractions, restaurants, and just a few blocks from Times Square and Rockerfeller Center, all of this for less than half of what the chain hotels in the same block were charging. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and the interior furnishings and finishes were modern and trendy. Although, we were very impressed with the hotel, the minimalist nature and the age of the building showed. The bathrooms were uncomfortably small; you couldnâ€™t control the heat in the room, itâ€™s an old radiator system; and the mattresses were a little hard. But hey this is New York, if you want luxury, youâ€™re gonna have to pay for it, and for the price the Ameritana far surpasses expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but rooms like a refridgerator!”
Reviews.Author: cancannes
