Reviews.Content: The location was great, but the rooms were small, the bathroom was miniscule! And definately in need of a refit. The T.V. didn't work, neither did the safe, there was no mini bar and the heater in the room would only give out cold air, consequently the room was like ice - it was minus 10 degrees outside - and felt like minus1 inside! The chambermaid removed a shopping bag from my room thinking it was trash - it included a book and some receipts which I needed to claim expenses on!! The manager offered to reimburse me then went off duty and nobody seemed to know anything about it, so I was not able to get reimbursed before I checked out. I would recommend this hotel for it's location - but bring warm pyjamas or stay during the summer months!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: traveler135
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick trip to New York to take in the holiday sights and stayed at the Ameritania hotel. The hotel was in a good location, close to the theater district and Times Square. We had a room with two double beds and it was small, but we saw a room with one queen sized bed and it was much smaller. Ask for a room towards the back of the hotel, for the rooms are larger. Beds were comfortable with cozy comforters. Overall, the hotel was very clean. The only problems we had were that the telephone did not work and the tv remote did not work properly. We brought this to the attention of the staff, but it was not fixed. All and all we would recommend this hotel for the budget minded visitor to New York who is looking for average accomodations, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SueandMartyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel with a group of friends and found it to be an excellent base to easily get to the New York attractions. The hotel is just off Broadway, a few blocks from Times Square and the Rockerfeller Centre, the David Letterman Show is just around the corner! Lots of restaurants on the doorstep. Our room was small, but clean and fresh towels were supplied each day together with fresh linen. The beds were very comfy, but take ear plugs as NY is certainly the city that never sleeps and the windows don't appear to be double glazed. The bathroom was very small, not a lot of leg room between the loo and bath, which can prove uncomfortable for people like us with long legs. The shower was over the bath, but was quite powerful and lots of hot water. Very good hairdryer in there too. It would have been nice to have had coffee & tea making facilities in the room, but it was available 24/7 in the Twist Bar area just off the lobby, so wasn't really a problem. The decor throughout the hotel was in creams and browns, Art deco style, so was very restful. We found all the staff very courteous and helpful, and we would certainly recommend this hotel to others who want a clean hotel, in a good location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel also great for families”
Reviews.Author: ginny123
Reviews.Content: A hip hotel that worked extremely well for our family of two adults and two eight year olds. Location (54th and Broadway) was terrific - great places to eat close by, walking distance of Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall, Central Park, etc. Tastfully decorated, good size room (by New York standards) with space for two queens, desk, and armchair. Beds were extremely comfortable with fluffy, luxurious comforters. Absolutely best feature for families traveling with kids from a different time zone -- good looking blackout curtains that will enable the kids to sleep late! 24 hour complimentary coffee and tea found in the Twist Lounge which includes an inviting fire place and sofas. Only negative - the water pressure was less than I like and the light in the bathroom was terrible for putting on makeup.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: pebblelake
Reviews.Content: New York, NY... the city that never sleeps. Ameritania is located right outside of Dave Letterman's theatre at 54 and Broadway. The location cannot be more perfect for the 'quieter' crowd, but if you stay in a single room, you'll be facing Broadway and it will be either the noise outside or the airplane-engine AC Unit that will keep you awake all night - visited during the heat wave of '06 with power outages and 45 degree weather, so AC had to run but these old AC units are horrible and that was the worst part of the hotel. The lobby is nicely laid out and serves American and Italian coffee as well as tea all day long. There's a great lobby bar as your meeting place before going out on the town. The rooms - well, the singles are T-I-N-Y but it's NY after all... there is a hole in the wall that pretends to be a closet, and two drawers, so don't bring too much with you. The bathroom is surprisingly large in conjuction with the rest of the room. The bed is a large twin or small double, hard to tell. Hard to walk around with the luggage table open - had to keep the Unit door open to do some ironing. BUT the double rooms are roomy, nice large bed and bath, and a true closet, so spend the extra dollars if you'll be there for two or more nights. There is no on-site restaurant but not to worry - there are so many choices just steps away no matter your taste. This is a mid-range hotel that was not too costly considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the pictures. Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Streeker
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures on the website. The staff at the front desk are friendly but not well put together. I checked into the first room to find it very, very small and a crack in my shower door. Upon moving to another room, I found pink mold on the shower door and the drywall around the plumbing was coming off the wall. I gave one more room a try and to my horror found a live cockroach in my bathroom. That was it! I notified the manager that I was moving hotels and he showed no remorse only to say that the exterminator comes in every month so he was not sure why there was a cockroach in the room. This hotel may be a cheap option and look modern from the pictures, but if you want a clean room do not stay here. I also want to note that the hallways are very dark and dingy. Not a very safe feeling for a woman.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: EM10
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a fabulous trip in nyc with my boyfriend. We stayed four nights in the ameritania hotel. We had a lovely large clean room with two double beds. The room was very comfortable, with clean sheets, towels and bathroom products everyday. The location is also superb, just a stones throw away from central park, times sqaure and fith ave. We also found the staff to be friendly and helpful. I really cannot complain about this hotel. I would definitely go back and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel at the right time of the year”
Reviews.Author: JimsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania in early October. We had a room with two double beds. The room size was fine. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The Ameritania's location is convenient to the theatre center and subway. The staff was friendly and helpful. We took advantage of the 24 hour coffee and tea bar. There is a nice, small bar in the lobby too. We had no problems with street noise from the fourth floor. The Ameritania is an older hotel. Thus, it has window air conditioners. When we were there, it was chilly outside, yet the air conditioner was still in the window. It was not possible to close its vent, so cold air was coming through into the room making it quite chilly. We inquired about getting some heat, but were told that they don't turn on the heat until the outside temperature goes down to 45 degrees. We didn't want to undertake finding another hotel, so we did the best we could to block the cold air, but we were still a bit chilly. I would not recommend staying here unless it is summer or winter.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as made out...”
Reviews.Author: Moniker
Reviews.Content: We were VERY concerned about this hotel having read the previous reviews. We stayed for three nights at the end of October (just back). Yes, the rooms are small (it's New York!). Yes, it could do with a makeover (there are no frills and the rooms are old). But location-wise it's great, very close to everything you could possibly want, and what do you want in NYC except a place to rest your head at night? The rooms are perfectly clean, plenty of toiletries and fresh towels every day, and the bar serves great cocktails...I really didn't think it was that bad (and I don't like to 'slum it'). Our room was very quiet (I requested one that didn't look down onto the street and would suggest you do the same), and granted the air con unit isn't the quietest, but it didnt bother us at all. I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for somewhere special, but for a short break in NYC without breaking the bank it's fine. Hope this allays some fears!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: setonmj
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife originally booked at a the sister hotel the Bentley but was moved to this hotel because of a leaking issue at the Bentley. The exterior is very inconspcious and simple. If you blink you could miss it. There is sporadic bellman service and there was no concierge service the three days we were there. Positively, the room was very neat and clean and surprisingly room for New York standards and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean although they seemed to not replace the proper number of towels and wash cloths. The best part is that you are close to everything and if you need a cab they arent too hard to find and the price is moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel - needs urgent makeover !!”
Reviews.Author: Citynews
Reviews.Content: Was very nervous after reading some of the reviews on this website and sadly, they were pretty accurate. We arrived at the Hotel on Saturday 7 October and were given a room on the 7th floor. We have stayed in New York before (2 years ago) so knew the room was going to be small, but this was ridiculous -it was probably converted from a broom- cupboard, and lets just say that 2 adults plus 2 hard-sided suitcases was a very tight fit! We asked to change rooms but apparently none were available that day, so we had to wait until the following day, when we were then given a room on the 4th floor. This was much larger and had two double beds - not a bad size at all. However, this room had its problems as well, notably the toilet being blocked when we arrived there. The hotel staff very quickly sent an engineer to sort the problem out, but the overall condition of the fixtures and fittings in the bathroom was very poor. Everything was either loose or cracked including the floor tiles. The only positive thing I can say was that the bed linen was clean and the towels were very white and fluffy, and changed every day. Overall, the condition of the hotel didnt affect our enjoyment of a wonderful city, but I would never return here again and I certainly wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location”
Reviews.Author: Bex_Mo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Ameritania Hotel for 5 nights for our first visit to New York. After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor we were a little worried but having arrived after a long flight, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located right on broadway and is about a 10 min walk to Times Square and 10 mins in the other direction to Central Park. Our room was small but then you shouldn't be going to NY to spend all day in your hotel room! We had clean bed sheets and towels every day and the air con is ideal as we went in September and it was still really warm. The rooms are very basic and not at all luxurious, however, for the amount of time we spent there it was just what we needed and great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Braile
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a week whilst on honeymoon in New York, When we first arrived it looked lovely as the lobby is nice. We stayed on the seventh floor and the first thing we noticed is that every single door had obviously been forced open with a crowbar as the marks on the doors are so obvious, i cannot believe nobody else has mentioned this in their reviews! We were petrified every time we went out of the room that it was going to be broke into. There was a safe in the room which was not fixed to the wall, so you could walk out with it under your arm, very useful! We asked to be moved twice as the room was so small and dingy but the reception staff were not at all helpful and just said they had no other rooms available. Decor in the rooms is shabby, air conditioning unit is horrendously noisy and the elevators take forever. The only plus side is that it is in a good location but they seriously need to improve their security as this completely put us off from the start.

Reviews.Title: “A total nightmare, the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: LucFrance
Reviews.Content: Imagine!! Stained and dirty carpets, walls and bathroom, the room so small you can't leave your luggage and walk around the bed, and a continuous noise because the windows are so thin and old it's like you are sleeping in the street!! Plus an unreliable staff and false information on the price of the room (internet acess is NOT free but at 9,95 $ a day). Add to that dangerous electrical plugs and poor lighting and you get a feel for the ambience. The only piece of furniture that do not need repairing is the safe. Not that critical in a hotel room. So fellow travelers do yourself a favor do not stay here unless you absolutely have to, you''ll be much better off without this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small even for me”
Reviews.Author: hrona123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May 2006. When we entered the lobby we thought, great it looks nice. The advert stipulated that there were coffee making facilities in the room along with a mini bar and hair dryer. I didn't find any of them. It also said that tea and coffee were available 24hrs; we didn't see that either until the last day when I asked at reception and was than directed to where this facility was located in the hotel, I think that just proves how inconsiderate the staff are to their guests. Surely this is something that could have been pointed out on our arrival. I wholeheartedly agree with some of the other comments about the staff being more interested in themselves, we only asked two questions and that was most definitely enough to let us know that our interruptions were note welcomed. I'm note sure who the manager or the owner of this business is, but I would definitely recommend that the staff went on a course in how to treat the customer and get repeat business, because they certainly will not be getting mine. The room was so small that I could barely get to the toilet, and I am only a small person of standard weight, anyone carrying a few pounds please go else where. I know that coming to New York means that you will hardly spend anytime in the hotel room, but you do need enough space to be able to use the bathroom, there isn't even anywhere to put your deodorants or cosmetics. I stayed in the Edison last time and I shall go back to the Edison next year, I suggest you do the same

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BobMcGS
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for our family of four (two adults and two kids) to stay (we shared one room with two double beds for two nights). All NYC hotel rooms are small and so was the Ameritania's, so no surprise. The important things are: * it was clean * we had a room in the back so that it was quiet all night from outside noise - we got used to the noisy AC quickly and were thankful for its cool air * the shower worked * we needed more towels and a brief call to the front desk sorted it * the location was excellent, close to Times Square, a Starbucks across the street as well as a well-stocked deli * some signs of aging tin the rooms but not bad enough to be off putting.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay among bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Cutthroat49
Reviews.Content: In town for the NYILFF. Needed a room for two nights. Booked thru hotel with group rate. Read reviews before check in and was wary. Check in was a breeze. Staff very pleasant. The room on the 12th floor corner with two windows was not tiny but not too small. Everything in the room was in working order, beds were very comfortable. Overall a good stay and I would book here again. For price and location this is a value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug20
Reviews.Content: Okay, reading others reviews on this site made me real nervous since it was our first time in NYC. All I have to say is that we had a pleasant and great stay at the Ameritania. We arrived on July 15th and we booked a one bed in our room. We tried our luck to be upgraded and when we checked into our room...surprised we were met by 2 beds and spacious bathroom and we were located on the inside views of the hotel. Where it was quiet at night to sleep. The rooms were clean and well kept. We LOVED it!. The only issue is with a the A/C it was a wall unit and it was kinda of loud at night. And the best treat was the free Tea/Coffee/Espresso bar in the lobby..mmm..it was the best ever. Please see for yourself and you will be pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was close to everything, broadway, times square.... Ps. Please go and see the colour purple...it is wonderful We will most likely stay at the Ameritania again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sonodalove
Reviews.Content: We had a mother Daughter long weekend in NYC and stayed at the Ameritania Hotel. The location was fantastic right around the corner from David Letterman and very close to Times Square, Rockefellar Center and many other must see attractions. The lobby is wonderful and yes the rooms are small but if you are paying to come to New York to stay in your room then why bother. The carpet was clean, the bed was comfortable and the linens were clean,the air condition worked great, if you left it on all day when you returned the room was perfect. The bathroom was clean a little small but very clean and neat they had great soaps etc.... The staff was very helpful. This was a very good experience. WE will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located.”
Reviews.Author: Elwilfo
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are out sightseeing all day. The Ritz it is not -- but then you are not paying for the Ritz. Since we were last there a few years ago it has upgraded the lobby and opened a very nice bar area where they do a killer martini. Just the thing after a long day walking about town. The staff were friendly and helpfull and the room was very clean and quiet, the ac worked fine, happily, since it was 80+ and humid. They have a luggage drop (which is handy) and they checked us in early. If you want 24hr pampering, go to the Waldorf-Astoria and pay for it. If you want a great New York crash pad, ideally located friendly and very reasonable then the Ameritania is the place. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected”
Reviews.Author: markmccauley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on the Canadian/American long weekend. The hotel lobby is very modern and quite boutique. It is a misleading precursor to the rooms. I did not have high expectations at the price we paid. We wanted an inexpensive weekend in the city and that's what we got. The reno on the hotel was on an obvious budget, but here are the facts. The beds are relatively comfortable. Crisp white linen and many pillows. The bathrooms are modern and clean. The television gets about two dozen stations. The lobby bar is cozy and relaxing. The door/bell staff are very helpful and courteous. The check-in staff are pleasant and efficient. The maids do a lovely job cleaning the rooms. The building is turn of the century, so with an old building, it has some detail issues. The location is amazing - right between the park and Times Square. The rates are incredibly reasonable. The hotel offers rooms with two double beds (somewhat rare in NYC). The rooms are snug, but come on, there's 8 million people on this island, it's gonna be snug. The smoking from other rooms permeates to the halls. The rooms have window unit air-conditioning. Subway access immediately adjacent to the hotel. Complimetray coffee in the lobby, but the Starbucks (plural) are right across the street. The jackhammering until 3:00 AM is not th fault of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Graham7720
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a corner underneath a broken neon sign that displays the Ameritania without the tania (when we were there). This is perhaps indicative of the kind of hotel the Ameratania actually is on the inside. The lobby was nearly always full of vacant looking tourists and their presence became irritating after a while. They would walk around in a daze and sit around in a dark room I later learned was the Twist bar and endear each other with their fascinating stories of NYC. I ended up feeling sorry for them. The lifts were not the quickest in the USA so if you have claustrophobia be afraid. Be very afraid. However the rooms were not as small as I expected. The decor was anything but sulubrious but the beds were surprisingly comfortable. The TV channels never seemed to be fully tuned in and there was not a very good selection. The air conditioning was OK if you put it on before you went to bedand off before falling asleep. Otherwise it keeps you awake along with the constant honking of car horns in Broadway during all hours of the morning. The sink in the bathroom was the size of a very large thimble and sometimes when I went for a shower I would end up sitting asleep on the toilet waiting for the hot water to arrive. The staff did not speak English very well but the doorman was a cool dude. As a British expat living in Florida I would have to say I was surprised by the good behavior of most of the English people staying at the hotel. After a few drinks I suppose it doesn't really matter what state your room is in anyway. The location is what makes the hotel a place I would go back to. That and the price and the fact that my wife and two kids thought the whole trip was a knockout.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for mid-budget with a great deal”
Reviews.Author: summerd
Reviews.Content: BEST location - on Broadway, dave letterman/hello deli around the corner, minutes walk from times square, central park, easy to get to 5th ave and all metros to touristy sites - i.e. empire state, stat.of lib., ground zero, museums, etc etc.... doormen were very nice and professional, nothing snooty about the staff. maid did a great job. rooms do need more lighting, a few more outlets, and the shower was bizarre - no door on half, glass enclosure on the other. one ice machine and no vending, but there's a large convenience/deli steps from the hotel. clean, modern, easy to find, validated parking in garage across street (23/day - and that is good for nyc). we got a great deal - 350 for two nights. midtown we couldn't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Sleebuyth
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania Hotel is in a prime location for everything from A - Z (e.g. subways, shopping, museums, Central Park, Broadway shows, etc.)! While the hotel is not pristine like some of the very expensive NYC hotels, it is still nice and for the price a great value for NYC (how much time do you really spend in your room in NYC?), the service is good too. It's definitely my hotel of choice for NYC from now on!

Reviews.Title: “okay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hoterl was very nice the lobby was very pretty but the rooms were so small. After reading the reviews i thought i would be okay since some people told me i would me i would be.I mean i knew we weren't going to be hanging aroung the hotel in new york city so all we needed was a place to sleep we weren't loking fora five star hotel. And it was true i was not a five star because of the rooms... they were so tiny, i couldn't fit in the tub, my mom plugged the hairdryer and the lights went out just in our room, and you know how regular hotels havae this tiny little air-conditionair at the corner, well ours were big and bulky that you couldn't hardly fit on the bed. Although all the bad things i mentioned, the hotel is in a great location. If you look right aroung the corner there is the david letterman show and right beside that is times square, and also if you have a little girl or boy there is american girl doll place which is right near the hotel and there is build a bear workshop which is near by too. Although it wasn't the best hotel in the world, it's worth staying at if you want to be near everything. sincerely, meredith

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: kflemlive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine..I wasn't sure when choosing this hotel because of the reviews but me and my husband spent our anniversary in NYC and we enjoyed it.. the location is great you can walk out the hotel and go a block or so and you're in Times Square. The hotel was clean its small but all the hotels in NYC are small. I would go again I LOVED IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: schultz
Reviews.Content: There was four of us girls that stayed at the Ameritania from May 19th - May 22, 2006 for our annual girls weekend in NYC. I selected this hotel because of the price, location and good reviews. As we were getting closer to our trip I started to get worried because of all the negative reviews. We kept hearing complaints about the size of the room, slow elevator, nosiy air conditioner and heater etc... So we were a little skeptical b/c our hotel last year was FAB!! When we finally arrived to the hotel the lobby and lounge was very modern and the free latte was a great feature. I requested a larger room with 2 double beds and was hoping for the best but expecting the worst. The room was modern, clean, comfortable and was big enough for 4 girls with big suitcases to get ready for a night on the town. It's close to everything that you could possably want. You must visit Angelo's pizza (around the corner from the hotel) and Divine Wine Bar (literally next door to the hotel. Both places have AMAZING food!! If you have booked here you will enjoy your stay! Don't listen to the other reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for city break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some poor reviews thought i would write my own. Great location within 2 mins of everything, rooms were small but with 2 double beds and enough room to move. some reception staff weren't great but others couldn't do enough for you. Would go back tomorrow. if you looking for somewhere to stay for your first ny city break then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is the only redeeming quality. We also were offered an upgrade, however, 3:00 came and went and the room wasn't ready. By 4:00, we decided to take the regular queen size room, since my husband came right from work and really wanted to shower. The 1st room they sent us to was the size of a closet, the wallpaper was peeling and the toilet didn't flush. We were sent to a "larger" non-smoking room that wreaked of smoke. We were then moved to another room that smelled like cat spray!! - You know that smell?? There is no mistaking it!! The bathroom was a joke. The toilet faced the sink with literally 2 inches in between - impossible for a person of any size to use. I started to unpack so my husband could shower. Not only was there no place to put the shampoo, there was no soap dish in the shower. (No tub) No soap dish, no shelf, no caddy - nothing. Where do I put the soap??? On the shower floor??? I don't think so!!!! AT this point we are exhasted. Our final room did have a king size bed, with the rock-hard texture of a $49 dorm room futon. The dial on the AC was broken and could not be regulated. The television did not work at all. We did tell the front desk and they said they would send some one to the room while we were out. When we came back at midnight - guess what?? The TV did not work!! I have never had an experience like this before. Have never even thought about changing my room after checking in., but this was unbearable. The carpets throughout the hotel hallways were stained and smelled old and musty and the wallpaper peeling and discolored, both a result of a water leak at some time. There is no sign of maintainance. This was not our first time in a NY hotel, but it will be the last at This hotel!! And yes, it is possible to find a decent size, well-kept room wihout going to Nebraska. My advice, stay far away from this place and take a cab to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Youth Hostel”
Reviews.Author: Juilletdix
Reviews.Content: I admit that I was swayed by the pretty pictures on their website, but it just goes to show that you cannot judge a book by its cover! I arrived around 9AM, only expecting to drop off my bags before going about my business. My first clue that this hotel was more of an upscale youth hostel was the large group of backpack-toting students milling about in the lobby. Not exactly the impression I got from the website. Fortunately, I had signed up as a member of their VIP club before arrival. This entitled me to a room "upgrade". The elevator was ridiculously slow and the room was one step up from miniscule. Yes, it had trendy looking features, but was in bad repair. The carpet was very stained as was some of the furniture. Worst of all, the room was situated on one of those interior airshafts. We happened to be in NYC during the heatwave last summer and the a/c was just a crappy window unit that couldn't begin to keep us cool. It was so loud that I couldn't bear to have it on at night. Dreadful. One of the worst features of the hotel was the housekeeping - we left the hotel by 9am each morning and our room still wasn't made up by 5PM. That's just wrong. They can have my VIP card back. I would never stay at an Amsterdam property again!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: gotcha51
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many a hotel in NYC over the past yrs. We chose the Ameritania this time as it was closer to Central Park. Overall, this is the only good thing I can say about it. Our first room was no bigger than a college dorm room (with the dorm room probably being bigger). Good news is that, at my request, they moved us to a larger room. This one actually had a closet/chest in it. The rooms are pretty dreary, the carpet is old and unkempt. There is absolutely nothing good to say about the bed (not sure what era the mattress was from). Our biggest issue with the property are the bug bites we got every night. We both had welts on our arms, legs, hands, feet and face. I'm thinking bed bugs, spider bites or who knows what. The elevators for a smaller hotel were very slow. We never did get a wash cloth in our room but at least there were towels. I dropped something under the bed and I was sorry to have to look under it to find it. Take my advise, don't look under the bed! As much as it kills me to have to spend the money it takes to stay at the more commonly recognized hotel chains in NYC, there is no doubt in my mind that they will be worth every penny spent if it means that I will not have welts on my body, have a mattress that is really a mattress, has clean carpets etc etc. If I were you, spend the extra couple of dollars for a place that makes your vacation memorable. This was more of a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels that go bump in the night”
Reviews.Author: oxpress
Reviews.Content: Getting 'bumped' by a hotel when you have paid up front IN FULL is quite simply inexcusable. A hotel should either refuse your reservation, or take the reservation (and money) and honour it. Arriving at a hotel in a place like NY to find that the hotel you actually chose has turned into one that you would certainly not have chosen is very inconvenient! Anyone booking this place might want to check that the hotel intends to actually give them a room nice lobby though...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located to times square, broadway, shopping, and rockefeller center. The David Lettermen sign was right next to our room on Broadway. Additionally, the 7th Ave subway was conveniently near the hotel to take to Canal Street (for shopping), the Empire State buidling and the we also take that sub to the financial district to see ground zero, wall street and then the ferry to staten island (which is free) to see the statue of liberty. The room that we stayed in was nice, and typical space for NY. Not overlly all that much room to walk around in. If you are looking for the basics though, this hotel is the BEST!! The beds were very comfy, the staff was very helpful and the free coffee is a plus! I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone that is planning a trip to NY and needs a place to crash!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Worry!!”
Reviews.Author: GKellyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in NY a few times, but this was my mom's first, so i was abit worried about the hotel Ameritania after reading some of the reviews....but honestly - DON'T WORRY!! As everyone else says, it is a fab location, there is a great little supermarket on the corner where you can buy everything- including some really nice fresh fruit salads! There are a few nice delis and restaurants nearby for breakfast or lunch - wouldnt bother for dinner though. It is within walking distance to everywhere! Now - the hotel.....i must say that i found the staff very friendly and pleasant, the doorman Jeff is lovely and chatty. Our room was wonderful, we had a corner room, looking over Broadway with 2 huge queen beds and a lovely clean bathroom. Yes, we were probably lucky, as i did manage to have a look in another guests room, and it was the size of a postage stamp, possibly smaller - so if you get a tiny room, i would ask to move, unless you really dont care and are only going to spend a few hours sleeping in it!! There were a few guests at the desk complaining that their rooms were too small, but the staff always seemed to try and help them out anyway.....but i had no complaints. Yes, the hot water takes AGES to heat up, but dont worry, just leave it running for a bit and it WILL come on....yes, the radiators are noisy, but if you leave them on just enough to warm the room up, just turn them off again after - simple!! It is noisy if you have a room overlooking Broadway - but WHO CARES - this is NY - get used to it!! You can go and get tea or coffee from dowstairs 24 hrs which was nice, and you can book trips/rides etc with the staff. Overall - it was clean, tidy and friendly and in a wonderful location. Yes, there were a few odd quirks and yes, you may get stuck with a small room, but this is one of the better hotels i have stayed in. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Our Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had read mixed reviews before arrival. Turned out we and our four kids had a great time over a four day stay. Euro-style modest and clean. Bathrooms just fine. Great location, nice staff. If you want a big, quiet room, try Nebraska. For Manhattan, we thought this was great. Would come back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “What water??Who isYellow Cab??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, then again, my family and I were new to NY. The hotel personel was polite and courteous. Practically sitting on top of the Ed Sullivan Theater where the David Letterman Show is taped was a plus, but the show was on pause that week. The room was spacious enough ... however, ... the bathroom was the size of a postage stamp. The whole hotel was without water for 3+ hours one evening. Each hour, I would call about the water problem and the front desk said:" We'll have the water back within the hour". So, after 3 hours, they aimed us to their sister hotel "The Moderne" right around the corner to take a shower so we could go to nearby Lincoln Center. When we left, the front desk kept pushing us to use their "special" taxis, who claimed Yellow Cab would rip us off. The front desk mysteriously didn't know the telephone number to Yellow Cab!! We had no problem with any Yellow Cab experience to or from the Ameritania. We were also charged $50 extra per night for my 14 year old twins. The Hotels didn't indicate the charge until DURING the booking of the reservations. The website should have warned the customers on the site itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A few Problems...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fabulous, unfortunatly, my husband and I had a few problems when it came to the hotel itself and the staff. On the one night that we stayed, there was a motercycle convention in the lobby and the members of the convention took over the whole hotel until about 5am. In addition, the pipe in our room began making an awelful sound at 4am, a banging sound, and then burst. The hotel staff did not respond to this matter and did not allow us to change our room!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I needed.”
Reviews.Author: Maeby
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania was perfect for my first trip to NYC and I can't believe there are so many negative reviews. Yes, the room was so small I laughed when I saw it, but who stays in their room on a trip to NCY anyways?! Also the bathroom is clean and stocked with shampoo, soap and other little amenities, which I always appreciate. The hotel is in a great location, I walked everywhere. Also it was quiet and I felt safe traveling alone. The only thing that annoyed me was the staff. They could have cared less I was there. In fact, once the doorman saw me coming, started to open the door for me, then butted in front of me, went in first and let the door shut behind him! I couldn't believe it. Overall, this hotel is good for people on a budget, you get exactly what you pay for. Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 979north
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not without its problems. But they are problems that are quickly resolved by a courteous staff. My phone didn't work. A replacement was promptly sent up. The light bulb burned out - another was supplied. The tap leaked - meh, I wrapped a towel around it. This place has seen better days but it is clean and the service is great. The one thing I loved was the fact that it was so close to everything. Times Square just up a few blocks, 5th Ave. up the street, Central Park just around the corner. A deli across the street provide quick and easy meals when I was on the go. If you don't plan on spending a whole lot of time in your hotel then this is the place to be. A good value with an even better location.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: jayne3108
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in February 2006 with my two friends for a long weekend. It was my first trip to N.Y and having read the reviews I was more than a little worried about staying here! I needn't have worried, the hotel is not five star accomodation, but it is cheap and it was clean and comfortable and the staff were really friendly and helpful. The best thing is the location of the hotel its right in the heart of Manhatten. Just around the corner is Times Square and the fantastic Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. restaurant !! Central Park is just five minutes up the road, and the Subway is close but we never used this as being Tourists we bought the Greyline Bus Tour hop on / off tickets which you can pick up in Times Square for about $100 and last three days and include entrance to Empire State Building and the ferry for the Statue of Liberty. These also stop at all the tourist locations and they have tour guides who are really helpful and give great tips and intersting points about the City. I would definately recommend staying at this hotel as your not gonna be in your room much when your in N.Y are u? so who needs a perfect view and immaculate room when you only want to get your head down after a long days sight seeing and shopping !!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine and great location”
Reviews.Author: MedicLondonUK
Reviews.Content: Just back from NY having stayed at the Ameritania. If you are in NY on holiday as we were then you don't want to spend all your time sitting in a hotel room - if you do then why go to NY anyway. If you just want a clean basic hotel to sleep and shower then the Ameritania is great value, and the location couldn't be better - 5 blocks from Central Park and 12 blocks (10 mins walk) from Times Square. The room we stayed in (1007)was fine and of a good size, although we could see from the fire floor plans that the rooms differed in size considerably. A little noisy as it faced out onto Broadway/54th Street. I suspect the rear facing rooms are probably quieter but you would lose out on a great view. Bathrooms are a little small and hot water was a little intermittent but otherwise perfectly OK. Great deli opposite on 54th Street or good diner just one block uptown. Give it a go - we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Simply Crummy”
Reviews.Author: stonebury
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel on business travel by a new travel agent. She must have gotten a kick-back as the place was a dump. I arrived after dinner with friends and checked in after 11 p.m. so I didn't have much choice but to stay. I liked the lobby but as soon as I went upstairs it was clear that 100% of the renovation dollar was used downstairs and none of it on the sleeping rooms. The floor was lumpy under the carpet, the lighting was poor, the sink scalded me but the shower was cold, there was no room service, etc. The furniture was cheap and chipped. And I paid $400 for the 1 night! Oh, and with doors to the hallway in both the sitting room and bedroom, I didn't feel entirely safe. I slept fitfully and checked out at 7 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LynnYork
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews , especially about the room sizes I was more than impressed to find we had a large corner room on the 9th floor overlooking 54th street and the back of the hotel, not the best views, but nice and quiet, the room was clean and warm and inviting after long tiring days in the City. Its location is ideal 5 minutes from Central Park and 5 minutes from Times Square, subway stations, deli's, restaurants and bars are all within easy walking distance. Would book for this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as we'd hoped but check your booking!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We feared the worst after reading lots of iffy reviews! Overall, I'd go back again so things can't have been that bad but that maybe fear of finding something worse or dirty! The main problem was we booked 2 twin rooms but on arrival we were offered 2 doubles!! Even after complaining, for ages, we still had to keep our doubles as "they were full up until tomorrow and it was only a REQUEST from us for 2 twin rooms"! Very poor service after booking 8mths ago. We did insist on a 'put up bed' but my mate slept on it and it wasn't very comfy. Thats what you get for making waves!! Also the radiators made loads of noise at all times of night and early morning! They hissed and seemed like they were about to burst. In the morning a small area on the floor around the bottom of the radiator was soaking wet but caused us no problems! This happened in both of our rooms. One morning my friend woke up thinking the hotel was on fire and the fire brigade had been as the room was filled with steam from the radiator!! Everything was covered in moisture. Exciting or what!! It's a good job the shopping was FAB as this took our minds off the rooms. I was glad it was very clean and the pictures on the web are an excellent representation, what you see is exactly what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to NYC and chose the Ameritania based on their photos and descriptions. After reading so many negative reviews we became a little nervous but we crossed our fingers and hoped for the best. We arrived on 2/22 at about 7am and to our surprise our rooms were ready and available. Unfortunately, we weren't provided with a queen sized bed as we had requested online and by telephone. When we got to our room we were quite surprised as to how SMALL (think shoe box) the room was. After the initial shock wore off we could not help but laugh at the situation! In general the room served its purpose. The staff was friendly and attentive. The location is SUPERB. We would stay here again. Don't expect much and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hsa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Ameritania Hotel, 54th Street, New York (18 Feb 06) After reading some reviews of the Ameritania I was a little worried. What I can tell you is that I was over the moon with the Ameritania. We arrived about 1.00pm and our room was not ready (check in is 3.00pm). It took less than 5 minutes to check in and our bags were stored while we hit the City. Stepping out the door your imediately on Broadway which is perfect, I stayed on Lexington Avenue last time and found it to be quiet and not much going on. Our room was small but for the time we spent in there it was not an issue. Huge comfy bed and great shower, hot water was always available. Our room was on the inside of the Hotel which was perfect, I can imagine being on the front can be noisy given the location. Perhaps asking in advance for an inside room would be a good idea. The Hotel was very quiet while we were there, reception is open 24 hours and there is tea/coffee facilities in the lounge which is very impressive with comfy sofas and a huge fire, great after a long days sight seeing. Everywhere is within walking distance to the Hotel and for sights further afield, the subway is on 53rd street. The Hotel arranged a car to take us back to the airport and stored our luggage on the last day. There is a handy 24 hour shop opposite the Hotel, great for stocking up on drinks/snacks. There is also some great diners out of the door. I would not hesitate to recommend the Ameritania to anyone and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “For and against”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For- Location.Time square 15 minutes and Central Park 15 minutes walk. Lounge-decor and music. Staff- helpful and friendly. Room- clean and comfortable. Against- Lifts-slow T V- poor quality/ reception. Coffee-poor

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: HotSkip
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews of the Ameritania Hotel, my daughter and I arrived with moderate expectations for our accomodations. We could not have been more pleasantly surprised as all aspects of our stay were delightful! Upon check-in, we were notified that we'd been upgraded to a suite, and were thrilled with the spacious and clever design of our room. The bed was comfortable, the sofa and accent pieces stylish and useful, and the shower fantastic. The location couldn't have been better for our purposes and the staff was up to greet us at every odd hour we appeared at the hotel. This is a well kept secret and we will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from a website that showed a pretty swanky looking modern hotel. I was taking my two teenage children, husband and family friends who also had two teenagers. We booked four rooms. We were shown to our rooms - we arrived hours after posted check-in time. Two of the rooms were not cleaned- unmade beds, garbage (including things quite inappropriate for the kids to see), actual 2-inch ROACHES crawling on the walls - Our bellman saw the condition of rooms and actually said nothing and left. I started to go to the desk and passed a room with teens in it - they had their door open because the room was filled with steam and condensation from the radiator. I went back to my room and immediately got on the phone and got four rooms at the Rhiga Royal down the street. Upon telling the hotel that we were leaving and why - they charged my credit card for the stay anyway and offered no apology. This was our Christmas present to our friends and needless to say I was horrifed.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it a lot! Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 7 nights, and we found found it comfortable. The bed was VERY comfy, which you need when you've been trekking all over NY in the heat (we stayed in June/July). The bathroom was a good size, and we found the storage cupboard to be extremely useful for storing suitcase, shopping etc. We did have a couple of issues though: 1)Air Con was NOT sufficent. We had to leave the fan on when we went out in the morning to ensure our room was bearable when we returned. 2)There was ONE ice machine for the whole hotel, which was 4 floors below us. This quickly got irritating. 3) The TV was not good, we would watch it for 10 mins or so and then it would turn itself off!! HOwever, we would definately stay here again. It was quiet, comfy, clean etc. We got a fantastic nights sleep each night we were there. We paid Â£500 for 7 nights which was a bargain considering the FANTASTIC location. This is the selling point of this hotel- the location. We were more than satisfied, as we didn't go on holiday to spend the week in the hotel. One last selling point, there is a starbucks right across the road, which was open first thing in the morning and last thing at night!! so good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much so you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JasAtl
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in their sister hotel, the Amsterdam Court, for a two night business stay. Amsterdam Court said my room had a leak earlier in the day, and I would have to go to the Ameritania. I've stayed at the AC and would say they are quite comparable. The rooms are extremely small, but that's what you should expect in a botique hotel in NYC. There is no central air - unit on the wall for cold and radiator for heat. I wouldn't say it is a nice place, but it was fine for my purposes. Just don't have high expectations, and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having read the reviews was expecting a small dirty room.arrived wed 11th jan 06, checked in by courteous staff. opened door of room 908 to be greeted by a clean, spacious, modern and very comfortable room. bathroom good size as well. stayed 5 relaxing nights. room cleaned every day with clean towels.location was perfect. temperature did drop to minus 12*and heating in room was more than adequate.will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not as presented on the Website, which makes the hotel look inviting, even glamorous. In reality, it was under construction, the lobby was a mess and it's much seedier than the pictures depict. Very few desk clerks who spoke English clearly or well. However, bellmen were very helpful. Rooms were awful -- tiny, and gave me a creepy-crawly kind of feeling. Thankfully, I always travel with a large can of disinfectant spray which I used liberally! Bed was lumpy and uncomfortable. Heat is provided by very old-fashioned radiators and extremely difficult to regulate. You either sweltered or froze. We had a street-side room so it was noisy and our view was a porn shop directly across the street -- swell. Not at all worth it for the money spent; the one upside was its location -- easy to walk to many points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “A good solution for family with teens”
Reviews.Author: paulandsarahthomas
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday January 14 after driving up from DC. Small problem at check in (they did not expect us to stay for two days) but this was worked out and turned into a nonproblem. We parked with a discount across the street. Cappuchino machine worked great at first, but then broke next morning and new policy on Monday (11 am to 11 pm). Great location. Clean. Friendly staff. Temperature control an issue; also small rooms but we expected that. Took a while to get up and down the elevator on Sunday morning--seemed like a full house with lots of international travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfills your basic needs, with some extras”
Reviews.Author: Philippe21
Reviews.Content: Arrived early friday morning around 10:30, and our room was ready. The lobby is appealing to the eyes, with trendy furniture and friendly staff. Parking was pretty easy. Drive accross the street to a 24h parking lot and everything else is taken care of. The lot has 24h security, and when you get a stamp on your ticket before you leave, the cost will come up to $20 a day. We planned to roam the city by foot and subway, so knowing that are car was safe was great. If your staying is at peak times and arrive at check-in time/check-out times, dont count on fast elevators. These things are really slow, and can barely fit 8 people with no luggage. If your going down, i suggest you use the stairs during those times. (but watch out when you open the doors) We had a room with 2 double beds which almost looked like a mix between a double and a twin. Dont count on being very comfertable if your 2 in the bed. The room was clean, so was the bathroom. No complaints in that department. The room was just the right size with a view of 54th and Broadway. Noisy at times, but didnt bother us at night. Ice machines are on each floor, but the only one working was on the 11th... if your tired and you need a cold drink... you might curse a few times. Cappuccino bar is a joke. Its either coffee or tea, and pretty bad coffee at that. If you really need your coffee, just walk 15 seconds to the Starbucks accross the street on Broadway. Thats another positive, its proximity to Broadway and Times square. You step out the door and you can almost see the lights from the giant ads. Its also relatively close to Subways, so you'll only have to walk a few blocks to get rolling. Didnt use much room service, but for the things we asked for we got pretty fast. Staff was helpful with directions and advice for restaurants. For breakfast, theres a greasy diner just around the corner. Perfect cure for a hangover, but dont expect excellent service. For the price we paid this was a good deal. We used this hotel to rest, sleep and store our bags. For that it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “OK place in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fififlores
Reviews.Content: A great location, three blocks from MOMA, Times Square and Central Park. Impressive entrance hall with cosy bar with open fire and sofas. Small room (but not that bad, I've seen smaller). Great view over Broadway. Nice black marble bathroom. Only complaints: very noisy plumbing, common in old buildings in Manhattan, and the plug not working in bath, frustrating at 6am when you want to soak away your jetlag!

Reviews.Title: “excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania hotel for 3 nights, this was excellent affordable accomodation in a prime locaton near central park and just off broadway. The hotel itself was very modern and the rooms were clean, comfortable with on-suite bath rooms. Rooms were on the small side, but when your in new york you dont spend much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ~ location location location”
Reviews.Author: tkring
Reviews.Content: We never stay very long in our hotel rooms so our prime objectives are location with a good price. Anything else is lagniappe. Well, we had a lot of lagniappe with this hotel. Great coffee and pastries in the morning. Wonderful deli across the street. Cheerful and helpful staff to help with your stay. Comfortable bed with a working television set. The bathroom was a little small but that was even workable. This is just a good hotel for New York. Everthing is in walking distance. If you are looking for the Ritz or the Plaza, then this one is not for you. But if you want a contempory hotel with character then this may be for you. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-good rate for NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Nov 05 and can say that the location is excellent. Just in the heart of Manhattan. Good Restaurants and DeliÂ´s nearby. Try to get a corner room (bigger) - rest of the rooms are pretty small. Cleanlyness perfect-Bathroom amenities very good, even though it is VERY small. Because of the location at Broadway kind of noisy but who comes to NY for sleeping anyway...

Reviews.Title: “May give it another try”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great for the business trip I was on. The bathroom however made me feel like I was on "Candid Camera". I am only 5' 8" and it was impossible to sit on the toilet. There was only 3 feet between the wall and the shower where they shoved the toilet and the sink was just inches in front making it impossible to put your legs anywhere. I had thought about asking a manager to come to my room to demonstrate just how I was suppose to use the toilet, but didn't have time for that gag. Too bad, becasue it would have made for a good story. In the morning there was no hot water, but they took 50% off the bill. May try this hotel again, but will check out the bathroom before I unpack and request another room if the toilet is in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel so far in NY!”
Reviews.Author: girliesaints
Reviews.Content: I've been to NY before and have experienced good and bad hotels, so I prepared to the worst. The Ameritania Hotel surpassed itself as a good value hotel in a great location, just off broadway and just before central park. Ok the rooms aren't the biggest, but by NY standard's they were fine, clean and comfortable. As it was a relatively small hotel compared to NY's standard it was pleasantly calm in the lobby and the staff had more than enough time to answer your questions and give you hints and tips. Around the hotel was a good selection of dinners, restaurants and bars. The only small critism was "the cappincino bar" was more of a coffee pot station!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: deskbound
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend in November for a week and we were quite pleased overall. The location is excellent and we were able to do most of our sightseeing on foot so saving money on taxis. The room was clean and we had a double bed per person. The staff were very friendly and courteous and the free tea and coffee, in wintertime, very welcome indeed. The one complaint we had was that our room was too dark, even with all lights on. Our room looked onto a wall and we had hardly any natural light therefore making it impossible to write postcards for example. This would not be acceptable for many people but there are so many things to do in NY, one dosn't spend much time in the room. We wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap with good location”
Reviews.Author: Tx Katie
Reviews.Content: The location is great to Broadway and so is the price. Expect old and crowded rooms. It is o.k. for two people in two double beds. Walk in the door and fall into one bed. Couldn't use the toilet and sink at the same time. Only two small draws and no table but plenty of hot water. No restaurant but a great deli across the street. The elevators are slow at rush hours. Nice neighborhood and good location, right around the corner from David Letterman. If you just want a place to sleep and hang your hat this would do but don't expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my partner and I (we're a gay couple, being New York, not an eyelid was blinked) read the bad things about this hotel on this site, we almost didn't book it. But after staying, we're glad we did. Ok, so the rooms aren't that big and it isn't five star. But its clean, friendly, and above all, the location is GREAT! Its a couple of doors up from the old studio 54 club (which is now a theater). It's location is 54th on Broadway which means its right on Broadway. Restaruants, cafes, bars, theaters and Time Square is really on a stone throw away. The hotel isn't the ritz but if you want 5 star, you pay five star. Make sure you get a room with air conditioning. Air Conditioning REALLY REALLY REALLY makes a difference in the summer in New York. We never expected it to but it's a must. Our room had cable TV and was an ensuit with a shower (cold showers are fab in NYC). GREAT, great location, clean rooms and friendly staff. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What's All The Fuss??”
Reviews.Author: nycfan
Reviews.Content: What's all the fuss about. I just returned from NYC and a stay at the Ameritania Hotel. After reading reviews I was skeptical but upon arrival found the hotel to be a nice suprise. The modern lobby decor and attached lounge with an inviting fireplace were a great place to relax and discuss our plans over a cocktail upon arrival.We were given a room with a king bed immediately upon ckeck in, and found it to be clean and decent in size as NYC hotels go. It's true there are no dressers or a place to put clothes away besides the closet but we were only staying 2 nites and didn't need to move in. If I were staying longer this may have proven to be a problem. The bathroom had marble floors and tile with a small counter around the sink and also the window sill to place toiletries. The water pressure was good and the water hot whenever we took showers. The staff was courteous and helpful. The parking garage across the street had a great rate of $20/day for hotel guests - but be careful not to go over your daily time - they charged me a full day for exceeding my time by 2 hours. My biggest complaint would be the SSSSSLOW elavators. It took as long as 10 minutes for one to arrive to our floor, the ninth, one time. We actually took the stairs on one occassion - baby stroller and all, because we figured it was quicker. All in all we were very satisfied with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsMac2000
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Sat 12th at this Hotel - we should have been staying at The Moderne and our booking had been moved to this one - we were pleasantly surprised. We had a double room and a room for 3 (two double beds) - the larger room was a great size. No complaints at all, it was a little bit cold at night but better that than being too hot. The location was brilliant - just round the corner from Times Square but pretty quiet considering where it was!! The staff were really helpful, we checked in at 2pm even though we weren't supposed to till 3pm. The concierge were wonderful - sorted us out a limo for the trip back to the airport. I'd definitely recommend this to those who don't want to pay too much but want a fab location - after all - you only sleep there!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were able to book this hotel at the last minute...and glad we did. The hotel is clean. The staff was helpful. We did an early check in and they held our bags for us. Nothing was taken, or gone thru. The doorman was wonderful and very helpful. The room was on the small side, but clean and fresh smelling. The bathroom is huge and well stocked. I would stay here again. The location is wonderful, and we had no problems sleeping. Don't hesitate to stay here !!!

Reviews.Title: “watch out for your belongings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: houskeeping picked up some of my items and the hotel promised to find them and send them back to me. So far no luck and I haven't heard a word from the hotel. stay clear

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Choice For NYC Lodging”
Reviews.Author: mopsa
Reviews.Content: I am picky--that's all there is to it. So, after reading some of the other reviews for the Ameritania, I was really concerned about the choice I'd made. Normally I check TripAdvisor BEFORE reserving. But this time I was meeting friends and someone else chose our hotel - so I was stuck. It turns out that all of my anxiety was for naught. The Ameritania is a more than adequate hotel choice. The location can't be beat - it's within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway theatres -- many major tourist attractions. But, most importantly, it is clean, quiet and comfortable. Yes, the rooms are small. But if you've ever been in a European hotel, you know what to expect. The staff was courteous and accommodating. I really can't complain. And, like I said --I am picky. The halls are dark and the rooms lack decent ventilation so it can be a bit dank, as well. But this is the big city. An affordable hotel that's clean, safe and accessible makes up for the little flaws you'll find in any establishment. Don't fear the Ameritania. It's just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Ameritania Hotel in October. We had two rooms for 3 nights. The hotel staff was rude and of very little help to us with an unusual situation we encountered. They behaved in a very unprofessional manner and made us all to feel very uncomfortable. We will never stay there again or recommend this hotel to any friends. We have never been treated in such a rude manner in all of our combined travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!!!!”
Reviews.Author: komediankat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ameritania recently for a long weekend/vacation to New York City. The location was great and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Although they were small and could use some better lighting, I was very pleased, overall, with this hotel. The employees were very helpful, kind and attentive. Some of the previous reviews made me a bit skeptical of the Ameritania but I was pleasantly surprised. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately Stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been nervously reading reviews before I went, I was very pleasantly suprised. The check in was quick and easy (even though they had no record of my booking, I had proof and was given a room immediately). Thinking I would end up in the smallest room in the world, I actually had 2 double beds - just for me! Although they have tried to make the rooms look contemporary, they are off the mark, but they were clean and the beds were comfortable. Plus the location is perfect, with easy access everywhere! It maybe a 'pot luck' hotel based on some of the reviews, but I would definately have another gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania is not a hotel that we would consider going back to. The rooms were very small, after complaining we were given another room which was slightly better but not that large. The rooms were dark, the bathrooms have no extractor fans for ventilation and in our first room the bathroom was tiny. There are no facilites in the room which could enhance your stay ie: fridge, tea & coffee making and very few plug points. The only positive comment we could make is that the location is great for Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying here after reading very mixed reviews. On the whole it was a decent place with clean rooms and a WONDERFULLY comfy bed! The location is absolutely top notch, you'd have a difficult time finding a more central and convenient place. The staff are friendly and helpful, the premises stylish and modern. On arriving we were shown to a room with twin beds, which was hardly fitting for a honeymoon. It was also a bit pokey, ie. you had to climb over one bed to get to the window because there was a wardrobe squeezed tightly between the bed and the wall. We asked to be moved and were immediately put in a room with a double bed. Our stay was enjoyable with only a few minor problems. All reports about the air conditioning units being loud are correct. It's like sleeping with a vacuum cleaner switched on next to you all night. We got used to that because the weather was so hot and we feared we'd die if we switched it off! The maid walked in on us at 4.30pm one afternoon (the door was locked but she let herself in without knocking). We were in a state of undress and it was a tad embarrassing (what did she expect of newlyweds????). I think she was more upset than us though, the poor woman. I would definitely stay here again. It's got all you need and at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 6-13th Sept. 2005 I also arrived at the Ameritania expecting the worst although had decided there was little point in worrying about it beforehand; obviously I hoped though it would be at least reasonable having spent Â£1165 (inc. return flight from Bristol, UK) on the trip. On arrival I realised my room had not been prebooked by my travel agent as the receptionist asked if I wanted smoking or non-smoking, when I replied non-smoking I smiled sweetly and asked if I could please have a 'nice' room as I was staying for 7 nights. She nodded with a little smile and gave me a double on the 10th floor. That was great as I was expecting a single. The room was no. 1004 and had a view over Broadway. The bedroom itself was spacious enough with adequate wardrobe and cupboard space and about 5 fresh towels supplied every day, with the bed made and the bedroom and bathroom cleaned and magazines and city guides provided. The bathroom was small but the shower hot and effective, the toilet was wedged between the sink unit and shower however so having long legs I usually banged my knees on the sink unit when I used it, it didn't bother me at all though as I was so pleased with everything else. There was a view over Broadway and highrise buildings. The room must have been high enough not to suffer the effect of street noise as I am not a heavy sleeper at all but ended up sleeping really well. I did however have the air con on which blocked out any intermittent noises with its constant whirring. I can't really say that the air con cooled the room down as much as I would have liked therefore I was glad I wasn't staying there in the heat of the summer, having said that though the outside temperatures reached the upper 80s and 90s during my stay. I could see from the room plans that some rooms would have been larger yet others (next to the lifts) very small. There was a TV with lots of chanels and a clock/radio which I enjoyed listening to in the mornings as I got ready. I was never disturbed by any noise at all within the hotel and met some friendly guests in the lift. The lobby was nice and cool to sit and have a drink and a read of a complimentary daily newspaper and the doormen were friendly. There was a cocktail bar with some nice seating (although it was all very dimly lit even by day) called Twist and I had a couple of Cosmopolitans one night - all very friendly and relaxed, the barman was nice. Any time of day you can help yourself to coffee or a selection of teas from a hot water/filter coffee making machine. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, better price”
Reviews.Author: jjandhb
Reviews.Content: For the price, this accomodation was great value. Fabulous location in the theater district, close to Times Square, Central Park and Fifth Avenue. We had a double at $229, which was adequate for our family of four. Doormen were very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city... shame about the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania for 10 nights in August. We arrived ready to complain about the room size (after reading other reviews!). We were moved to a slightly bigger room but the TV did not work. The position of the hotel was excellent - so close to Times Square. The photos of the hotel looked amazing; however we were very dissapointed by the facilities - just the little things that make a trip easier - no fridge etc... The room was very dark, we were kind of disoriented as you could not tell if it was morning, noon or night. No view, except of the windows of all the other rooms. The staff however were friendly and helpful. Doubtful that we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be an informed consumer and you'll have a good experience”
Reviews.Author: cappie
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was a bit wary of staying here but figured it was just one night and we could work it out and the price was good, location great. The place was not redone with the best of quality and so the carpet and the furniture shows wear - but the beds were comfy. My one word of advice would be not to book this hotel through a discount site - many of the hotels offer their own discounts (I found a better price through the hotel's site than any other) and then I feel like you have more power when you check in if you are displeased. I booked a double double room and we got upgraded. We recieved good service from the front desk and prompt response with housekeeping. The bellman was stiff but relaxed eventually. I would stay here again for a good price because the location is great. Ps don't miss the Matisse exhibit at the Met - it was great and the view from the roof of the museum is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Everyhting you need right on your door step!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to go to New York since I was a child and I finally got my wish in December last year! My parents and I stayed at this hotel and we loved it that much we're going back next (March 2006) and statying in the Ameritania again! We found the hotel was exactly what we expected, it was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpfull. We were located in Time Square and were minutes away from everything such as, Central Park, MTV Stduios and the David Letterman studios. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit N.Y.C. Plus the added bonus there's a STARBUCK'S just cross the road!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bazzaOakham
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ameritania from 1st to 11th August 05 having read many bad reviews we were a bit sceptical about our stay.As it turned out, the room was a 2 double bedded room for 3 of us,everything was clean,reception were helpful and friendly.There was free coffee and tea 24/7,an ice bucket and a free supply of ice to keep water etc.a free safe in the room,the a/c was efficient.Being situated on broadway and 54th st there was traffic noise but not enough to worry us and it meant we were near central park and near Times Square which was great I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: lmwultimt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights Aug 4-8 for a wedding in Central Park, arranged for by the bride. After reading reviews, I was somewhat skeptical. Rooms were larger than expected. Mine (1118)had two beds, large walk-in closet and modern bath. My friend's had two beds also, but smaller closet and larger room (608). Lighting is very dim and hard to see in the evening and for applying makeup! Our AC worked fine, but had some complaints from other guests, who were moved to rooms where cooling worked. Elevators can be slow, but only experienced this during peak morning check-out times. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is wonderful. We had wedding price of 159-179, was a great value. Tried to book for following Sat, after wedding, and were told price would be 325. For 325 I will go elsewhere. Overall, though, better than expected. Would return for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Tourist Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. I had read some pretty awful stories! After a long flight from Manchester UK, we arrived at 9.30pm by transfer bus. We were greeted by excellent staff, very efficient. I was given a King size room with huge bed and lovely big bathroom. Room was clean and tidy, Air con a little noisy but you soon get used to it. My mum had asked for a bottle of Champagne and choccies for us to be left as a welcome and it was duly there waiting for us when we entered the room. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The hotel is very well situated on the corner of W54th and Broadway, about 5 mins walk from Times Square. Every place of interest is within easy reach. Excellent restaurants all round us and plenty of places for breakfast. (Note they don't do complimentary bagels at hotel anymore although there is tea and coffee downstairs in lobby) I have worked in the travel business for a few years and whilst I wouldn't put a large group of conference delegates here, I would more than happily rate this as an excellent tourist class hotel with all you need and I would certainly stay again. Whilst in New York, check out some of the smaller restaurants, there's a nice Greek - Molyvos- on 7th Ave and the Jeckyll and Hide Club on 6th is fun for all the family. For the romance, The World Yacht is simply the best. The concierge at the hotel would be able to arrange this for you. The local transport is good...$2 on the bus for any distance..they only accept coins though, and whilst the bus tours are good, the public transport gets you around and who wants to get on a bus when you can walk and take in the atmosphere? HAVE A GREAT TIME......WE DID!

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room”
Reviews.Author: Travellhopper
Reviews.Content: You have been warned about the size of the rooms!!! The bed fits in and thats all. The air conditioner hardly cools the room and keeps you awake most of the night. It has been modernised to a degree of hiding all the underlying issues. No food in the morning. Doormen were helpfull and location is great on Broadway and Central Park. But Im afraid the rooms put me off. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The word "small" doesn't quite describe how small the room was. Imagine a telephone booth with a full size bed and an airplane-sized bathroom. On the evacuation floorplan stuck to the back of the door, it was difficult for us to even find our room, because the star that marked the spot was almost bigger than the room itself. It was challenging for two people to co-exist in a room of this size. We asked to change rooms but the hotel was sold-out, so we dealt with it for one night. The size was not the only issue.
