The rooms were trendy and clean, but the basic essentials were lacking. The futon-like bed was on a slope so all our blood rushed to our heads. The $30 air conditioner they put in the window blew semi-cool air, but couldn't even cool off this tiny room. The television didn't work (all fuzz for 2 days). The cd player didn't work. The pull chain on one of two bedside lamps had been yanked out, so there was only one light for the whole room. We made numerous reasonable requests to the front desk staff, and though they smiled a lot, our requests seemed to fall on deaf ears. The window had velveteen drapes, but the blinds were missing. When we asked to have blinds put back in (which took 3 calls to the front desk to get anyone to even look at it), we were told that they didn't have any more, so a maintainence man stuffed half of the drapes out the window to block out the light while allowing the AC to do its thing. I give high marks to our maintenance man, who was the only staff member who acted with a sense of urgency. The location was great, but we'll try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clever Refurb of an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: baulkogal
Reviews.Content: OK, here's the deal. I was a little worried about booking this hotel after some of the reviews that I read here, however, it appeared to fit all my criteria and I didn't have much left to pick from. The Ameritania gives a good first impression, helpful doormen, funky decor, nice looking bar and good aircon. It's when you get upstairs that the cracks become more visible, first of which, no aircon as soon as you get out of the elevator..... Our first room, which was a standard queen was certainly miniscule; there wasn't enough room for my friend and I to open our cases at the same time let alone bring home any shopping! The first night was terrible as we couldn't have the airconditioner on as it was rattling and too loud. Upon asking for a twin room the following morning, we were told they only have twin queens which cost and extra $200 per night, however, when I told them about the aircon problem, they upgraded us with no charge for the remaining 6 nights. With a queen bed each to stretch out in, we were much happier and had no further complaints the entire time. As another reviewer said, it's not the Ritz, but you're not paying Ritz prices. The refurbishment of this hotel has been very cleverly done and it is decked out in a great modern style (no swirly carpets and floral bedspreads). Apart from not having a ventilation fan in the bathroom, you get what you pay for and I think this hotel was clean, friendly and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The internet reviews made me think what will i find when opening the door and let me tell you it is not that bad. For the rate we paid the room was great. The bed was better than mine at home. The location was perfect. The frontdesk was helpful and so was the door man. We had no problems. i will stay there again. And good luck to all of you that will go there. Maby i was just lucky.

Reviews.Title: “Fine.”
Reviews.Author: MrLittlewood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania very recently (June 2005) and enjoyed it. Our only gripe was that the booking agent must not have liased with the Ameritania and we had to negotiate our room with reception. Upon arrival we were offered a twin room as this "had more space". We politely declined and requested a room with a large double bed, which we were fortunate enough to receive. This could easily have spoilt our holiday in NY so be warned. The room was modern, clean and all appliances worked fine. Absolutely no view out of the room window but we weren't bothered. Overall the staff were very polite and welcoming, especially the door staff. The location is superb. Turn a few steps right out of the front door and you are on Broadway. A few minutes walk down Broadway and you are in the thick of it in Times Square. There is an excellent chinese supermarket directly opposite the hotel which offers a cheap buffet and important supplies such as drinks and nibbles. I think the hotel complimentary coffee was next to the bar however no sign of the bagels! The hotel is in the same block as Letterman and if you are lucky like we were you may also get tickets. We would definitely stay at the Ameritania again.

Reviews.Title: “Crap!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Still having nightmares about this hotel!!!! WouldnÂ´t stay here again if they payed me to stay. The noice from Broadway is terrible, our aircondition had ducktape around it........ could have slept outside, no difference. DonÂ´t be a cheap ------, pay the extra dollars and get a decent hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel/trip for my birthday and like many others I was a little worried about what we'd find. Okay it's not the Ritz but you're not paying Ritz prices. What you do get is a small but clean room, fresh towels every day, and friendly, helpful staff. If you're just looking for a place to sleep and shower then you can't go wrong with this hotel. It's in an excellent location, giving you easy access to NY tourist sites. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest Hotel room ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: linzi31
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Ameritania from 2/6/05 to 6/6/05. I will start on a positive by saying that location wise, the hotel is great. 5 minutes walk from Times Square and 10 minutes walk from Central Park and the designer shops on 5th Ave. Now the negatives. On arrival we were given room 1220 and were expecting it to be on the small side after reading the reviews. The room was tiny!! Imagine a small double bed with just enough room to squeeze past and a tiny bathroom and that was it! We went down to reception to complain and were told that the hotel was full but we could stay at the Moderne Hotel just around the corner which had a bigger room available. We went there and to our relief the room was much better. Although we only used the room literally to sleep in and get changed in, it does still have to be comfortable so my advice if you find yourself in the same situation when you arrive is to demand to be moved and do not accept a rabbit hutch as a room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania is a great little hotel and close to everything you need in the Big Apple. The room we had was on the small side, but pretty standard size for New York. I wouldn't recommend the bathroom to those carrying a little extra weight, but the room was stylishly decorated in soft leathers and dark woods and the bed was comfy. The toiletries were quite comparable to those you expect in 4 and 5 star properties - and the bath towels were plush! We found the staff friendly and helpful (especially the cute doormen!) Overall - a great find that I would recommend to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Love New York, Not sure about the Ameritania”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second visit to New York in six months - love the city big time but not sure about the Ameritania Hotel. Rooms were tiny and very dark - so dark that even in daylight there was not enough natural light for me to put my make up on and bed very small. Also no bathrobes or safe in our room. Had to get our sons bedroom changed as it reeked of cigarette smoke. Staff (except the door staff) were a bit stand offish and not particularly helpful. Have been advised if you book with them direct rather than a package they give you a better room. We booked a van (as there were five of us) to take us back to Newark Airport on our last day, giving them 24 hours notice but they got the booking wrong and only a four seater turned up. No time to wait so we crammed into it - must have been illegal and very uncomfortable. So beware. Hotel bar made some brilliant cocktails and had some nice wines available but they are not cheap! Loads of brilliant restaurants locally and some wonderful seafood. For a quick breakfast the local Europa made the best choice, good food, reasonable prices and friendly staff. Going back in September but not to the Ameritania!

Reviews.Title: “Loathed this place.... What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: vcar1012
Reviews.Content: The photo's are decieving. Yes, The lobby looks OK, but as for the rest of the hotel, the service, and the attitudes of the staff - forget it! After paying for upgrades to try and get a room that was somewhat habitable we ended up with a king size room comprising of 2 single beds pushed together and sagging in the middle, the bathroom was a disgrace, torn carpet and the door looked like there had been attempted break in's about 5 times. Although the Hotel is right on Time Square, there is alot of street noise even on the 11th floor. The check in staff have the "Whateva!" attitude so theres no use trying to make your stay more comfortable by saying anything to them. We would never stay in the Ameritania again - even if they gave us the room for free.

Reviews.Title: “well worth it!”
Reviews.Content: ok so you dont get food there and yeah the rooms aint massive....but for the price, why complain? it was clean and the staff are friendly, espiecally the door staff. ! i loved it in new york, got back yesterday. on arrival at jfk, we sorted a ticket for a round trip bus to and from the hotel for only $27, its worth doing if you dont wanna pay loads but the only thing is it takes you to the bus station not the hotel, but you can get a cab from there and its not far. with the round trip a mini bus will collect you from your hotel, you need to phone 24hrs before. the hotels location is great, not to far from times square or central park. theres a nice cafe round the courner called applejacks. my mother-in-law loves coffee and reackons thats the best place to go. if you want to go to the statue of liberty you have to catch the m6 bus, its only $2 but make sure you have it in change. i havent got a bad thing to say about my trip to new york, i would definatly go back and stay in the ameritania. hope if u go you love it as much as me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthandWaldo
Reviews.Content: The location is the real bonus for this hotel. Just out of the tourist rush of Times Square and walking distance from Central Park, it is also next door to a great Mexican serving great tequila's. Room were New York size but with decent sized bathrooms. All in all, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_UKZoec
Reviews.Content: First time in New York and couldnt have picked a better hotel in terms of location close to everything you want to see. The staff were friendly the room was small and seemed quite dingy because of the decor, however was very clean. We had clean towels everyday and the bed linen was clean. The view was non existent (looking at a brick wall) but it didnt bother us we spent hardly any time in the room- only to shower and sleep and we didnt do much sleeping as there was so much to do. I highly recommend this hotel based on its location. You cant go to wrong with it. I am going again later in the year and will try and stay at the Ameritania

Reviews.Title: “was okay”
Reviews.Author: brainless69
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to new york and i thought that the hotel was okay nothing special, however i did stay in a hostel for the first few nights i was there and didnt move to the ameritania till a few days after..the room was really small and the staff not so helpful(apart from the doormen) Pros:close to everything,just off broadway near subway station central park etc...cons:rooms too small. reception staff were quite rude. Also for the price i paid which included "new yorkers' breakfast was not worth it as this was just coffee/tea. and i paid a lot less in the hostel and got bagels and juice for breakfast also a bigger bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great for your first trip to NY”
Reviews.Author: chophop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ameritania from 6-9 April 2005. Took my fiance for her 30th Birthday. The rooms are fairly basic (shabby chic describes them well), but our room was nice and clean and had everything we needed. Would recommend calling them before you go and requesting a smoking/non-smoking room and also a street facing room quite high up. We had a pneumatic drill going at 2:30am the first night, but hey its New York! It could happen anywhere, so ask for a room high up (there are 12 floors in all). No tea/coffee facilities are available in the rooms, but a free coffee/espresso machine is always on hand in the lobby/bar area downstairs which is a nice place to sit and relax before or after venturing outside into the big city! The hotel bar is nice and trendy and relaxed and the staff were always helpful, especially with local knowledge and booking attractions etc. We really enjoyed our stay. Its a great location, not far from Central Park so we had a couple of early morning walks in the sunshine, and Times Square is just down the road in the opposite direction. There are plenty of places to eat for breakfast within a few minutes walk. A great 24 hour deli/supermarket across the road for drinks and snacks. A nice bar/restaurant with yellow signage (can't remember the name) is also across the road, but in New York you will never go hungry! If its your first time in New York, the Ameritania is a absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what all the fuss is about!”
Reviews.Author: donkey_nuts
Reviews.Content: Like many others i was a little nervous about my stay at the Ameritania. On arrival we found the check in fast and hassle free as was finding our room. We had a twin room which was more than big enough and a decent en-suite with a nice powerful shower. My only grumble is that we were put in a smokers room which really did smell stale, but it wasn;t completely unbearable. The air con was loudish but again didn't impact on our stay. If all you're after is a room to lay your head, you can do alot worse for the Ameritania. It's a short walk to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue. Best of all if you get lost, just ask for directions to the CBS Studio for the Dave Letterman show, as it located just around the corner on the same block!! We found the staff friendly and very helpful. I would stay there again no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel room but excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Geaynor
Reviews.Content: The Ameritania's standard room is a basic room with all the usual amenities but the location more than makes up for this. 54th Street is directly off Broadway and if you do not mind walking is not far from most of the tourist attractions e.g. central park, 5th ave, chrysler building and the empire state. If you are only there for a relatively short time and there is so much to see in the city you don't really spend too much time in your room and they are more than adequate. Although we did have a couple of hitches whilst there. When we arrived there was no heat in the room and being March it was quite chilly. This was soon attended to but the radiator was the noisiest in the world. After a couple of nights we got used to this. The other problem was with the loo which nearly flooded the bathroom a couple of times but we were able to mend ourselves. The Twist Lounge is a nice bar located off the reception and the cocktails are lethal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel near theatre district”
Reviews.Author: Bedwas
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11-15 March 05. Great Location, check-in went well, doormen very pleasant and helpful. Room (3rd floor) was clean with stylish touches and, a comfortable King Size bed. Shower worked fine although the bathroom area was a little cramped. Only real negative - the radiator in the room although warm was quite noisy on occassions. Subway stations close by, good Wine Bar next door, subway outlet and deli accross the road. If you want to stay near Times Sq and are on a budget then I wouldn't have any concerns. Oh bye the way... the free coffee was excellent (when the machine is in service) - didn't see any bagels!!

Reviews.Title: “nothing to worry about”
Reviews.Author: andyjspiers
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to NYC before so spent a couple of hours on the net looking for a great location. I didn't find any other hotel anywhere close in price in this fantastic location. We booked with a well known holiday site for a tiny Â£30 per night each!!!! Unfortunately i then read some shocking reviews on tripadvisor. Stories about rats, tiny dirty rooms, and no heating in January!! Utter nonsense! The hotel was pretty clean. of course the rooms are small, it's New York! Do you know that the street hotdog sellers pay New York City $300,000 per year, just to use a couple square-feet of sidewalk?! So the room was around 12 feet square, no problems. The staff were courteous enough, but i really didn't need to ask them for anything. i just requested some extra pillows, which arrived in 10 minutes, fresh and clean. There was no problem with noise, our room was on the 3rd floor right on the corner of 53rd and Broadway. As for heating, it was cosy beyond belief. All in all i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. If you can afford the Four Seasons for $5000 a night, then stay there. But if you want inexpensive, unfussy comfort in a perfect spot in a wonderful city, try the Ameritania.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Mark-LosAngeles-CA
Reviews.Content: I had booked into and paid in full for the Bentley requesting a King bed room on a high floor, bridge view. When we arrived they had over-booked and offered the Ameritania - which is part of the same group (it also includes the Marcel). We paid approx $180/night and very simply in NYC you get what you pay for. A smart looking lobby, nice bar and designer bedrooms but look beyond that and you'll find a Victorian heating and ventilation system and a lack of basic services. In the Ameritania (and I suspect the others in the group are similar given the comments that I've read) heating is by a very noisy old water radiator system that clangs, gurgles and clatters all night. And the radiators seem to have two settings ; too hot or too cold. Ventilation is an open window or a through-the-wall aircon unit that I'll bet is as noisy as hell in summer. It took a room change from the dingy twin-bedded box they first offered us to end up in a Queen room on the 5th with a view of Broadway. Not bad but not what we'd hoped for. I suspect the lesson is that in NYC there are no bargains. I hunted for one for a long time thinking the Bentley might be it - but it wasn't. If you really want luxury and style and a full set of services (the Ameritania has no food facilities or room service or gym/pool/spa) then you must pay for it. Pony up the $350-$450 a night that it's really going to cost and stay in a chain hotel or one of those fancy places that sit on 59th Street looking north across Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania in February 2005. When we checked into our room we were shocked. The room was so small we had to plan who would move first. The bathroom so tiny that it was difficult to use the toilet. The most disturbing part was the musky smell that permeated the room and the corridors. The carpeting was damp and the accent pillow they had on the bed, stained and filthy. When we asked the front desk to be moved to a different room they just kept on telling us about the extra charge and never tried to explain why the carpeting was wet and the room so smelly. Location is great, also they offer parking in a parking garage nearby at $20 per day. We go to Ny City often and stay in hotel in the same price range as the Ameritania that are a far better deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not so modern, but great location”
Reviews.Author: tadao11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really 2.5 stars. Some booking sites call it a 3-star, but it's a little more run down than the pictures look. The rooms are small and the bathrooms even smaller. Service was adequate - we got the things we needed but the staff was small and a bit sluggish. The beds and linens were clean and the bar is very cozy. The best thing about the hotel was really the location. Everything was so close. It's right next to the David Letterman Show and there's a great deli across the street. Central park is only a few blocks away. I would stay there again, but not for more than $125 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mother
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter for two nights after being in Las Vegas for 5, should have done it the other way round as people not as friendly in the hotels here, saying that though if I returned I WOULD GO BACK to this hotel, I was concerned when I read some of the reviews, however this hotel is in a great location just a short walk away from Central park & Time Square. The rooms may not be quite as big as the one's you find in other parts of the USA but ours was clean and as big as you'd get here in the U.K, it still had two Queen beds in, and you get free coffee 24 hours downstairs. The city tour bus was just a short walk away and was good value. Although I don't expect I will return to NY I would recommend this hotel to my friends. BE AWARE - when arriving at the airport ONLY get in a yellow cab or an organised shuttle from your hotel or tour operator - there are a lot of people hanging around asking if you need a taxi - these people are NOT insured to carry you - will charge you what they wish and may or may not drop you off where you have asked to go - Please pass this on - I was not told and nearly ended up going with one of these guys.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!”
Reviews.Author: ecrisci
Reviews.Content: great spot for theater, shopping, etc. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable - our bathroom however was a good size. No problems with outside noise. Enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Whole hotel was dark and dingy”
Reviews.Author: deepthought
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 8th Jan 2005 for 4 nights. Thought I would treat my husband for his birthday. What a shock we got when we arrived. We had to change rooms 3 times as heating wasn't working or really noisy. The breakfast room was a freezing cold room that looked liked it hadn't been used for years. It smelt really damp and musky. The location was good and the staff were friendly and helpful. Wouldn't stay there again though. I only wish I had checked with tripadvisor before I went.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: leaderman
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 70 college students to the Ameritania for two nights (29-30 January '05) and have nothing but good things to say about our stay. If value is important to you, you simply can't do better than the Ameritania. Sure, rooms might be small, but they are well kept and comfortable. No, there is not a restaurant, but you can find anything you want directly across the street or around the corner. The students loved being here - access to the city was at their doorstep, and they felt 100% safe and secure. It seems to me that if you have the need to say you are staying at the Plaza, then stay there. Otherwise, you need a place to sleep and shower, and you can sure do that easily (and well) at the Ameritania. Put your money into FOOD, FUN and LIFE and not into a wildly overpriced hotel in the Times Square area.....the Ameritania will do you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel... the location couldn't have been more central, room cleaned and bedding changed daily, friendly staff and the Bagels and coffee set you up for the day. We stayed for 5 days from thanksgiving and maybe we were lucky but the room size was large (3 of us, they have end of corridor rooms which are larger than the rest, why not ask?) I can't understand the bad reviews! I and my family really enjoyed the stay,,,,, What are people in NY for?

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: janpbunty
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my daughter and 2 friends for 5 nights. My daughter and I had 3 different rooms during our stay. We had booked 3 months prior to stay and the room we were given was very small and the bed slightly larger than a single for us to share. We refused this room and were given another slightly better. We stayed here for 2 nights, but guests in adjoining rooms were so loud and inconsiderate we were kept awake until 5.30 a.m. Hotel staff seemed unconcerned but moved us to yet another room. It was freezing, no hot water (hotel said it was necessary to run taps for half hour prior to using). Very noisy plumbing - loud enough to wake us up throughout the night. No in- room coffee facilities as described, no room safe, faulty bedside lights, no complimentary bagels, complacent and fairly rude reception staff, booked alarm call didn't materialise, and final straw on checking out we were presented with a 30dollar bill for something we hadn't had! Our friends room also had no hot water and loud plumbing and faulty lights. We certainly would not go here again. Only good thing - excellent location and right opposite a superb breakfast etc. restaurant, which is just as well, as the hotel didn't appear to have the advertised restaurant. Very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: GTI-R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ameritania from 28 December to 2 January 2005. Having read some of the terrible reviews on this hotel we had prepared ourselves for the worst. When we arrived at the hotel the reception was better than we had expected. I have to be honest and say I was a little put off by the frosty reception that greeted us (but not all staff were like this!) We went to our rooms and were more than a little disappointed - our room was the size of a matchbox and our mums had to share a bed (although their room was bigger than ours). I marched straight back down and the same receptionist told us that we'd have to stay there for the night but that they would change our rooms in the morning (apparently we'd only requested a double and a twin room 9 months earlier so weren't guaranteed that we would get what we had asked for!!) At this stage I have to admit I was upset. The next day I woke up and didn't really expect anything to change it seemed that everything I had read on this site was true!!! We spent a fantastic day out and when we returned I was thrilled to discover that we had new rooms...hurrah! The rooms were great, clean, warm (maybe too hot) and a reasonable size. We thought the breakfast was great, unlimited coffee, orange juice and bagels for FREE - what more could you ask for. The rest of the holiday was superb - the rooms were cleaned everyday and clean bedsheets & towels were provided (although some days we didn't have enough towels - it wasn't a problem I just helped myself to more from the cleaner's trolley!). All in all the hotel was exactly what it should have been and what an excellent location, couldn't have been better! Don't forget if you get there and you're not happy TELL THEM and they will sort you out. BTW Don't get room 420 try 406 (double) or 419 (twin). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice, although the room was extremely small; The staff is rude and snobby; don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I do not know why some people are dissatisfied with this hotel. My boyfriend and i stayed here from dec 18 until dec 25 and we thought it was a great hotel!!! First of all the staff was very nice! In the morning there was a small breakfast. I think it was great! You could choose from different bagels and I hav seen at least 2 toasters!!! The rooms where big enough, and why need big rooms, you are there to see the city and i think only on your room to sleep. The bed was comfortable and they changed the sheets several times. The bathroom was big enough. And one of the most important things it was very clean!!!! The only thing what was a little bit weird was that it was so hot in the hotel, we even slept with te windows open (and it was freezing outside) and it was still to hot to sleep with a blanket. The location was great. I really can't say anything bad about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Billowingflag
Reviews.Content: My wife & I have just returned from a trip to New York (4th to 8th Jan 2005). We were booked into the Ameritania and, after reading the negative reviews we went there with a fairly open mind as to what we could expect. On arrival we got checked in very quickly and were shown to our room (room 315). The room was not huge but perfectly adequate for the two of us, there was a king size bed, the bathroom was clean and there was also a large cupboard to store our luggage as well as an iron & ironing board. Granted, the decor of the room was a bit scruffy but what do you need for a short city break? I am always of the opinion that as long as the place is clean & you can get a decent night's sleep & a hot shower then it fits the bill perfectly. The location is good, the hotel is on W 54th Street & Broadway, about a 5 minute walk from Times Square, 10 mins to Central Park/5th Avenue etc. There are several diners close by which offer good value typical American breakfasts and for restaurants you can do a lot worse than explore the Hells Kitchen neighbourhood which is only a few blocks away. All in all, the Ameritania offers excellent value for money and I would certainly use the hotel again. It's nothing special, but for a sightseeing city break it's very good. If you're looking for a bit of luxury, don't bother booking in here, try the Hilton or the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was the location! Oh yes also the little bar of soap.”
Reviews.Author: ybor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Dec. 27th to 30th. Location is great. When we arrived the hotel lobby was freezing and so it was for two days. Checking in was quick, so quick that the person at registration was speaking so fast, it was difficult to absorb what she was saying. Helped to our room with our luggage. My husband and I had brought our 2 daughters to New York for a short holiday. Although the hotel had been advised that we would be 4 people, they had towels for 2 and no serviettes. Yes the beds are small, hard as rock and on an angle, needed to be careful not to roll out of bed. The bathroom, we were very lucky that we're not overweight people, because a big person would not make it through the entrance door. The toilet is about 3 inches from the sink that would not drain. The 2 small lights in the bathroom was not enough to see yourself in the mirror - the whole bedroom was dark - not able to see the dirt, I guess. The redecorated hotel needs new furniture, as most sofas and chairs are ripped. The included "breakfast" is coffee, orange juice and a cold bagel... would not be difficult for the hotel to purchase a toaster for the clients to toast the bagels.... I could go on but my husband wants to use the computer! Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you need a bed and a shower”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ameritania for the first time. The room is very small, but not as small as the shower. If I had been staying with another person, we would have needed to negotiate where we would be in the room so as to not bump into each other ("Okay, I'm going to walk to the other side of the bed. You might need to step into the bathroom for a minute."). The shower was about 3 feet by 3 feet and there was no hot water while the room next door was using the shower. The room was adequate for a single traveler - I would not want to be in that room with another person. The location is nice if you want to be close to Times Square. For the $160 I paid (octopustravel), I can't complain about the accomodations in such a high cost area of town. If you simply need a bed and a shower in Times Square, than the Ameritania will due fine.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York.The Ameritania was a perfect location,easily within walking distance of theaters,shopping,and Central Park. The rooms and baths are VERY small,but clean and adequate if you are only in the room to sleep. The staff is very courteous. Our bathtub would not work. It could not be fixed during our stay,so they moved us to a nice suite. We will go there again. The Ameritania is where many people from our area stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from 4 nites in the Ameritania. Like some other reviewers I was a bit worried having read previous reviews. We had a great time in NYC and the Ameritania contributed a lot to the experience. This is a really good 3 star hotel and I would certainly stay there again. We were happy with our rooms. Free coffee all day in the lobby is a nice touch. The Twist bar is a great place to meet after a days sightseeing or later at night - Sarah does a superb job behind the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read reviews bar this one”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and works for Thomas Cook in the UK, but I am also a realist. We paid a fair price for our 5 days in the Ameritania and got exactally what we thought we would. A nice little hotel in a good location. Its not 5 star but it doesn't claim to be. It claims to be a 3 star and thats exactally what it is. I read horror reviews about the hotel before i left and was really not looking forward to staying there, but it was fine. The staff were great, Marina at the desk phoned us when our phone bill was getting out of control and Jeff and the doormen boys were a great help in getting our bags back after they were delayed. The room heat was fine so was everything you would expect from a 3 star hotel. As i say was horrified to read some reviews and ok there was a small odour in the corridors sometimes, but so what how long do you spend in a corridor? A minute and thats if your a slow walker! The only small critism of the hotel was how close the toilet was to the bath!!! But we coped somehow!!!!!!!!!! Book this hotel with confidence and ignore the negative reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good price. We had excellent service from the housekeepers. We didn't have a closet in our room so it was hard to store our clothes. There were no fans in the bathrooms. We had a great time there though. It is in a great location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little sceptical about using this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but were pleasantly suprised with our stay. The rooms are acceptable, the bed linen & towels were changed daily, the staff were pleasant and polite and the hotel perfectly located for exploring New York. The rooms are not the lightest & airest I have stayed in, but Manhatten is a city full of skyscrapers and most of the surrounding buildings are tall. You have to accept that the closer you are to street level the less natural light you will have - if this is a problem ask for a room on a higher floor. I only found two problems with the hotel during my stay - the lifts during busier periods can take a while (there are only two), and the water wasn't the hottest I've showered in. Transfer via taxi from JFK to the hotel is a fixed price of $45 and the bell desk arranged our transfer back to the airport for $19 per person. The bell desk will also keep your luggage in a locked room if you have time to kill between checking out and leaving the city. The hotel itself is in a prime location and within easy walking of the Empire State building, Central Park, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Crysler Building, Broadway, Macy's and 5th Avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was worried about staying here due to the negative comments, but I found no problem with this Hotel at all. It seems to me that everyone has had different experiences as a result of which type of room they were allocated. The first room I was given was at the back of the building and although quite small and dark, it was very clean. I asked to be moved to a room with a safety box as this room did not have one (not all rooms do), and was allocated another room straight away. This room was slightly bigger and overlooked Broadway but found no problem with noise. Again it was very clean with the sheets and towels change everyday, and the bathroom was in full working order with a good shower. It included TV, hairdryer and iron. Although the decor was somewhat dark, I cannot fault this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and it is in an excellent location. After staying in the Quality Inn Broadway last year, which was far from satisfactory, I would definitely book this Hotel again. It seems me that after visiting other hotels throughout America, you have to lower your expectations of the hotels in New York. Additional information - Applejack Diner on 230W. 55thSt is good for breakfast and there is a cracking Irish pub/restaurant McGee's on 240W 55th St.

Reviews.Title: “Not likely to stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures do the Ameritania a lot of good. The reality is that it's location is the best thing it has going for it. The lobby was updated and has a modern and clean feel. The rest of the hotel is rather dark, musty, and old. Since I had the opportunity to be moved from one a room that was laden with the smell of old smoke to another that was "smoke free", I found the rooms to be small, ill equipped and prepared. I had little confidence the linen was changed in my first room. There was no toilet paper or tissue anywhere to be found. The AC's did not work in either room. The TVs' reception failed, the data ports on the phones did not work, nor did the alarm. This hotel is fine for a tourist who only plans to sleep and shower in it. It is not at all suitable for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thank you very much for the help we received in acquiring a room for the night of Oct 23, 2004. My friend and I were left without a place to stay due to an unfortunate accident. The front desk (Mariana?) was of the best help. The location was perfect (above the Ed Sullivan Theatre!!!). Thank you again, for the greatest help. Even in a big city such as NYC, its good to know that people still are willing to help.-----josh

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms ending 20”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in NY. Our first room at the Ameritania was a disaster - same 7x9 room other reviews talk about, plus a damp smell and a bed so small my feet were hanging over the end. Friday morning we were woken by the clock radio on full volume at 6am - I would have expected the hotel staff to check the settings to make sure this sort of thing didn't happen. Not being best pleased I went down to reception to make my opinions known. We were allocated a different room at no extra cost, and the new room was much better - no smell, a good amount of space and a view of broadway (the first room had a view of the back of another building). The first room we had was 720, but going by the room numbers on a couple of other floors I suspect any of the rooms ending 20 will have the same size problem - they're right next to the main lifts. I would have rated Ameritania as Terrible, but the second room was good enough to win them a point back. Also, the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon reading reviews about this hotel, after booking 4 nights (13-16 Oct 04) on my very first trip to NY, I was very worried. But to my relief it was fine, our room was on the 3rd floor (302) overlooking Broadway and wasn't very noisey, the room and lobbys are a bit dark but are not dirty or dingy, our room was cleaned every day (cleaning staff were very nice) and the beds are very comfortable, didn't use desk staff much but were helpful if I needed them. The rooms are basic and I think would benefit with tea/coffee facilaties but with an excellent deli across the road (I would recommend their bagels and hot chocolate for breakfast), I suppose its not too much to complain about. I would stay at this hotel again as it's in walking distance to Central Park, Times Square and lots of nice places to eat. And I'm sure people are going to NY to see the city and not spend every minute in their hotel room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Keep Expections on rooms Low”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My three girlfriends and I travel to NYC every year for a "Girls' Weekend". This year we chose to travel over Columbus Day Weekend and found it very difficult to find something affordable and decent. After booking the hotel, I then read the reviews. I was very nervous and warned my friends to go in with low expectations. It was fine. There is nothing fancy about this hotel. Most of the money on renovations appears to have gone toward the bar and the lobby. We reserved two rooms and what a difference between the two. One was tiny with a great bathroom and the other was larger with a tiny bathroom. The colors make the hotel look dingy but it seemed clean. Ask for a room on the upper levels. Ours were on the second floor and while the windows were shut and the AC on, we might as well have had the windows wide open - VERY NOISY! Great location though. Walking distance to Central Park and a good mexican restaurant next door. Going in with low expectations, the rooms were fine. We weren't in NYC to stay in the hotel anyway. Also, the bar is fun. The desk staff is not so helpful but the bartender was so that was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay attention to the mean-spirited reviews.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's hard to understand the mean-spiritedness of so many of the bad reviews of this hotel. When we read the reviews (after we'd already booked) it caused us no end of worry and stress. Why would people do that? Anyway, I am pleased to offer our experience at the Ameritania Hotel. We spent seven nights there from September 21 through September 28, 2004. There were three of us. We were in Room 1012. The room was perfectly fine. We did not find it dirty, or too small, or any of the other nasty things we read by previous guests. The TV worked fine, as did the air conditioner, the phone, and the plumbing. The shower, in fact, was about the best I've found in a hotel in a long time (good water pressure). And the location couldn't be better. It was quiet, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the bagel breakfast was a wonderful touch. The biggest problem I could see is that the on-line ticket brokers are misrepresenting the hotel. We booked through Cheaptickets and there were a number of untruths about this hotel's services on their website: a gym, for one thing, and in-room coffee makers and I don't know what all else. It certainly isn't the hotel's fault if a private agency like Cheaptickets gets their facts wrong. We would gladly stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to our friends. The only thing I didn't like was being charged to make local calls. That seemed out of place in a hotel that caters to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews of this hotel and thought 'oh no." We had already purchased our package and decided to go with it and see what happened. The hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The lobby was very nice like the pictures on the web, the halls were not as shiny and new, a little dingy, but the rooms were fine. Everything was clean, the AC worked, we asked for extra towells (there were three of us) and they brought a huge bag full about five minutes later. We asked for a room with two beds and received a room with two full beds. Not a very large room, but okay. Yes, the lighting is very dim, we had to turn on all of the lamps in the room, and it was still like forty watt lighting. We tripped the breaker with multiple hair dryers, curling irons, cell phone and camera chargers . The guy came up and fixed it within minutes and apologized, saying it is an old building and to use the provided hairdryer, which was fine. The staff was pleasant and helpful, recommending restaurants and giving directions. The room was cleaned and the sheets and comforters changed each day, and our things were not disturbed. All in all a very nice hotel, GREAT location and friendly staff. No room service, but Times Square has about fifty million places to eat. Would stay there again, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the tatty room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the information on the website, the hotel looked modern and fresh. Indeed the lobby was like this, but the room was in need of refurbishment. The floor was on a slope. The paintwork was chipped and discoloured. The lighting did not work propery and there was a lot of trffic noise, even from the sixth floor. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with the Canadians!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm in full agreement with the Canadian couple - lower your expectations! We stayed at the Ameritania Aug 14th-19th 2004. It isn't the best place in the world, nor the best place in NYC, in fact its probably not even the best place on West 54th Street, but for the price and the fact that all you need in NYC is a place to sleep & shower as there is too much to do AND you get bagels thrown in, its not that bad at all. If all you require is the basics then this place is fine, if you're going to smell the carpet, check the curtains for moisture & the sheets for static then pay a little more & stay at the Hilton round the corner...

Reviews.Title: “Served us nicely!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews we had been reading we didn't know what to expect so we may have lowered our expectations anticipating the worst... What we got was far from it. Yes, the rooms were small but ours was clean. The decor is dark and dated but the air conditioner and T.V worked fine and the front desk and service staff were polite and helpful. We were only looking for a place to hang our hats and soak our feet, not entertain or schmooze with the high life so for the money it served it's purpose. It's not the Ritz and shouldn't be compared to a high-end hotel. Location was our reason for staying here and being only blocks from Central Park, Times Square, Broadway shows etc. it satisfied nicely. If you want fine dining and polished brass don't stay here but if you have experienced 3 star resorts in Cuba or The Dominican or a good hostel in Europe or Canada, the rooms here are very similar. We tripped the breaker when we used the hair dryer with all the lights and T.V. on. (Just like in the Caribbean). The New York bagels for breakfast were great! It's an older building so just lower your expectations a little, stop complaining and enjoy NYC. Life is too short. Sandy and Dan Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “please don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel though expedia and it was a disaster. This place is a hole. It is a 7 by 9 room with a full size bed. (they advertise a queen size bed). The TV gets 10 stations and all of them have static running though them. The air conditioner does not work (and they do not know how to fix it) so the temp. in the room is about 80 degrees all the time. The hotel lets you know that they know the air does not work by the fact that the bed has no blanket or comforter just 3 sets of sheets. And if you like to stay in a hotel that give you good service like clean towels and a phone to make local calls don't stay here. We had to call every time we needed clean towels and wash clothes and half the time they did not bring both. The phone was not working for 2 out of the 4 days we stayed there. And the bathroom is so small you cannot turn around in it. Before you think of staying here I suggest that you go to your local jail and check out the cells because I am sure they are more roomy and comfortable than this hotel. I mean at lest prisoners get air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Called about the toilet backing up on three separate occasions on the same day then maintenance guy said it's not problem, I could survive till the next day (This is with a 6 year old child). Called reception and changed my room. The new room's showerhead was broken. Good reception/desk staff though - shame about their maintenance staff. Not worth their price, you can get a much better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: daleman
Reviews.Content: Having read the poor reviews on this site, after I'd already booked 3 nights, I expected the worst. OK the decor is depressingly dark - everthing in shades of brown, and light bulbs seemingly 40 watts max. However the hotel is well positoned, our room was adequate and clean, breakfast was OK and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. At the price we paid we were satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the location They seemed to have spent all the allocated remodeling budget on the lobby because the rooms need serious improvement. I was fooled by the photos on the internet. We stayed in a room with a king size bed. It was TINY! I mean all that they could fit is the BED. The bathroom is even smaller if you can believe it and our shower door was only HALF a door so we also had a flood in that small space. Lastly, I thought that the staff was unpleasant. For the price that they are asking I would recommend that you continue searching, this hotel is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Tatty”
Reviews.Author: SJ1975
Reviews.Content: Expedia promised an "Ultra-modern hideaway just off Broadway" with "Jazzy decor" "Decked out in coffee, cream, and crimson, the 212 guestrooms have a creative, modern look, with tall leather headboards, checkerboard floors, and abstract art. " The hotel was probably last decorated about 20 years ago - the rooms were dark and dingy with single glazed windows so the traffic on Broadway kept me awake all night (and you could not see out of them due to the layers of grime built up over the years). The aircon was non-existant so the heat in the 90's was unbearable. My friend was greeted by 6 flies buzzing around her room and when she called reception to complain they sent up a man with a tea towel to flick them to death. Yes the location is very convenient but i'm sure you could find a much better hotel in the price range and area. Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere except here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thing we encountered were useless doormen in front of the building. Not only did they NOT carry our bags, they simply pointed in the direction of the front desk in stead of showing us into the building. We had to interupt their conversation in order to get that little bit of information. The lobby was the best thing about the hotel. After an easy check-in we went to the linen closet they called a hotel room. Be careful when opening the door, if you open the door all the way you will hit the bed! The entire hotel is dim night or day you don't get any sun light and the lights are always kept low. I suspect its so that you won't notice the dirty bed linens, bare carpet, or peeling wall paper. Complain and you will get a slightly larger room but DO NOT take your clothes out of your suitcase. If you think you saw something crawling....trust me...you did!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dirty, Dingy and Drab”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel full of great expectations. The staff on reception were quite pleasant, but it was very dark. We then went to our room, the carpet was very dirty, the view was non existent, just the back of another building and we were on the 12th floor. It was very dark and the whole hotel had a funny smell, it may have been air fresheners. The only good thing I think about this hotel is its situation being virtually on Broadway. I certainly wouldn't recommend it to anyone. My husband and I were very disappointed, in fact when we arrived we asked if we could change our room and then showed us another on the 9th floor, which didn't even have a wardrobe, just a rail hanging in a corner and the bathroom tiles were filty, the glass tray nearly falling off, so we decided to stay in the first room and I sat on the bed and cried. I was so disillusioned. In various web sites, it maintains there is a restaurant or restaurants and there wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: carolemc14
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff. Room was nothing special, It was clean but reasonably small. I've stayed in better hotels that Virgin offer but this was fine for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple times. The first two were nothing special. Not awful, not great. But, it was always cheap and great location. On my third trip there I had some portable speakers broken, and a shopping bag full of personal documents and new sunglasses disappeared from my room. I was given the run around by quite a few very rude members of staff. Never able to speak to the hotel manager until after my stay was over. I had to file a police report. When I check out the amount for my speakers was deducted from my bill. When I got home I played phone tag with Mark Wellins, the hotel manager. Once we finally spoke, I explained, he apologized and offered me a 2 night voucher. To this day I've never received it and he dosen't return my calls!

Reviews.Title: “musty nasty smell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for around $140 a night, when my Mother came to town to visit. I thought, perfect location, we can walk around and see a lot....the lobby was nice.....check in was so so.....a little attitudy if you ask me......and then it hit us. A funk like no other. What is that?? armpit, cabbie smell.....we got into the room, and they didn't look too bad, except....WORST bed to sleep on....the pillow was like someone just threw bits of foam into a pillow case, there was no shape to it whatsoever...and my mother was compelled to clean the AC filter, in the hopes that would help. It did not. I was so grossed out using the shower, and we ended up buying deodorizor for the room. What a stink hole. WHAT DO YOU PEOPLE DO THERE?

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For $350 a night we got a second floor room overlooking Broadway. Rooms was tiny ... Window seals were garbage - just as noisy with windows open ... May as well have been sleeping on the side walk outside Worst value ever :-(

HotelInfo.Name: Ameritania Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 230 West 54th Street, New York City, NY 10019
